text: bottle from lcbo. Nutty aroma, caramelized sugars and piney/evergreen hop notes with a boozy background. clear golden with small short lasting head, nice lacing. sweet malt up front with evergreen and bitter finish. medium mouthfeel. overall a little boozy, not bad but not something i would pick up again.

Bottle pours clear deep golden, with small white head. Aroma real hoppy, fruity and grassy, nice. Taste with clear bitterness and light sweetness.. Rather soft carbonation, but full body. Nice IPA, wouldnt have noticed the 8 ABV.

Bottle. It pours mostly clear golden with a creamy white head. The aroma is biscuit malty and sweet fruity hoppy. Some marmalade notes. The flavor is sweet malty with sweet fruity hoppy notes. Biscuit, resin and crackers notes.

From a 355 ml bottle poured in to a Snifter. Slightly hazy golden colour with a creamy off- white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, pines, caramel malts, honey, sugars, resin and toasted notes. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with resin, rich malts and caramel malts. A classical American IIPA.
Lemon and honey aroma in a golden pour. Hop forward balance with big sweet citrus body and sustained bitter finish. A big beer that goes down way too easy.
Flaske 355ml fra Systembolaget Sth Vasagatan. Gylden. Høyt luftig skum som daler sakte. Pen lacing. Aroma av søt frukt. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken mango & fersken. Grei men ikke great.
Bottle. Golden pour. Aroma of bitter resinous hop, caramel, citrus and malt. Taste has citrus, resinous hop, chewy orange zest, caramel, peach and a bitter hoppy finish. This is quite nice.

Excuse me, how rude! Lagunitas does not suck, but its cute that theyre so self-deprecating and can still make bomb ass beers. Indeed, this beer is another example of their lovely, hoppy, fresh selection. Pours amber and smells wheaty, with a big smell and taste of bitter hops. Good for a rainy Memorial Day indoors re-watching Twin Peaks, being flatulent, and making naan pizzas with your beloved.

dut. frisk lime sødlig svag appelsin 
smag frisk appelsin citrus malt kant malt sødme
Pours clear golden with a medium white head which lingers. Aroma is honey and syrup. Taste is peach sweet, mango sweet, honey sweet, slight pine bitter.

As determined at the brewery in a tasting of all of the more common Lagunitas beers, I kept
coming back to this one. Yum. It is sweet beer goodness with a dumb name.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,3 litre Bottle ordered from systembolaget, at home. Light Golden, hoppy aroma. Nice ale!!

Bottle. Light yellow,clear with quite big, white, solid head and good lacing. Strong and solid hoppy and citrus aromas with some malty tones and little bit of resins. Medium body with slightly sticky mouthfeel, heavy and long bitterness with some light spicy alcohol feeling. In taste grapefruit and passion fruit flavors, also some mineral notes. Surprisingly drinkable, very good!
Bottle 33cl. Small white layer leaving. Peach color, quite hazy. Aroma rose hips, fruits, strawberry leaves. Taste is sweet, but balanced.

Bottled 0,335L. Dark orange dirty color, clear blwn with foamy head of long duration. Intence alcoholic and soft roast cereals aroma. Bitterish and strong mouth, solid body with sometingh swwetish on the final.

33cl bottle at Foodhallen, Amsterdam on 23-Apr-2017. Clear orange amber colour with a small white head which dissipates quickly. Aroma of tropical fruit, citrus and floral hops. Medium body and carbonation. Taste is sweet fruit, medium bitterness and hops. Mango, pineapple, grapefruit, caramel and malt. Decent.
Bottle from Liquor Barn into a pint glass. Aroma has some spice from the rye and barley and pine hops.

Bottle @ Fox and hounds, Aabenraa. Unclear amber body with a nice off-white head. Aroma has malt, bread, citric fruit and pine. Flavor is sweet malt, hint of toast, citric fruit, some ripe fruit, pine and balanced bitterness. Medium body and pleasant aftertaste. Quite refreshing and tasty, nice one.

Aroma: Fruity hops and caramel. 
Flavour: Caramel sweetness and fruity bitter hops. A somewhat creamy mouthfeel and a dry bitter finish. 
Colour: Amber with a white head.

355ml bottle. Pours a mildly hazy golden hue with an off-white head. Smells delicious. Resinous notes, caramel, honey, grapefruit, fresh pineapple, faint vanilla, and a very pleasant floral scent. Basically., hop candy. Taste wise, sweet with resinous notes, grapefruit, passion fruit, papaya, some mineral notes, with some light alcohol burn that heads into sweet tropical fruit, caramel, mineral notes, and some citrus pith bitterness. This is solid stuff. Pretty much liquid IPA candy.
aroma of light pine, citrus, and malt. gold and clear in color with decent head. taste is hop forward of pine, resin, light citrus, with underlying light caramel malt notes.
Nice floral aroma, medium amber color. Very tasty for a one-off. March madness 2017.

This is a truly nice beer. The aroma is pleasant with plenty of citrus. The body of the beer is plenty to support the hop. Quite a nice balance. Just a little less malt than a 90 minute and less hop bite but the beer stays in balance and is a joy to drink. Ill have six, please. Thank you.

From bottle. Pours a beautiful clear golden orange. A pretty beer. Small quickly dissipating head. A nose full of piney hops and some citrus, mango, pineapple, incredible on the nose. A forward sweet attack on the palate with some malt and great balance. Holy crap this beer, for some reason, hits on most cylinders for me. Why have I passed this up before? This is my first taste. It is bitter and full and complete, but for those who like a bit less bitterness you might look elsewhere. Impression: nothing is over the top but its all done well.

Offrande dorée limpide, semi pétillante et au parfum de houblons fruités qui dominent. Une bouche qui rappelle, tant de par lalcool ressenti que les sucres résiduels et la force des houblons, à une IPA 1.5. Agréable et bien équilibrée, elle semble cependant ne saccrocher à aucun style, tout en étant dune originalité toute relative. Pour ce qui est de la satisfaction du buveur, on en redemande, par contre on doit avouer quelle rappelle vraiment un brassin un peu fourre-tout.
From bottle, hazy orange amber colour with a white head. Nose of caramel malts, sugar, light citrus and grapefruit, earth fruits, prunes, crisp sweet malts, toffee. Sweet taste, light heat of rye.

355ml bottle at Gullkorn, Hamar. Remaining white head, spotty lacing, hazy orange coloured body. Inviting mid-sweet citrus aromas. Well blended taste of berry fruits, grapefruit and red orange. Bittersweet and warming finish. Fine bodied. Enjoying in friendly company at the pub (03.03.2017).
12oz bottle from Thirsty Beer Store. Orange amber, good head. Boiled sweet citrusy aroma. Oaty barley surgery flavour. Sharp bitter sweet aftertaste. Good example of this style of beer.

Bottled (backlog). Deep slightly hazy orange colour with a mediumsized creamy white head. Aroma is bready malts, some slight ripe fruits, brown sugar, some grassy notes. Flavour is sweet malts, brown sugar, some ripe fruits, grassy and floral notes with a mild bitterness in the finish.
Big beer. Aromas were malty but with slight confusion. Its kind of all over the place. Hop bill was good with a nice finish. Full bodied and somewhat weighty.

Pours a clean golden colour with a little orange hue. Nice head, almost creamy, long lasting with good lacing. Smells like an Imperial IPA with the grassy hops, caramel malts and citrus notes. The mouthfeel is pretty nice and smooth, with the alcohol well-hidden. Milder taste of citrus fruits with the hops rounding things in the finish. A very smooth finish. Goes down too well.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Colore dorato. Schiuma bianca, fine, cremosa e persistente. All?olfatto profumi di agrumi e frutti tropicali. Al palato corpo medio, come già manifestatosi all?olfatto, ritorna la frutta tropicale. Il finale rimane amaro ed erbaceo. Anche se 8 gradi l?alcol è ben camuffato ed è molto beverina. Un?ottima birra, sicuramente buona per carne alla brace.

This is what I would call a light IPA. Though its not an IPA it gives you the crispy fruity hops and just the right amount malt . This beer is golden with a soft bitter citrusy after taste. This beer is dangerous as at 8% ABV it will creep up on you. A soft pine earthy aroma with a light yet fluffy head ,that gives it a nice smooth fizz. 
On a scale of 1 to 10 this beer is a solid 9.5 so far the best beer Ive had in 2016

bottle deep golden clear medium head malty note balanced with citrus hoppy note but not too aromatic
oro carico limpida schiuma mediadiscreta persistenza buona maltatate bilanciata da un buon amaro ma non molto aromatico leggero agrumato arancia

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass at Taco Mac in Atlanta. The appearance is a clear bright orange color with a medium sized white head. The aroma is hop driven. The taste is hops and tropical fruit. An outstanding beer.
Bottle 0,33. Pours hazy orange. Malts, cereal, hops, fruits, barley, nice mouth feel. Medium body and carbonation.
Tap at de Beurs Meppel. Served in a jar. Clear yellow colour with a small dense head. Aroma has citrus grapefruit and a slight sweetness. Decent ale like an ipa.

6er from the BO. Clear orange pour, medium white head. Aroma is sweet, quite malty, toasted cereals, brown sugar, with light fruit and grasses. Nice mouth feel, good carb. Medium bitter finish, light notes of pine and light fruit. Maltiness fades and it gets hoppier at the end. Interesting brew.

6-pack from LCBO. Beautiful deep orange pour with a lush cap of creamy foam on top. Grains are deeply present & add a nice complexity to this. Lots of sugar. Pronounced dry hops. Good stuff, if not a tad over rated in these parts.

Bought this as a single at the neighborhood supermarket. I held off trying because of the name. Typical Lagunitas, messing with me. I poured into a pint bar glass finding a dark yellow presentation with a pearlescent white foam. The scent is tricky but interesting. I detect pine and then something else, a sweet smell? The taste is really fine, I would call it hoppy but that cannot be right. Grainy but in a good way and also toffee with tropical fruit. Light on the bitterness and dry at the end. Guess I will have to buy a sixer before it is gone.
Poured from 12oz bottle golden with a medium white head. Strong citrus aroma medium carbonation, easy to drink, citrus and a medium bitter finish a well balanced brew.

Bottle at DØE US tasting. Clear light yellow with a white head. Aroma medium hoppy, light spicy, medium malty (barley, rye, wheat, oat). Flavor medium sweet, medium+ bitter (piney), spicy, long lasting. Medium+ body.

Keg Half Pint at White Horse American Beer Festival 2016, Parsons Green, London in July 2016 - Hazy Gold in colour. Excellent foamy off-white head. Good lacing. Very Malty; grainy malts, toasty, spicy, toffee. Very Fruity; sweet tropical fruits and citrus. Hoppy; piney resinous hops. Sweet-bitter malty fruity with bitter hoppy finish. Enjoyed this. Lovely American Strong! (2016-07-02)

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2017 Dorata e limpida, schiuma biancastra compatta. Aroma abbastanza fresco, note erbacee, agrumi. Al palato non è male, con una buon equilibrio tra amaro e base maltata e alcol che sostiene bene. Sempre note di agrumi e una luppolatura giusta. Carbonazione media. Corpo medio.

12 oz bottle. Pours a clear amber with moderate head. Aromas of pine, toffee, dull grapefruit, resin and sweet malts. Flavors of pine and resin, bready toasted malts, and bitter citrus. Bitter finish. Good West Coast IPA.

Strong citrus notes, tropical mix, a bit earthy, deep golden with a good white head quite persistant, medium body, medium carbonation, easy to drink, citrus and a strong bitter final...a good and strong ipa.

Backlog: Bottle at Unibar. Pale golden with huge frothy white head. Aroma is fresh, floral and fruits. Taste is fruity with sweet wheats and rye. The beer has a very good mouthfeel, lively carbonation and good fitting texture. 

Fresh!

Bottle at home. Clear orange gold, cream head. Rich red orange juice, pink grapefruit, sweet malts, caramel, cream. Carbonated, pine needles, resin, fresh orange and grapefruit juice, creamy, honey notes.

Brown Shugga Substitute Ale on the label. Pours a fairly big frothy off-white head and has a pale golden appearance. Lively carbonation. Some nice dirty lacing. Aromas of earthy and floral hops. Flavours are mostly on the hoppy side of things, oranges, resin, pineapple but also some notes of brown sugar which forms the sweeter side with hints of caramel. Well balanced between sweetness and bitterness though. Medium bodied mouthfeel. Very good.

The aroma is sweet maybe of cherry. The appearance is a honey gold with a medium white head. The taste is a little bitter but very nice the way it should be. Easy to drink and overall I liked it quite a bit.

Nice hoops and dark Carmel flavors. Sweet. Nice beer with good aroma. Lasting head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A resin and floral hops aroma with notes of citrus and caramel. Pours a clear golden color with a short lasting white head with nice lacing. Tastes of resin and lemon with a hint of caramel, medium body with a transient bitter hop finish.

12oz bottle, honey gold color, with a frothy white head, very nice candied lemon, grapefruit peel, lemon marmalade nose, with some good floral citrus, leafy hoppy, faint lemon candyish lollipop, lemon pie crust accents, and a honeyed pale, toasted, wheat, oat malty, subtle mint leaf note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth good sweet candied lemon, grapefruit, lime rind, lemon marmalade, flowery citrus, leafy, grassy, minty hoppy character, with some honeyed wheat, toasted, pale, oat malty, lemon lollipop, subtle lemon tea leaf, mint leaf flavours, leading towards a warming zesty candied lemon rind, sweet wheat, pale, toasted maltiness, lingering herbal citrus, leafy, minty hop bitterness finish.

Lagunitas self-ironic multi-grain ale, at In De Wildeman in Amsterdam. Off-white, thick and creamy, papery lacing head over a hazy, lightly peachy orange blonde beer. Aroma of lime peel, pomelo, green banana, unripe mango, gin, green peppercorns, bread crust, biscuit, guava, tonic water, cereals. Clean fruitiness in the mouth but rich in mango, green banana and even slight apple, strongish minerally carbonation, numbing a bit the smooth, full, biscuity and cereally maltiness, well-rounded with only subtle hints of velvety oats, soapy wheat and spicy rye - in fact overpowered by the wealth of aromatic, DIPA-like hoppiness, grapefruit peel- and green pepper-like, providing a long, drying bitterness; some warming alcohol in the very end. Nice beer in all, classically Californian Id say, but if you put four grains into your beer, they should be able to speak for themselves a bit more explicitly, and not be covered in an IPA hoppiness, no matter how attractive the latter is to all those geeks out there. But a nice beer, that is certain.

Bottle @ home. Giallo ambrato, limpido, schiuma bianca, non molto fine ma persistente. Aroma intenso, durevole e complesso. Fruttato, frutta esotica, lytchee, resinoso, piney, maltato, cereali (avverto anche del frumento). Ingresso dolce abboccato, quasi amabile, malato, fruttato, liquoroso, poi un pungente ed intenso amaro avvia al finale pulito, secco. Corposa, molto molto molto calda, non nasconde nulla del suo alcoolico. spigolosa. oleosa. Equilibrata ed armonica

12oz bottle. Clear bright golden, effervescent bubbles and a thick frothy off-white head. Flavors are sweet cereals, caramel, pine resin, grapefruit and apricot marmalade with herbal, sugary and peppery notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.
Lite oklar, lätt rödtonad med tunt vitt skum. Doftar lite malt, tallbar och citrus. Smaken medelfyllig, maltig och lite söt. Eftersmaken tämligen kort, med liten beska.

Aroma of cumin and old taxi seats. Clear, sherry like mouthfeel probably old or mistreated bottle from store. Hops were stale and hurt the overall flavor of the brew. Ill try it at brewery and re rate.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pale with good white head. Nose of pine, resin, fruit. Sweet, resiny with a bit of zest, surprisingly hoppy. Some rye flavour but unable to detect the oats and wheat. Medium body, some fizz, slightly sticky. A nice, hoppy finish.
UPDATED: DEC 24, 2016 33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours hazy golden with little head. Fruity aroma with sweet citrus and hoppy grape taste.

Many tastes - first rate - pretty plain looking gold body - nice off-white head. Nose is hop forward - citrusy and piney - go blind on this and you think youre gonna have a nice IPA on your hands. Some biscuity malt character in the background - nice on the nose. Flavor is quite tasty as well, and always comes through hoppier than I anticipate. Good dose of roasty, toasty malt, general caramel sweetness - good! Palate is medium bodied...lively carbonation. As is always the case with a Lagunitas pour, I feel like the value is incredible - this stuff is great for $9 for a sixer!

Bottle from the LCBO. Clear medium amber under a small short lived white head that leaves sparse lace. Nose is pine resin, some light toffee, citrus peel and a touch of spice. Light toffee sweetness under a big pine and citrus bitterness. Mouth is medium- and chewy with a lingering bitter finish. 

8/3/8-/3+/15-

(355 ml bottle, Beijing) 
AROMA: very hoppy nose, grapefruit, floral, 

APPEARANCE: medium golden, clear, good visible carbonation with tiny bubbles, soft fluffy white head that lingers a while leaving significant residue and tracing.

TASTE: first flavors are bitter and hops, then some malty sweetness, green, pine, citrus peel, some fruit and raisin. Dont really taste/notice the 8% ABV.

PALATE: soft and oily on the palate, dry finish, good balance.

OVERALL: Delicious. Very nicely hopped beer, with bitterness and hops not going too far overboard. Well-rounded and well-balanced. Sad I only had one in the fridge to drink.

Bottle 2016. Light copper pour with a frothy cream-colored head. Fresh, dry-hopped goodness on the nose with some baked toffee cookies in there too. This one is a flavor bomb, with sweet cereals and citrus hops up front, followed by fig preserves and rum raisins, and with a lasting posterior tongue bitterness. The mouthfeel is very soft, almost fluffy. I just love this and I wish Id discovered it sooner.

Pours an unassuming clear pale gold, froth white head. Big, beautiful, refreshing hop aroma. Big flavor - resin hops riding the back of a succulent, slightly sweet mixed grain base. The palate is the perhaps the feature - creamy, succulent, dry and sweet. Overall, a beer that triggers an almost immediate response to have another one. The background grain base is complex while the hop forward is clean and clear. For an American Strong, hops are more present then most - no criticism, just an observation.
Bottle at home. Grapefruit aroma. Taste is sweet grapefruit, lime and lemon. Soft mouthfeel. Zesty aftertaste.

Bottled. Pours clear golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, caramel and brown sugar. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and bitter. Medium bodied oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice hoppy Ale indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

12 oz bottle from LCBO, served almost cold in a tulip glass. 
App.: Clear light amber with a so-so off-white head.
 
Aroma: Big, sweet, inky, lots of caramel and crunchy sweet malt, big pine and grapefruit, dusty, a bit peppery, Sweet Tarts fruitiness.
 
Palate: Medium+ body, fine and fairly full carbonation.
 
Flav.: Lots of sticky-sweet malt with plenty of pine/resin and grapefruit, peppery again, Sweet Tarts fruitiness; quite sweet and fairly bitter with a sweet malt and very fruity/citrus/candy-like finish.

Oh, cmon. They dont suck *that* badly.
Bottle. Pours orange with small white head. Aroma is really hoppy. Taste is really fresh and has notes of orange.

Orange yellow with a touch of haze. Frothy, tinted head and wide lacing. 
Oh yeah, this is a good one, Mouthy, huge palate, malty, some sweetness, great complexity, Finishes clean minus some bitterness left behind. Great beer from a great brewer. 
12oz single from total Wine & More, Boca Raton, Florida

Bottle 12fl.oz. @ [ The Country Stat Improver Tasting ] - Saxo, Aarhus. [ As Lagunitas Sucks ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, moderate hoppy, pine, alcohol. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration, pale malt, sweet malt, pine, alcohol. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161008]
 7-3-7-3-14
Tap at Tapzuid, Amsterdam: Clear amber colored brew with an sweet bitter taste, hints of caramel, tropical fruits, spices and pine. Clearly on of the best from the Heineken portfolio.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 Bottle poured into a globe glass. A clear amber color with a sudsy white head that leaves spotty lacing. Aroma SMACKS you in the face with pine, floral hops, a hint of malt. Initial taste is pine, floral hops, a hint of lemon, pepper, and caramel malt. Pine hops, toasted malt, and rye on a dry and pleasantly bitter and balanced aftertaste. Body is fairly full and very smooth. Damn good stuff! Very Imperial IPAish but not a hop bomb.

Draft 0.25l at Tap Zuid Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 22.09.2016. Taste with Vlada Ciaone. Still remember our first tasting in Belgrade when luttonm brought this one. Now its finally time to put the ratings. Pour it clear golden color with small white head. Aroma sweet pine, some pickels and peppery. Taste smooth, sweet orange juice, pine, nice pleasent, tangerine candy, fresh bitterness at the end, medium body, creamy, slick feel, lively, long finish. Nice!
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a light amber colour beer with a small head. Fruity and hoppy with some caramel and pine. Dry finish.

Straight out of a bottle. Aroma semisweetness of biscuits and some pine. Flavor is on point. Sweet cherry, grapefruit, orange candies, medium bitterness. Smooth finish with a kiss of malt. 8%. Damn i could session this stuff into a coma.
Decent, Imperial IPA-ish, without massive hops, leaving a very solid malty backbone, sweetness and a chaser of hoppiness.

Hosszú kihagyás után az első sör, amit elfogyasztok, s még hosszabb idő telt el az utolsó IPA kóstolása óta. Mondom ezt annak ellenére, hogy a besorolás szerint american strong ale rejlik a palackban, ennek azonban szinte minden porcikája ellentmondani látszik, elég, ha a kitöltést követően vetünk rá egy pillantást. Aranyló szín, áttetsző test, ragacsos habkéreg; porcukorral hintett vadvirág-lekvár, citromos töltelékes keksz, trópusi gyümölcshangulatok keveréke; marmaládé, grapefruit, narancshéj-olaj csípősen telt szerkezete. Nem az a tipikus american strong ale jellemrajz. Szúrós szemű szénsavbuborékokkal alaposan megtűzdelt teste éles, hirtelen és intenzív jegyek sokasága, ami komlótól farnehéz, s amely frissességet sugárzó kesernye hordozója.

Bottle. Pours a dark golden color with a fair head and good lacing. Aroma of caramel, malt and citrus. Taste of citrus, caramel, malt and light fruit. Mild bitterness and a fairly dry finish. Moderate body, smooth with a bit of a malty feel. Enjoyable beer.

Amsterdam Pubcrawl 2016, @Tap Zuid, van tap. donker gouden met witte kraag. aroma van gras, floraal en stro. Smaken van gras, hooi/stro, matig tot redelijk bitter, grassig, zacht, dun, zwakke body, ok co2.

On tap at Tap Zuid. Clear golden amber colour, white head. Aroma of resin, some pine, caramel, spicy rye, tropical fruits, sticky and hoppy. Flavour is hoppy, resin, tropical fruits, caramel, light spice, bitter finish, some pine. Medium bodied. Nice.
Sampled at Tap Zuid, Amsterdam. Clear golden color, average sized white head. Aroma and flavor is malts, hops, resin, pine, bitter. Medium to full body and medium carbonation. Lovely.
Tap at Tap Zuid during pubcrawl. Clear golden with white head. Sweet malts, barley, resin, exotic fruitiness. Medium sweet and bitter. Medium body, quite alcoholic, low carbonation. Yeasty finish.
Tap at Tap Zuid. Clear golden with fluffy white head. Fruity hops, some resin, mango, pineapple and lime, sweet malts, light mineral and doughy. Medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied.
Bottle at Aarhus tasting. Pours pale gold with a lasting white head. Aroma is fruity, hop, caramel. Finish is bittersweet.

Bottle @ Johns. Pours golden with an offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruity hops, citrus, grapefruit, light alcohol. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, malty, caramel, fruity hops, citrus, grapefruit, alcohol. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish with warming alcohol. 081016
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, fruits, pine, malt and has a nice hoppy finish.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear golden with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 081016
Keg @ Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Pours amber. Nose is toffee, pineapple, grapefruit, big resin. Taste is pine, mango, slight floral, grapefruit.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass. Appearance is slightly hazy golden orange with no sparkle, finger-width white foamy head with poor retention and nice sudsy lacing. Aroma is strong pine, citrus, rye, wheat, resin, mild tropical fruit, and malt backbone in background. Taste is bitter resin, citrus and pine with rye and wheat in the middle and late mild tropical fruit balance. Palate is medium bodied with smooth texture, average-to-lively carbonation and mix of bitter resin and mild sweet tropical fruit finish. Overall, a good amount of complexity here. Nice.

Bottle at Fiddler. Clear golden orange with an off white head. Aroma of orange, grapefruit, pine notes, light spicy hops and light caramel malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. [22-08-2016]

Bottle shared at In de Wildeman. Clear golden with a medium white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Good bitterness with nice fruity sweetness. Caramel, pine, malts, grass, fruits and yeast. Very nice.

12 fl.oz bottle. Klares hell orange goldenes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Pfirsich, Aprikosen, grapefruit, harzig bitter. Geschmack sehr hopfig bitter, intensiv fruchtig, Aprikosen, Pfirsich, lecker!

Bottle at De Paas, Den Haag. Poured a clear medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is big grassy hop, citrus, pine needle. The flavour is moderate bitter with a crisp, fresh grass, nettle hop, fruit, yeast palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

35.5cl bottle from the Paas. 
Thin white head. Clear golden pour. Lovely bitterness. Nicely done.

Brown American bottle. Pours medium pale yellow with no head. Scent is pale ale and a bit peppery. Taste is medium pale ale and noticeable brown sugar. Finish is a bit peppery and dry. Very good. Surprising.

Kinda IPA for my liking and if so a smart elegant one given the 8% ABV. Having this one late in the day but far out its easy going. And very pleasant of course. Funky barnyard sweetness, medium strength hops make for a super easy drink.

On tap at The Amsterdam Beerfair 2016.
Nose is citric. 
Body is clear pale golden, head is big, white, creamy, average lasting, excellent lacing. 
Aroma is wood, tea, leaves, spices. 
Medium sweet, light bitter. 
Finish is medium lasting hoppy medium bittersweet. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Easy, refreshing, nice one.
Van de tap bij homeland tab. Heerlijk fruitige dipa met aroma van bloedsinaasappel re n perzik mooi vol bittere afdronk

Aroma: hoppy, red apples, esters, weak citrus notes.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: medium citrus bitterness, esters, red apples, weak citrus notes, nice malty backbone, semi-dry/semi-sweet.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Surprising beer, really balanced and drinkable, nicely balanced.

decent 1" white head... little lacing or cap.. the brew is clear golden/lite orange...

Nose is a tropical fruit bowl.. mango, melon and citrus.. pale malt sweetness moves the hops front and forward.

Okay bitterness up front.. musky fruity hops.. deep melon and mango... tangerine... papaya? sorta dries out toward the finish but still the fruit carries on forever... sorta musky melon with warmth... dank and dirty.. just sooo fruity.. wow.
Clear golden appearance. Aroma and flavour have floral hop and fresh tropical fruit. Refreshing and not overly bitter.
Golden colour with white head. Fruity aroma. Taste is fruity and crisp. Pineapple and citrus.
Bottle.Hazy orange flavor with medium white head.Aroma is fruity of pineapples and pine and grass,nice well balanced and crispy with some mild toasted nots,fresh hoppy finish and easy to drink.

Bottle, 8%Slightly hazy amber/orange with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, earthy, grapefruit and pine. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, medium sweet, grapefruit, bitter, little earthy, caramel, fruit peel and orange.

I love the story behind Sucks and what inspired its name. Poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass produced a 1 finger head that is creamy white and lightly carbonated. Looks like liquid gold in the glass. The aroma is delectable with juicy pineapple and oranges with fresh cut pine in the background. A mosaic of lacing left on the glass. The flavors burst with ripe pineapple and biting citrus with a balancing act of honey sweet cereal; almost like Cheerios.

Draught @ Falstaff, Maastricht. Clear golden, big foamy white head. Rich hoppy resin and spruce, some citrus, grainy and sweet malts, medium but crisp bitter. Very well balanced. Firm body, medium carbonation.

Bottle at home. Aroma is resinous hops, chewy malt, big pine resin, ripe tropical fruits, stone fruits, peach, apricot, caramel. Flavour is moderate sweet and above medium bitter. Body is medium. Smooth and quite resinous with a bittersweet flavour, nice one.

Bottle @ de Paas. Pours a clear golden beer with a nice white head on top. Aroma of resins, peaches, grapefruit. Flavor is light bitter, firm, a big malty base, sweet grainy notes and a nice long bittersweet finish. Softly carbonated, hints of cookies in the finish as well. Very decent.
Clear golden with a moderately sized head. Aroma of funky pineapples. Taste is saccharine and spicy. Excessively carbonated.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy wonderfull aroma. Heavy bitter fantastic flavor. Creamy palate.
Draft: Poured a golden color with a white head. Aroma is hops and light metal. Taste was a harsh in your face hops mixed with metallic and malts.

Definitely smelling a fresh cut grapefruit with some bits of caramelized sugar. Dark golden color with a modest off-white head. First sip is loaded with hops. Pine, citrus, grass, spice its all there front and center. Rather dry, but there some hints of caramel and lightly toasted malt. Certainly a hop bomb, so bombs away! 11/11

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2016 Golden with a very slight haze, small frothy white head, spotty lace. Deep aroma of caramel malts and resiny hops...a welcoming sweetness. Very refreshing yet big and balanced taste. Fruits and caramel throughout, some apple, orange, white grape peel, some spice yields to a lasting bittersweet finish. Boozy as it warms.
35cl bottle at De Paas. Clear pale orange with no head. Pine resin, caramel, grapefruit, citrus hops and subtle tropical fruit. Medium body, low to zero carbonation and a bitter-sweet aftertaste.
Tap at Flying Saucer, 14th July 16. Pours golden, Aroma is pleasant, Taste is sweet, but bitter, grapefruit, citrus, pine. Not bad

Golden beer. A lot of malt aromas, caramel and hay. Grass and herbal hops. Taste is sweet in the begining- bread, caramel, fruits. Then a hop dominated finish, spicy and herbal that leads to a bitter finish.

Draught at Taphouse. Low fluffy and quickly disappearing white head. Clear yelolow golden body. Sour apples lemon aroma. Dry fruity hoppy flavor. Low carbonation. Long dry and bitter finish. Alcohol well hidden by the bitterness.

The first experience is the best. By no means is this a bad beer, in fact it is very good. It just feels like a let down as the best attribute is the aroma. It sets up a tropical fruit, new Zealand ish, ipa that it just doesnt live up too. That being said is is a very smooth, easy drinking fruity (but balanced) beer.

Pours nice clear golden, bit edging on amber. Beautiful creamy white foam, not too much of it but it is leaving some excellent lacings. Sweet and crisply hop-caramelly aroma, some fruits also there. Taste is full, you can feel the alcohol but it doesnt really bother, more like helps this beer to stand up even better. Like a barley wine in some sense, at the same time generously hopped and not so sweet and sticky, so liking this quite a lot.

12 oz bottle, clear orange pour with thick creamy egg shell head, decent lacing, smells of brown sugar, malt and dried fruit apricot and prune, medium to heavy body, syrupy, some honey, resin pine and some spice, citrus, mango and grapefruit, overall good balance although a tad sweet

(Bottle) Golden amber colour with big, frothy, off-white head, leaving traces of lacing. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of apricots, citrus (mandarin, orange peel), honey, lychee and fresh floral, citric hops. Fruity, hoppy taste with apricots, grapefruit, mandarin, honey, tropical fruit and lots of fresh citric, floral hops in a finish with a generous bitterness. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Tasty and well made, with a fresh, generous hop character. Very nice.
Orange pour, thin white head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Sweet flavor, pretty spicy. Peppery finish. Lingering sweetness. Kind of a weird beer. Not very Complex but tasty.

Bottle
Orange, white head
Aroma of mandarin almondy 
Taste sweet bitter, mandarin. 
Alcoholic
Pours a medium orange hue with adequate head. Excellent aromas of pine, grapefruit, and pineapple. Taste is like a hoppy, fruity melody. The malt balances perfectly. Hard to beat when fresh.

8%ABV.

Poured out cloudy amber. 12ºSRM.

Nose has sweet ripe citrus, with oranges coming to mind rights away with maybe kumquats. There are sweet malt aromas in the nose. Inviting with some nice pine freshness.

Mouthfeel is soapy and thick. Palate is full-bodied with nice toasted malty flavors of barley bread, graham cracker and honey. Hops are spicy with cilatro, parsley, with bitter and mint, I immediately get hyssop on my mind. The hops are just about right considering that the sweet malty, syrupy palate just wont go away.

Finish is still bitter and long, but with a strong plant bitter component.

Goes on Favorites List !

Alaranjada de leve turbidez, espuma branca de boa formação e média persistência. Aroma de frutas amarelas maduras, melão, abacaxi e um pouco de pêssego. Corpo médio,baixa carbonatação. Final de leve resinal, mantendo as características de frutas amarelas, leve lasca de madeira, média persistência.

From a bottle into a Boston Lager glass. Pours gold with big head and lace. Aroma of rich malts, grains, cereal. Medium carbonation and significant moughfeel. Flavors of amber malts, oats, minerals, grains, straw hops, melon rind, bitter herbs. Overall rich and flavorful with some slightly odd & rough notes.
Aroma is a sweet, spicy malt. Taste is half Belgian, half IPA - a blend of hops, malts, and spices. Overall decent.
Copper pour from bottle. Taste is dough, pine, hay, grain and a hint of booze. Well balanced and very good.

Bottle. Nice creamy white head on golden pour. Awesome citrus pine aroma. Balance of citrus, pine hop with light caramel malt is superb. Awesome beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce bottle pours a yellow copper color with a nice white creamy head. Nice lazing on the glass. A dank piney hop  aroma. Nice smooth bitterness high carbonation. Light bodied. Seem like a bit if apricot and molasses flavors. Solid drink.
Pours a nice dark hazy brownish color. Aromas of malts, and some other hints, maybe fruit, maybe caramel, and hops. Flavor is a bitter, malty, and hoppy with a nice dry finish.
I can really see the potential of this beer but the hops have died in transit to NZ.
Pours light orange clear, big white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, resin. Taste is hoppy but quite smooth, not bitter, bready almost caramel malt sweetness. Thick smooth honeyed mouthfeel.

Golden copper pour with a light pillowy head. Sweet piney aroma, a suggestion of tropical fruit. Maybe some apricot too. Aggressively hoppy, resin and some dank, balanced with plenty of malty sweetness that ends with a dry finish. Delicious.

Nice golden copper with generous puffy head. Aroma of sweet tropical fruit, hint of citrus, lightly candied sugar. Lovely mouthfeel - thick enough body to feel like it needs a bite, long lingering finish thats somewhat slick and mild bitterness. Less bright in mouth, mixed cereal malts, and mild citrus hops.

12oz bottle - Very similar to Sumpin Sumpin... had to look at the bottle.. twice! But there were small differences. Sucks poured a golden copper with a white head. Decent aroma. Grassy, citrus fruit, and over-ripened figs. Flavors of mild grapefruit, hay, and a hint of leather. Not as toasty as I thought with the barley, rye, wheat, and oats medley... but the malt was present. Enjoyable and Id definitely have another in the future.

Light copper colored beer with a white head. Strong aromas of pine forest. Tastes of bitter pine/spruce hops, some earth, hints of caramel, and sweet tropical fruit. Bittersweet finish has a nice balance of fruit and hops with caramel thrown in. Smooth beer but quite strong in the hop department. I enjoyed it.

Well balanced throughout. Pleasent piney aroma, a hop forward taste hits you right away but brings with it wonderful complex flovors of pine, malt, grass, citrus. Even flavors from start to finish. Slightly sticky but not bad at all. The most enjoyable beer Ive had from this brewery.
On tap at St. Augustines. Poirs a pale clear blonde. Aroma and Taste are hoppy (tropical fruits), malty, a bit sweet. Full-bodied. Very good.

Keg at Craft Beer Rising. A slightly hazy deep golden colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange, pine, some caramel, slight toasted malts, a little honey, some Cheerios and subtle apricot.
Taste is similar of grapefruit, orange, resin, subtle apricot, some caramel, slight toasted malts, a little honey, maybe biscuit and subtle grassy hops. Full bodied and a slightly slick texture. A bittersweet, caramel and citrus hop bitterness in the finish. Really hoppy, great citrus and resinous flavours. Its quite sweet as well though, tons of caramel and toasted malts. Strong but doesnt blow you away. I enjoyed this.

.355l bottle @Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours clear pale golden with medium white head. Leaves some lacing. Aroma is pine, exotic fruits, grape fruits, malts, caramel notes. Flavor is mostly same. Well balanced beer! Silky mouth feel?

Bottle from a trade with Cunningham. Pours clear deep golden with a huge frothy white head. Strong piney hop aroma with resin and sweet oranges. Taste is moderate thick sweet,marmelade, loaded with dry resiny hops, well balanced, lingering finish.
Solid grass aroma body is a bit hoppy with some bitterness. Finish is grassy with some malts.
Bottle. Pours an amber with an off white head and aroma of hops and pine. Taste is of hops, toasted malt, toffee, fruits, resin and pine leading into the bitter finish.

With Z, pours an amber , light brown and gold with a beige head . Nose is sweet with toffee, caramel and malt . Taste is sweet , deep caramel, malt and toffee. Finishes on the same tasting notes, sweetly with a moderately short finish . Quaff Score 6 / 10

Pours hazy blonde with a fine white head. Nose is deliciously potent west coast hops with lots of citrus and resins. Flavor is a similar burst of hops, but not to the point of over bittering the malt. finish is surprisingly dry. a great example of a West Coast IPA.

The nose is mild with some initial fruity hop and some pine needle underneath. A weirdly sweet beer. Lots of sugar mixes with a very fruity hop profile, it has apricot, orange and papaya notes. Its bitterness is pleasant.
12 oz. bottle. Pours straw with good beige head. Aroma was hops, citrus and pine resin. Taste was rye, sour fruits and alcohol.
