Medium, earthy, slightly sour aroma of sweet malts and berries on the background. Golden color with small artificial head and slightly hazy liquid. Medium/strong, slightly sour and complex taste with malts, brown sugar and hops. Some berries. Averagely balanced with wide taste spectrum and long hoppy and malty aftertaste. Medium body with low/medium carbonation. Overall, a bit weird and messy, because has features of different styles.
Clear light golden, medium foamy head. Aroma floral, honey, jasmine. Medium bodied, chewy fruit, nice moderately bitter finish. Very decent.

Aroma: caramel, floral, citrus, pine
Appearance: clear golden with a beige head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, 

Delicious

32 Fluid ounce poured to wine glass
Today is 1/23/2016
Appearance: Light amber, small head, almost no lacing
Aroma: Strong hoppy smell, slight boozy scent not overpowering
Taste: Slightly bitter, then sweet, 
Mouth feel:
Overall: Excellent beer, specially with the price. Definitely something to look forward to.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a bright amber yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is semi-sweet and bready with a hint of pine. Nice body, light and syrupy texture. Full mouth feel. Smooth semi-sweet citrus with only a slight bitterness on the roof of the mouth. Smooth finish with flavors that linger for awhile. Solid and very refreshing and enjoyable.
How : bottle Appearance : almost clear deep golden, minimal white head. Aroma : pine, citrus peel, ripe fruits, herbs, cane sugar. Palate : medium body, average to light carbonation.

Poured into a pint glass.

4.25 A: Clear light orange color. Two fingers of creamy off-white head. Retention is good and lots of lacing is left.

4.0 S: The grains mesh to make something quite pleasant - earthy spiciness from the rye, grainy barley, oaty oats, and mild neutral wheat. Seems like theres a lot of rye comparatively, you could comfortably call this a rye brew. Big orange citrusy hops, floral, and spice. Big and powerful. Pretty good.

4.0 T: Tastes like it smells. Tons of earthy spiciness, spicy hops, caramel malts. Again lots of floral and orangy hops. Mild-moderate bitterness. Again, big rye component, which I really enjoy.

3.75 M: Lighter medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Pleasantly creamy and super smooth.

4.0 D: Really nice beer. I can see why so many enjoy it.

★ 815 characters


DavoleBomb, Jun 13, 2015

Bottle at home while visiting Jacksonville. Pours gold with a white head. Sweet light honey, orange, trop fruit aroma. Medium body, medium carbonation. Some grapefruit, lemon, pine, light caramel, white bread, light soap... Its OK.

Aroma: chocolate, bread, citrus, 
Appearance: golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, 
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
Palate: medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Bottle as Lagunitas sucks holiday ale. ABV 7,7. Pours golden with small white head. Aroma is sweet and hoppy, pine, citrus, caramel, berries, rotten fruits. Taste is bitter with some sweetness, malty, hay, Medium body. Long bitter finish. Nice.

clear golden liquid with minimal white head. aroma of tropical fruits, goatweed, malts. tastes same, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle from systembolaget sweden named Lagunitas sucks holiday ale brown shugga substitute 7,7 %. Big white lasting head. Almost clear solid golden color. Big citrus hop aroma. Distinct hop taste and balanced bitterness. Small sweetness.

Orange candy. Lots of orange, mandarin, nectarine, honey, marmalade, lollipop, fairly dry finish. Definitely hides the alcohol pretty well, but quite overly sweet orange focused for me, not bad though.

Bottle 355 ml. Deep golden and white head with plenty of lacing. Aroma and taste are very sweet but the taste also has some sour notes that are not too pleasant. Plenty of hops. Not one of the great Lagunitas beers.
Guldgul. Massa tropiska frukter i doften. Mycket frukt och blommighet i smaken, fruktsötman balanseras av en bra beska; fyllig och rund. Riktigt god!
Yummie beer. Melon, peach and pineapple in the aroma. Clear golden yellow color with white head. Light sweetness and strong bitterness in the taste. Good stuff!!
Shared 12 oz. bottle. Pale gold with white head. Aroma of grapefruit and pine. Taste: hoppiness is more subtle here than in the aroma. Hops nicely balanced by the malts. Good.

Aroma: grapefruity with lots of sweetness; Appearance: hazy straw with fluffy head and some large bubbled lacing; Taste: a little disappointing after the aroma; slightly bitter without much complexity; Palate: medium body with long bitter finish; lively carbonation; Overall: okay but nothing special; might buy again.

Bottle. Light amber with a white head that settles to a cm or so. Aroma of grapefruit, lime leaf, herbal lemon, toasted grains. Pretty sweet with kumquats and herbal lemon just doing enough to keep it in check. But the sweet malts are worthwhile - a bit bready, some toast, a little chewy. Doesnt dry out all that much and the bitterness never is really more than required to partner the malt flavours.Pine comes in at the end too. Nice hops, plenty going on with the malt side of things, character and balance. Really good.
It smells much more hoppy than it is. A nice and sweet backbone. Wet finish of sugar and alcohols. It's a good representation of the right way to do a strong ale.

Rätt ljus och halvklar. Malt i doft och smaken är också malt med en trevlig beska. Balanserat och lätt att gilla

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yellow pour. Hoppy, fruity tropical backdrop, very much hops on the palate. These sly SOBs know they have a good one here. Very tasty and refreshing. Bottle @ Three Cellars, Franklin, Wisconsin.
Bottled. Pours golden with a huge white head. Smells bread malty, a bit hay, spicy. Tastes spicy hoppy, a bit herby with a bitter sweet finish.
Bottle, Clear and pale color. Fresh and hoppy on the palate. Tropical notes with some pine thrown in. A well balanced and solid beer for a last minute substitute.
A vary fresh and hoppy aroma, clear and pale ale..with a very nice white and thick foam top...a fresh and hoppy IPA taste, very refreshing.. No seasonal herbs here just good beer..

Flaska från SB. Julölsprovning med Nerikes Ölsällskap. Klar ljusorange med två fingrar högt vitt skum. Rätt anonym i doften, en aning humle. Desto mer i smaken. Tydlig sötma med kåda och granskott. En något sötare IPA, inte jättespännande och inte särskilt julig. Får väl dock sin förklaring i beskrivningen av ölen ovan...

Bottle. Grapefruit peel and sweet caramel malt aroma. Slightly hazy honey gold with a large off-white head. Grapefruit peel, caramel malt, and herbal hops flavor. Medium sticky body, moderate carbonation.
Very good quality beer with plenty of hops and nice tropical taste. Decent body and big head.

This is my kind of beer. From tap on Bishops Arms in Karlstad. Aroma really fully hopped and nice. Taste leaves only few wishes not fulfilled. Impressive citrus and nice bitterness with a looooong lasting taste. Really to recommend.

Look; off white persistent head, golden amber about clear body, thick lacing. 
Aroma; fruity resin, spruce n pine, bitter peachy malts, hoppy fruits a lot. 
Taste; resiny caramel, juicy forest of pine n spruces, bitter peaches -
leading to a well balanced fruity 
finish with the whole bowl of pine cones blended in potent resiny caramel juice. 
Palate; solid. 
Overall; a must-have for ipa-lovers, even though its an american strong ale. 
[33.5cl brown btl, 7.7%abv ibu63, BB.20.08.2016 #2, B@SystembÖLaget]

Pours golden with a beautiful white foam, beautiful. Aromas of malt, barley and other grains upfront. Tastes powerful, alcohol is well balanced and is more present than higher AVB beers. One of the better Lagunitas beers.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2016 Amazing and easy drinking for a dipa. Awesome nose of pine and tropical fruits. Taste is pine, tropical and delicious. What makes this great for me was the sweetness on the back with each sip. Super smooth and medium bitterness. One of my favorite dipas but only when fresh. When old this definitely well ... Sucks.

Smells of malty sweet breads with slight hop fruit scent. Taste starts off bitter with a bite then instantly switchs to a lovely sweet sugary bread like flavor finishes kind of malty. Light yellowish gold color. Delishous brew makes me wanna try brown sugga.

Candied orange peel, piney/resiny hops, grass, grapefruit, ripe pineapple, and a hint of molasses. Mild pepper and dark bread. Some slightly camphoric notes from the hops. Quite hoppy. Medium syrupy, with fizzy carbonation. Taste is hoppy, herbal bitter and lightly syrupy sweet. Very good, though not something I generally crave.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 355 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Golden coloured with a medium white head. Aroma of grasy and citrusy hops, and caramel malt. Taste reflects the aroma, moderately sweet, moderately bitter. Medium bodied, with a lsticky texture. Medium carbonation.
Flaska från SB. Ljust gyllene med vitt skum. Fruktig doft med inslag av passionsfrukt, ananas och lite tallbarr. Söt och fruktig med låg beska.

Yep. It sucks. Fucking pine sol. Where the fuck is the "cereal"? Crazy incorrect deScription.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2015 Pours clear golden color with a thin white head. Aroma; hop, passionfruit, some honey and orange. Flavours; mango, blood orange, passionfruit with a pinch of cinnamon. A little bit thin thru all the flavours in the taste palette.

From the bottle the pour is clear yellow and brown, the aroma is ale not sure I get the other hints possibly brown sugar, the taste is lightly hopped a little sweet, the finish is clean I get the brown sugar notes in the finish. The mouthfeel is medium.

Äntligen julöl!!! Ehm...eh, förlåt, jag menar: "Åh vad härligt för barnen med denna glädjens högtid". Och apropå glädje: Tack snälla tomten för att Lagunitas och 7,7% jävulskt välproducerad alkohol finns.

Pours clear dark golden with some white head. A tropical aroma that turns into deep resin with the toffee flavours from the malts. The rye is strongly present in the taste. I wonder how they made this so full-bodied and light given all the malts involved and the complex taste.

355 ml bottle, at a breakfast joint in Petaluma. Deep golden to orange colour, large off-white head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, pine, caramel and sweet malts. Maybe a bit too far out on the sweet side for me, but still a fairly nice beer. Some alcohol in the finish. Anyway, I wouldnt say that it sucks.

Bouteille de 12 oz achetée chez Elmore Store (Elmore, VT) au coût de 3.00$. Arôme: Odeur de caramel avec une pointe florale. Apparence: La couleur est orangée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes et de caramel avec une pointe dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #6510)

355ml bottle from Systembolaget (as Holiday Ale 7.7%, vintage 2015). Almost clear golden, medium size, white head, good lacing. Hoppy sweet citrus aroma, tangerines, sweet orange, pineapple and ripe kiwi fruit. Sweet silky mouthfeel, full bodied, gentle carbonated. Sweet and fruity taste, tropical sweet fruits, orange marmalade with a pleasant bitterness from citrus peel in the finish.

Bottle at Villain & Saint. Nice copper body with slight head. Nose floral, caramel, malts, yeasty. Tastes quite malty, bitter, with hops and fruits in there as well. Really nicely done beer with so many different flavours. Great!

Such a good tasting Double IPA. I do not like how its appearance though, kind of a light color for an Imperial IPA. The taste doesn't say that at all. Drinks along the lines of a lighter Hopslam if I had to compare. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Loads of hops in this one. The one thing different about this and most other beers in its style it the alcohol is very present on the back end. A fruity floral bouquet is also nice. Well rounded.

Bottled. Very nice little concoction. Aroma of pine and toffee. Taste is similar to the nose. Very piney--almost like an IPA. Palate is medium. Finishes long and dry. Paired well with some home grilled carne asada.

A very unique brew. Lots of buttery toast, butterscotch, and caramel. Very slightly bitter with a nice balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. A slightly hazy golden yellow/orange lots of lace. Wheat, citrus and resin hop, detecting some pine, sap like the woods. Ive had this a bunch now recently, not sure what it is but Im losing interest in it, still enjoy it but I think its a predictable, however well done, brew.

I poured it from the bottle into a pint glass. It pours a cloudy golden color with a nice white head and lacing. The aroma is hops, booze, and burnt sugar. The taste is strong on hops with hints of booze, fruit, and brown sugar. It was flavorful. It was drinkable for the alcohol content. This was pretty good.
Very nice balanced beer, between malt and hops. Nice medium bodied beer, good easy drinking beer for being 8.0%.

Rated on 10-01-2015 (Bottle-Don Halls Factory-Fort Wayne, IN) This beers appearance is a very small beige head that mostly diminished, yellow hazy body, fast rising carbonation, some floaties, and spotty lacing. The aroma is citrus and pine hops, pineapple, grapefruit, tropical fruits, some spice, earthy, light perfume, and malt. The flavor is moderately bitter, citrus and pine hops, fruity, earthy, and malt. The mouthfeel is moderate carbonation and this beer is medium-full bodied. This is a very, very quaffable beer with a very good flavor and an enjoyable beer to rate and drink. It is worth trying and a beer I would definitely drink again and again.

Hop forward, and that is just the way I like it. Lagunitas always blows me away; when you think you found the best beer in their line another crops up to enjoy. Fantasic notes of hops, resin, and carmel. The taste of brown sugar never really came across for me, though the appearance and taste merit the name.

Ill tell you what, nice job here by lagunitas. Looks great in glass, lots of bubbles streaming up. Feels good to drink, nice carbonation. Smells the way you like IPAs to smell. And tastes the way you like em to taste. Maybe a bit toned down from some of your fav IPAs. Certainly interchangeable with some other ones you like NYD.

Poured from a coupla quarts which is what most beer companies should do instead of the 22 ouncers. This is a real good substitute for all the beers that come out in the fall and try to soup up marzen and fall styles that have been taken to their limits. This is hoppy, a little bit sweet, strong, and very enjoyable.

Bottle poured a lightly hazy orange hue with large white lasting head and great lacing. Moderate malty straw aroma. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a bold bitter finish. Tastes are pine, caramel, brown sugar, grass, and pineapple. Creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.

A- Pine, spruce, bitter, citrus, dank, resin.

A- Orange color, hazy liquid, off white head.

T- Pine, bitter, herbal, subtle citrus.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- For some reason I expected this to be like a barleywine. I guess in a sense it was...but not really. More like an aggressive IPA from hell. Loved the aroma but the taste was a little too much for me. Liked it more than I thought I would.

Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass.

Appearance: pours a 2" sudsy white head that drops slowly with plenty of lacing. Color is golden-yellow with plenty of sediment in suspension and tons of carbonation.

Aroma: citrus, grapefruit and some extra citrus just for good measure.

Mouthfeel: medium bodied and oily with a mostly dry finish.

Flavor: citrus and pine with malt sweetness and white bread dough.

Overall: a nice sipper, appropriate to the style.
Poured golden with with head. Quite a hoppy aroma, grapefruit and pine. Lots of grapefruit in the flavour too. Very hoppy. Tastes like a good ipa. Really good beer.

This is a strong, flavorful beer. If you blindfolded me, I'd have known it was Lagunitas, but it's a little on the strong side for me. Still a good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Light orange golden, clear. Some creamy, white head.
Aroma: Fruits, slight alcohol.
Taste: Good hops, heaps of malt. Sweetness. Bitterness in aftertaste. Some alcohol.
Bought: Total Wine (Sterling), 355 ml, $1.69
Info: 14/9-2015
Big bottle, Ann Arbor, MI via Sams Club. Pale hazy yellow, thin head. Citrus lime aroma with some resin and grain. Balanced, with ginger and honey on the long dry finish.

Clear golden pour with thin, clingy white foam. Amazing aroma of pine and grapefruit. Good bitter hop hits mid-sip, while ever smooth throughout with some malt sweetness. Finishes a little dry, but otherwise another excellent one from these guys.
On draft. Golden orange color with fluffy one finger head. Pine, grapefruit, other citrus aroma. Big flavor of grapefruit and pine. Excellent.

Clear orange yellow. Rye, pine, earth on the nose. Taste is caramel, orange, nice piney hops bitterness, some booze burn and big body. Id call it a DIPA with some maltier barleywine notes. Pretty good, and a great value.

Bottle from Stone in Asagaya. Pours a clear gold with a nice medium-sized head that dissipates fairly quickly. Big pine and citrus nose that is super enticing. Taste is more of the same. Very juicy grapefruit, orange and some lemon zest. Bitter finish that is crisp and dry. Excellent beer for the price and availability.
Pale gold and clear, medium bodied, citrus and hops aroma. Orange peel and hops flavor with lingering bittersweet finish.

Poured into a taster showing well filtered clear dark yellow with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose is bursting with pine and cannabis. 

The palate is well carbonated and medium bodied. The first flavors show juicy citric fruit forward tartness with the middle balanced out with some dry malt flavors. Pilsner bitter finish at the end.
Bottle at Antenna America. Great copper with decent lacing. Huge orange aroma. Strong beer from a behemoth...

Bottle at 2112. Hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma is hoppy, piney, malty, sweet with quite a lot of resin. Taste is soothingly sweet, good malt body, pines, resin and moderately bitter finish.

Pours clear copper orange with a nice white head. Head retention is good. AROMA: pineapple, earthy funk, malty, caramel, herbs, citrus, grassy, yeast esters, herbal hops, tangerines, lime zest, molasses, pine bitterness and spice. TASTE: malty bitterness, hop spice, pineapple, molasses, pine bitterness, caramel, herbs, citrus, grass bitterness, earthy, alcohol, lime zest, spice, tropical fruit tart, yeasty, peppercorn, chili and leaves. AFTER TASTE: malty bitterness, citrus, hop spice and molasses with an oily finish and mild alcohol warmth.
Pours golden with a white head. Aromas of hops. Taste the same with some citrus. Nice strong ale with little to no alcohol taste.
Bottle from SB. Very nice aroma and taste. Very complex taste, kind of a mix between IP, tripel and barley wine. Good!

12 oz pour from chilled bottle into tulip glass. Orange, translucent, moderate carbonation, big fluffy cloudy white head. Nose is grainy, sweet, cereal, bready, biscuit, fruity, orange, maybe even a little spicy. Fuller bodied, creamy, smooth, a little hops stickiness on the end. I can definitely see the oats. A more complex body than most beers, but it works. Taste is sweet, biscuity, bready, a little fruity, mango, orange, a little rye spice on the end, a hint of alcohol. Really interesting and really good, though distinctly on the sweet side.

On tap. Slightly hazy golden amber pour with small off white head. Aroma of caramel, hops, pine, tropical fruits and malts. Taste of sweet malts, peach, apricot, grapefruit, pine, caramel and syrupy hops. Full bodied, lower carbonation, slightly creamy mouthfeel and a hoppy finish to smooth out the sweetness. A little cloying in the middle but good beer nonetheless.

bottle poured into a snifter..golden hue with a fluffy white head..aroma of citrus,pine,caramel,florals..tastes of mango,apricot,caramel,pine..nice finish..more of a DIPA than a strong ale but excellent nonetheless.

Nice peach and mango aroma with some cereal sweet malts, pine needles, and caramel. Taste is very much like the aroma: grapefruit and pine, tropical fruits, with some sort of spice and caramel in the finish.

Keg at the Hanging Bat.

Surprised at how old school this seemed to be. Light clear sparkling russet brown with a good hop nose and supple mealiness of the body.Smooth yet stealthily big and round

Wow, didnt expect this to be so damn good for some reason. Poured into a goblet. Beautiful, amber/orange color with a decent amount of carbonation. Smell right out of the bottle was very...fruity? Literally had no idea what to expect out of this beer, and what a pleasant surprise it was. Head is super thin, pale color, dissipated almost completely within minutes. Taste is just plain awesome, fruity, clean, no hint of the high ABV to me, and .. spicy and bready at the end. Niiiice.

I didnt catch the ABV, a bit surprising. It had a fair sweetness, though the pale malts tended toward a nice breadiness, some caramel components, fairly strongly hopped but had enough malt backbone to make a nicely balanced beer. Very drinkable.

12 oz bottle. Clear light amber, tight tan head, sticky lace. Aroma is sweet caramel malt, followed by a healthy dose of hops. Pine, resin, citrus, grass. Flavor starts sweet, light caramelized sugar, then spice, grapefruit, tropical fruit.

Pours an amber gold with a nice head of tightly packed white bubbles. Its a beauty. Wonderful fresh aroma although, malt dominates. Very balanced flavor with malty sweetness giving way to sour, bitter, and then umami. Palate is nice with a lingering bitter and some stickiness. Its a great brew.

Bottle. Lightly cloudy golden amber pour with a pillowy white head. I had no idea what to expect here, but it smells like a delicious IPA - lots of bright citrus with some sweet fruit notes underneath. Flavour is fairly sweet, bright citrus and pine, resin notes and tropical fruit. Pretty nice.

32oz bottle to tulip. Pours clear gold, white frothy head. Aroma of candied fruit, pine, citrus and malts. Taste is same. Finish is slightly citrus bitter....lots of toffee, caramel and some brown sugar. Pretty complex, deliciously sweet...yet balanced.

Pours a clear orangish gold with a small white head. Aroma of cat piss(assuming the delicious Simcoe hops), citrus, pine, grapefruit and sweet pale malts. Taste is grapefruit, citrus fruits, light pine and some sweet pale malts. Malty sweetness is balanced perfectly with the bitterness from the hops that ends in the finish and finishes semi dry. Cray to think an 8 percent beer can be this smooth.

Back on the train of beer-rating. 12 oz. bottle. Pours a largely translucent light copper with a small off-white head and a bit of lace. Aroma is mild citrus, pine. Moderately sweet with a steady bitterness on the finish.

pours a rich clear gold with a medium off white head. Aroma is grapefruit citrus and pine. taste is hoppy citrus and quickly turns good bitter. thick resinous mouth feel. Long semi-bitter finish with a nice nasal linger. Good beer!

Keg, The Criterion, Leicester. Hazy golden with a white head. Caramel and wheat with mango, pineapple and grapefruit. Juicy with leafy pine bitterness. Some underlying brown sugar sweetness with a bready palate. Peppery, warming, nutty booze

Not too shabby as a sub to brown shugga. This beer is a smooth sippa with a subtle sweetness and a nice finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2015 Bottle at TNT Taisho.
L: pours an unassuming light clear gold.
S: killer nose. Big fruit notes, passionfruit, mango, pine, its bright and the hop aromas are immense.
T: very tasty. The same fruits come through, some grassiness, and touch of malt.
F: so smooth, a wonderful balance of bitterness.
O: beers like this, Sculpin, and Ruination 2.0 are blowing me away continuously. Bright, balanced, fruity and floral qualities up with the hoppy pine, dangerously easy to drink.

Tasted from a 12 oz. bottle. It poured a mostly clear golden-amber hue with a frothy off-white head and abundant lacing. Deliciously fruity aroma of peach, pineapple and hops. The hop & fruit taste is built upon a solid malt base. Tasty with a nice bitter finish.
Pours hazy copper with a white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit and sweet caramel. Taste follows nose

Poured from bottle into snifter, dirty orange in color, pine resin aroma, hoppy taste, strong ale body. Good stuff. Would pair with fire, any fire...campfire, bonfire, chiminea, non-gas grill, fireworks, or pyrotechnics. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a clear orangish color. Aroma and taste are orange, pine resin, and hoppy bitterness.
This beer is very tasty. The piney aroma and flavor combined with hop character is delicious!
Golden color with a foamy white head. Punchy, dry, but with a nice citrus zest. Hoppy, but thats not what defines it. Theres a lot of complexity, spice, and a bit of earthiness.
12 oz. bottle. Nice beer for sipping in the summer. Aromas of citrus and hops. Tastes of grapefruit and citrus, hops and breads. Will have this beer again, soon.

Growler from McHughs. Pours cloudy golden with white foam head. Citrus, pineapple, pine, coconut, mango, bubblegum, candy floss. Flavour is sherbert, bubblegum, fizzy sweet, sticky caramel, sugar. Full bodied. Probably sweetest beer Ive had. Orange aftertaste. A bit unexpected but good beer.
Quart bottle into a shaker- poured a turbid light brown/orange color... dont care, it was good, I drank it, and it was good. Fuck Texas!

Half pint on-tap at Euston Tap, London:
Another excellent Lagunitas beer, not as hoppy as Id expected with sweet malts taking the front seat but some did feature & the balance was a good one. The beer proved to be quite an easy one to drink as well, despite the strength. One well worth seeking out if you can find it.

Medium gold pour, 2 finger meringue "substitutes" for a head, leaving some decent lace. Nose is steady, but not overpowering, pine cones. Bitter, with a serious objection from malt. Middle starts light caramel, alcohol shows itself, mango, papaya (green) and sweet malt come together. Finish drips pine resin...for awhile. WOW!

One of if not my favorite of the beers I tried for the first time this year. The sweetness of the beer is subtle, but its there and makes this a delicious beer. Its especially great on a hot day and it has become one of the regulars in my fridge

Draught at The Euston Tap, London. Golden amber with slim white head. Aroma of fresh citrusy, juicy fruity hops. Lots of citrusy hops in the taste, orange peel, pine. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation, long and big bitter finish. Very good.

Funny premise. It's a good medium body almost IPA. I know they made it in 2011 so it has aged well. Also comes in a fun 1 quart size.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells slightly sweet and a little grassy from the hops, pours a gold color with a small nice white head, taste is sweet with a bit of a bitter bite at the end of it. The only thing that sucks about this beer is I dont have any more of it.
Hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma is hoppy, piney, malty, sweet. Taste is soothingly sweet, good malt body, pines, moderately bitter. Good beer, good complexity.
32 oz bottle. Poured golden with light white head. Aroma was of fruity hops. Taste was citrus, orange peel, floral, pine, pale malts. Goes down pretty nicely, not too much alcohol in the taste.

Draft after drinking a Lagunitas IPA. Taste is eerily similar. Pours a thick golden color. Aromas of cutrus, heavy floral, and dank. Flavored line up the same. Medium carbonation, medium high hopped, bitter dry finish.

12fl oz bottle poured into a Samuel Adams Perfect Pint. Sparkling gold with a tall fluffy white head. Aroma is flowery hops. Flavor is pretty hoppy, fruity, and delicious but finishes with a mustiness that isn't entirely pleasant. Overall, not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear gold with a frothy cream head. Aromas of hearty wheat, sharp rye, citrus, floral, and caramel, and the classic IPA pine, although thats more faint. Taste is a nice medley of West Coast hops, sweet tropical fruit up front fading to that fine bitter, spicy hop-taste. Very good. Lagunitas continues to become a favorite of mine with every beer of theirs I try.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a mostly fading off white head. Aroma of orange, resinous pine, floral, lemon, perfumey. Taste is of pine, lemon, blood orange, grapefruit. Long bitter finish. Medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Lovely stuff.

40oz.er in brown paper bag to shaker glass, pours deep golden, monster frothy off white head. Awesome lace and retention. Aroma pine and caramel. Taste is awesomely balanced for a strong ale, moderately sweet, pleasingly bitter. Full bodied, lively carbonation, sticky mouth feel. Finishes long and bitter with a slight alcohol presence. Tasting notes of plum, raisin, pine, lemon, grass, I could go on. Sucks nice!

Ive been wanting Sucks for a long time, now. Wow, that sounds dirty... With the innuendo out of the way, lets go right into it. Appearance is like a beautiful IPA: hazy orange with a frothy, long-lasting head. Aroma reveals floral hops, caramel, pine resin, juniper, and citrus. Taste showcases candy-like malt, citrusy hops redolent of orange cream, toffee, spiciness, and a boozy bite. Mouthfeel is crisp with a stomach-warming alcohol finish. Even in the eclectic Strong Ale category, Sucks is entirely unique. Its tricky to describe and damn hard to pigeonhole into any one style. Sucks is an Imperial IPA/American Strong Ale thing with lots of West Coast attitude. Its... Ah, shit. Its really good, okay? Leave me to it.

Bottle, 12 oz. A hazy, pale orange-golden beer wtih a small, dense, off-white head. The aroma is really lovely, with pine cones, grapefruit and resins, and a whiff of malts. Perhaps a bit one dimensional, but damn lovely. The flavor feels sweet in a way, but its very dry on the palate. Its bitter, full-bodied and with a soft carbonation. Pine cones, grapefruit and a peachy touch in the flavor. Hints of alcohol. Lasting bitter, fruity and resiny finish. Wonderful indeed, wouldnt mind a steady supply of this back home. 150607

Bottle 355ml @ Hotel Room, Four Points by Sheraton, Boston
, MA
Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, pine and hop cones. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus, grape, orange and pine finish: Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft,

Pours a pale golden yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is floral hops and resin. Flavor is rye and resin, slightly sweet with a touch of bitterness. Has the aroma of a double IPA, but comes off maltier and less bitter. Its a good beer.

Keg at Brewdog, Bristol, Saturday 30th May 2015   Beautiful clear warm gold with a sticky white head. Soft in mouth, really quite sweet but lots of tropical flavours. Enjoyed this, a touch sweet was the only real negative. A6 A4 T8 P4 Ov14 3.6

12 oz bottle. Slightly cloudy yellow golden pour with a medium fizzy white head. Aroma of pine, candied sugar, coriander, lemongrass and grapefruit. Easy drinking medium body. Dangerously tasty at 8%.

Poured from bottle. Citrus and pine hops in aroma. Good lookin cloudy gold with lasting head. Not the hop Bomb I expected, but I taste the citrus / pine hops with a very creamy malt base. Also tasting notes of peach, pepper and maybe a hint of coriander. Very easy to drink for a strong ale. As usual, another excellent beer from LBC.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Clear golden copper hue with a film of sticky foam. Resinous pine and toffee dominate the flavour, some hoppy fruits going on as well, nice sweetness from the malt. Flavour is very bitter and hop-forward, soapy, toffee, bit of vanilla actually. Sweet indeed. Big mouthfeel and nice, soft, carbonation. Top stuff!

Keg at brewdog bar, Sheffield. Pale gold with a small white head. Aroma is cerealy and malty with bread and zesty citrus too. Taste is sweet and bitter. Body is nice and oily with quite prickly carbonation.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a beer can glass today. A: Grapefruit, tropical fruit, and spiciness. Very juicy. A: 1 finger head with an easy pour, receding to a ring and fluff. See through honey orange body. T: Sweet grapefruit, mango, and spiciness dominate. Honey, cereal, and pine are subtle. P: Smooth and a little oily until the bubbles take over. O: This one goes down too easy for 8%. The alcohol is barely noticeable. Im going to be buying much more of this.

12oz bottle. Pours golden orange with a big, foamy white head. Lively carbonation. Aroma is of hops, malt, pine, and caramel. Taste starts off with a bitter, piney hop burn. So very resiny. The hops are evened out by a caramel malt backbone. Lingering hop burn. Mouthfeel is light and soapy. Body is medium and drinks real easy. The alcohol is definitely there. Drinks very easy.

Super słodki, super owocowy aromat. Mango, brzoskwinia, ananas. Barwa złota, piwo delikatnie mętne. Szybko opadająca piana ale świetny lacing. Odczycie wskazuje na bardzo lekkie piwo. 13-14 Plato. Zero ciała, dość wodniste. Alkoholu nie czuć. Jak na IIPA to super pijalne, ale przez to brakuje mu charakteru dużego piwa. Średnia goryczka, super przyjemne, ale trochę mu brakuje kopnięcia.
Keg at Bat. Pours amber golden. Decent head and lacing. Big floral hoppy aroma. Big oily resin hop fruitiness too with a nice malt backbone. Full of flavour.A nice DIPA
Pours gold with a white head. Big hoppy aroma. Citrus, malt, resin, and floral notes. Medium body and carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel with a dry finish. Really good DIPA.
Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours clear amber gold. Nose is sticky resin, fruits, sweet toffee, pine, citrus. Taste is also resinous, bitter fruitiness, citrus. Sweetish.
Citrus and pine on the nose. Clean aroma. Unfortunately, Thats about all i really had an appreciation for with this beer. Over all just not a fan.

DATE TASTED: May 20, 2015... GLASSWARE: Victory Hop Devil nonick... OCCASION: Watching the Cavs try to steal a second straight in Atlanta--and relaxing after the end of baseball season, for good... APPEARANCE: Bright, pilsneresque body that releases tiny bubbles; the head is a monstrous white pillow that pitches a hedgerow of lacing; as the glass drains, excellent up-and-down lacing ... AROMA: thick wafts of sugary resin, pineapple, mango and other "strong" scents; not as much of the four grains available... PALATE: a mellow, moderately weighted body with a soft, balanced aftertaste--as easy-drinking as an 8% ABV will be...TASTE: a beautiful balance of a four-grain drag and a bevy of hops; a rather ridiculously good tasting "alternative" to the original, which I did not get a chance to sample; the resin is sharp, the pineapple palpable, the hops teeth-tethering--in a word, a full-flavored experienced that warms as it sips... OVERALL: ah, Lagunitas--thank God you have made the nationwide market a goal; grabbed a quart for $6.99 at Hope Liquors, and this beer is a perfect compliment to the night; hearty, flavorful and easy-drinking...any other aspect needed?

18th May 2015: quart bottle shared between me, my wife and son-in-law. Golden/amber pour with a white topping on each glass. Nice blend of aromas and flavours. Hops first and foremost, piny and citrusy: semi-sweet malt taste mid-sip. Decent and worth trying: hides the alcohol content nicely.
From a 22oz bottle. Pours an amber gold with an off-white head. Nose is veyr resinous\ and citrus. Full body. Flavor shows rye and citrus. Dry hoppy and very resinous finish. Damn good!!

12 FL OZ ($9.99 6 pack) one of the best beers from the maker. a killer beer that attacks you like its an IPA and then after that first pint youre already feeling it as its 8%. a truly perfect drunk maker.

Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Aroma is of hops, citrus, grain, bread, and just a hint of fig. Slick and bubbly palate. Flavor is of bittersweet citrus and floral hops, yeast, oat, pine, and earthyness. Leaves a nicely balanced citrus hop taste in the end. Great stuff!
Golden with white head. Grapefruit hop aroma. Taste is malty sweetness up front. Long pine/grapefruit citrus finish. Slight dank hop flavor too. Delicious.

Fresh beer served in a tulip. The beer pours a fairly transparent yellow orange with a thin white head that shrinks down pretty quick and leaves ok lacing. Aroma is oranges, tangerine, grapefruit, pine, and sweet caramel. On to the taste. At first sip the beer is initially full of bright citrus flavors. Mainly the ones aforementioned in the aroma. It is met with a nice caramel malt with bits of toffee and brown sugar as well. The beer starts off very juicy and finishes a bit dry, but remains very quenching. Another outstanding offering from Lagunitas, and @ 8%, its just dangerous enough to have some fun with. Excellent beer.

Pours amber into the glass with a 1-finger soapy head that reduces to webbed lacing. The nose is of pine and grassiness. Flavors of a huge grain bill, cereal, citrusy grapefruit and orange, and large resinous pine hops finish with a hint of ABV among the large pepper and spruce-pine notes. Almost in the barleywine category, this complex, substantive palate wrecker is full-bodied with a very bold mouthfeel. Huge beer with lots and lots to provide.

1qt bottle to pub glass. Like a fresh breakfast on a distant shore. Very heavy grapefruit with subtle honey and notes of molasses. Warm malty finish. As close to a perfect ale as I can remember. Tongue, prepare yourself.
Sucks should be in the beer hall of fame. The hops characteristics give deep floral aroma, malt rich taste, and a long hops heavy finish. You really dont want the finish to end.
Whats not to like about this aromatic hop masterpiece. Im so glad they "screwed up" and had to make this beer. Beautiful golden color, crisp, delicious hoppy ale.

LAGUNITAS DOSE SUCK BECAUSE THEY DO NOT MAKE PLINY (MY #1 FAVOURITE BEERS) AND THEY HAVE NEVER EVEN TRYED TOO! THIS BEER IS OK THOUGH :AT FIRST I SMELLED IT UP MY NOSE AND IT ACTUALLY SMELL A GOOD AMOUNT AS AN PLINY (I LOVE PLINY, YOU KNOW), AND FOR THAT IT FELT GOODS IN ME. UNFORNTUNATLY - IT DOES NOT HAVE FLAYVER LIKE A PLINY AND IT LOOKS LIKE THE NATTY WE DRINK AT BBQS SOMETIMES. SO LIGHT AND IT COULD DEFINITELY USED MORE ALCOHOL. I DONT KNOW WHAT HAPPENS TO THERE HOPS, BUT I BEARLY TASTE ANY. MORE MORE MORE!!

Appearance- Clear golden orange with a thick fluffy white head
Aroma- Nice crisp grapefruity hops, piney, malts
Flavor- Sweet beginning with a bitter hop bite for the finish, fruity, hoppy, some pepper, citrus.

32oz - Beer pours a nice gold color with a nice head. Quickly you pick up citrus on the nose. The first taste is complex and hard to read at first. Swish it around and you pick up some citrus and pine but also other flavors. Bitter finish and dry. Nice mouth feel. I would buy this again and I will.
Bottle. Pours rich yellow with small foamy white head, floral hops aroma, medium carbonation, slightly bitter hops taste, long finish. Nice and smooth.
Piney hop aroma. Pours clear orange with a thin white head. Smooth up front with a long bitter finish.

32oz bottle for $6.99. Pours a clear dark gold with a decent fluffy white head. Aroma is straight up pine/floral hops. Taste is hop forward with a bit of a malt backbone. Dry, bitter finish with a bit of a kick from the alcohol. Big, thick mouthfeel. If you were to call this an imperial IPA, I would not disagree with you. Once again, Lagunitas delivers a kick ass ale for a very reasonable price.
Hoppy, medium off white head under a clear amber pour, very nice balance, impressive

Tap at Pizza Luce. Amber colored with a thin white cap. Light pine aroma with alcohol, malty and light rye notes. Moderate sweetness with a piney bitter finish. Body is heavier with a soapy feel.
Old rating. Big sweet, floral beer. Gold amber. Big citrus, grapefruit and piney hops over a spicy malt backbone. Some sweetness.

12oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Pours golden-copper in color. A little hazy. Nice white head.

Aroma is sweet and malty. Fruity apple. Floral
Hops. 

Taste is mostly sweet. Somewhat bitter too, but its underwhelming. 

Body is medium. Soft carbonation. Medium finish. 

Decent, but not amazing.
dark gold color with a thin off-white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, and grain. Flavor is grapefruit, pine, grain, and bread.

Pours an amber body with a medium head. Flowery aroma of hops. Very nice and sweet taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drucken på flaska. Orange, lite grumlig med fin krona. Luktar torkad frukt, apelsin och bröd. Smakar fantastiskt gott, härlig humle med fin maltsmak. Lättdrucken, men ändå trevligt sällskap hela kvällen.

Lagunitas has been consistently good to excellent in its lineup of offerings (in my experience; the numbers say a median rating of 4.2 from 21 ratings including this one, with only two scoring below 3.8 and the lowest being 3.3). For some reason I was apprehensive about this one but it turns out to be quite enjoyable. The initial nose triggered "barley wine" thoughts, the appearance that of a slightly hazy Stone-ish IPA, with lots of rising carbonation bubbles. Flavor that of a slightly mild IPA with lots of near-butterscotch sticky sweetness thrown in (which is fine by me in this case, since while its lots of sticky sweetness, its not too much, although almost too much). Finishes very smooth. Almost sessiony if not so boozy.  to be exact Id rate this 8.7/10 or 4.35 on a 5-point scale.
This is my first brew with Lagunitas. This is a pretty good beer that would make me come back to Lagunitas.
has a good pine hop aroma with a nice blend of grains. taste is a nice grain blend, some rye mixed with some good ending hop bitterness.
Aroma and flavors dominated by strong citrus hops. Golden, full bodied backed by sweet malts. So good Lagunitas serves it up in a quart bottle.

Poured from 1 Quart Bottle into tulip. Three finger white head dissipates quickly leaving lots of lacing. Aroma is hoppy with hints of citrus. Appearance is light hazy orange. Taste is crisp and lightly sweet with medium bitterness. Hints of citrus and floral hops. Medium bodied with a thin texture. Carbonation is soft to average. Moderately long grapefruit finish.

Overall good enjoyable refreshing beer.

Quart bottle (cause sometimes, 40 ounces is just too much). Lemon, orange rye malt and pine/grapefruit peel aroma. Golden yellow with moderate white head and nice lacing. Sweet orange biscuit rye malt and moderately bitter grapefruit peel/pine flavor. Nice body.

Poured from a one quart bottle into a pint glass to drink. The beer had a light, clear dark gold color with a slight touch of amber and a modest foamy white head with shorter retention, but good cling and lacing. The aroma featured a blend of grainy and earthy hops with sugar, spice, and a bit of pine. Its taste was pretty sweet with notes of sugar, molasses, light fruit, and a touch of bitter grainyness at the swallow. The beer had a very lively mouthfeel and was well carbonated with a good fizz and kick, and was somewhat drying in nature.
Poured from large bottle, golden, clear, tan foam, resin, floral, medium bitterness, light body, average carbonation, bitter, very smooth, nice beer, love lagunitas!
For a screw up situation they made an excellent beer here. I love a winter beer that does not have a lot ofg the holidy spices but heavy warmth and this is one of those.

Hazy golden , with big ,white head. Malt, caramel and pine in aroma. Great balanced taste. Unbelievable tasteful and drinkable. Perfect for sharing , quart bottle. The label say to share with friend ... Unfortunately , he is to far away ...

Nice sweet malt nose with pine coming through. Makes you excited to taste 

Taste is like the nose, nice balance and sweet without being fake or cloying. The high carbonation helps to keep balance and makes you want to take another sip

Very enjoyable afternoon supper with a kick.

Sticky malty oaty wheaty carmel foamy carbonated sweet treat with lick your lips sweet finish. Think that there said it. Try it it doesnt SUCK! Cheers!

32 oz bottle poured into 12 oz snifter. Definitely a bottle size you should share...
Solid IIPA, very very drinkable. Compared to newer IIPAs lower alcohol, lower sweetness, not over the top, kinda nice to have that option!
Quart bottle shared by Elijah, thanks! Pours yellow gold with a white head. Aroma is biscuit, dank hop. Flavor is caramel, but, dank hop. Very nice.
Shared bomber, pint glass. Clean, light gold. Light and dry yet sweet. Mots going on: biscuity, hoppy, citrus. Fresh. Good.

Clear golden color, big frothy white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, resin, biscuit malt. Flavor is tropical fruit, pineapple and mango. Lots of biscuit malt, and a whole bunch of other malt character I can?t quite describe (rye maybe). Hoppy finish. Really good.
Tap at CBR, gold with a lightly spicy and orangey nose, a fleeting sweetness disappears beneath a wave of dry-bitter hoppiness, leaving tantalising hints of tropical fruit and honey.

Lagunitas Sucks (32-oz. bottle) has a thin, off-white head, a mostly clear, orange-gold appearance, a few stray bubbles, and a bit of lacing left on the glass. The aroma is of standardized, piney hop resin, and a touch of white bread. Taste is the same, with noticeable, but not harsh, hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium, and Lagunitas Sucks finishes semi-dry and fairly drinkable. RJT

Bottle: Pale, golden straw with great clarity. Only a very subtle haziness at the core. Voluptuous, foamy white head chunks up nicely & sits on top, fluffy as hell & lasting for days. Loads of chunky lacing left all around the glass. Great aroma of unabashed hoppiness. Pine, citrus peel, pineapple, dank nuggets, oranges, sticky wet mango, grapefruit... Wow. Tons of both tropical & citrus fruits going to town on your nose. Lovely resinous & leafy undertones with a mild spicy bite. Flavors of pine, resinous oils, citrus, pineapple, toast, crackers, green onion, grass, buttered bread, herbal tea leaves, under-ripe pineapple, & just a hint of alcohol. Heavy carbonation snaps the tongue nicely, mostly dry in the finish, lingering with lightly sweet biscuit malt, peppery-herbal hop leaves, & a touch of citrus peel. Delicious.

the juice is loose, pouring out of this thirty and deuce. Label stipulates an ABV of eight but RBs data is a little late. Fizzy white froth floating on top, not a drop of this ish I will drop. Paint thinner permeates my nose, better sip on this or I will doze. The mouth scream of citrus aroma, bust out a beer bong to put me in a coma. - I would like to thank the Beastie Boys and KMFDM for inspiring my rating.

Pours a clear gold with thin white head and a lot of lacing on the way down. Great nose - grapefruit, floral, pine - definitely the stand out characteristic of the beer. Taste is citrus, some hops, and a little too much alcohol on the finish. It's very good - but the taste does not quite pay off the expectation of the nose.

Taster at Lagunitas. Pours clear gold with a white head. Nose is oatmeal, hops, citrus, and bread. Flavour is crisp hops, cereal, citrus, grapefruit, and pine resin. Medium body. Well balanced multigrain beer.

Clear amber pour. Smell of Pine....................

This beer pours a somewhat hazy golden color with a thick white head that left plenty of lacing around the glass. The aroma is so inviting with this beer! I pick up citrus, floral hops, and some pine. There is also a little bit of breadiness in the nose as well. The taste is incredible. Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Bright gold with dirty sea-foam colored head 5mm thick, fades slowly, medium-fine. Big 32 oz In iPa glasses. Clear amber, really shines in the light. Light, fluffy head. Aroma of pine and orange, clean. Taste is sweet and smooth, with a hop bite on the finish. Damn good beer.
Golden with a white head - Fruity hop aroma with pine - good malt to support a hop flavour that has some fruits and pine with nice bitterness - Good hop bitter finish with some pine - This was good

Poured from the bottle into a snifter. Pours a cloudy orange color with a small white head. Aroma consists of floral notes, citrus, pine, resin, and cereal. Well balanced beer that does not overdo anything. The citrus, pine, malts, make a really nice beer that is not overly bitter. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and a sticky mouth feel. Excellent beer, especially for the price.

There rises a little heavy malt scent up the glass, containing pine and resin. In the mouth also nicely mellow, with the alcohol present, on top of the almost sticky (not negative) taste of resin and malt. Almost like a double IPA. The bitter hops lasts well into the aftertaste but with no floral or spicy impression from the small green buds. Overall it seems almost like a cross between double IPA and barley wine. I think that it ends sympathetic although not well balanced, as I am sure the intention was.

Golden colour with a white creamy head. Strong aroma with hops and fruits. Flavour of grassy hops with a sweet smell of elderflower, some toffee and sweet mandarin. Taste of toffee and some burnt sugar with a medium bitterness but with a sweeter after-taste. Orange and grapefruits.
Bottle 33 cl. Golden, clear with a minimal white head. Fresh fruit aroma with some citrus and light caramel sence. Light bitter taste with a long fruity end..

Guess I hadnt rated this yet. Clear golden with a big, sticky head. The aroma is full on passion fruit, grapefruit, and orange, citrus zest, resin, and floral hops. Pours clear and golden colored with a deep white clingy head. Big aroma of resin, pine, grapefruit, lemon, and orange that is reminiscent of a dry hopped IPA. Bottle. Pours golden orange with a medium lacy white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, grapefruit and light caramel. Flavor was sweet, bitter, and hoppy with pine, caramel, citrus, orange, grapefruit and had some notes of toffee. Oily texture, medium body, bitter dry finish.

From a 32oz bottle (which is what all bombers should be) - Pours a clear orange with lots of bubbles and a big head. Citrus and pine aroma. Real nice hoppy flavor. The citrus and pine is well balanced and not real bitter. Overall a really good IPA, not to citrusy as many of them tend to be.....A friend said this beer matches good with a Sharp Cheddar cheese so Im breaking out some Hooks 10yr Cheddar to see.

Bottle @ home. Pours a golden color with a medium white head. Sweet nose and flavor with lots of hop raisins & caramel in front. Medium to big body with smooth carbonation and sticky alcohol, Notes of Pine apples, Pine needles, Oranges, some spices, lemon, spruce, sugar & alcohol . Je qualifie cette bière de "vin de céréales" tellement son cocktail de grains est imposant, autant en bouche quau niveau olfactif. Clear amber color. Thick, long lasting head. Fruity aroma. Nice bitterness. Full, smooth body.
Flaska från SB. Doftar mango, tallbarr, kåda och citrus. Värmande och kraftigt besk smak. Denna matchas med en medelhög sötma. Lite torr i slutet.

(350ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours a very slightly hazed pale golden orange with a short lived white head that fades to a ring quickly with a little lace. Aroma is nice and vibrant, with pink grapefruit, hints of candied orange, some red berries, light tropical notes, and a lightly spicy, herbal undertone that could be rye as well as hops. Otherwise malts are restrained in the nose. On the palate, sweetish initially with orange, grapefruit, strawberry, and a lot of earthy, spicy herbal/floral hop characters. In the middle, its half sweet, half bitter with the hop character still dominant. Towards the finish, the characters of the grain bill come into focus, with a peppery rye note and a creaminess from oats, alongside a moderate resinous bitterness and lingering citrus/tropical notes. The feel at the finish is smooth and rounded with that oat character. Mouthfeel is medium-full otherwise, and the carb quite soft. Perhaps that mouthfeel is the beers biggest strength, and the best contribution of the complex grain bill. Alongside is a nice, fruity/spicy hop profile that matches it, making for a very balanced and drinkable DIPA. Id not call this an ASA, but who cares, its good stuff!
Bottle @ home, tfs Vaiz. Aroma is big malt and caramel and huge fruity and slightly sweaty hops. Flavour is big medium bitter lingering hops with some caramel malt. Very nice.
Very impressive double IPA that is very easy to drink. The 2014 bottle is the best version I have had to date.

Aroma is tropic and also sweet malty. Taste is at first a little stingy/peppery, but that evolves into a smooth very light bread feeling and a nicely balanced hop presence. The only thing that sucks with this beer is that it isnt in the regular stock in our stores in Sweden

Poured a clear yellow-amber color with a frothy white head. Aroma is quite hoppy with oatmeal and pine. Taste is fantastic lots of different grain flavors with plenty of hops to balance it out. Slightly spicy with oats and rye. Nice complexity and very well balanced. Overall a great beer. Finish has lots of pine and resin with some rye.

Draft at Euston tap a couple months back. Rich gold, fluffy white head fades slowly. Nice nose of juicy berries, rich citrus and some tropical notes, some caramel. Tastes sweet and big bitter, citrus, resin, green dankness, some spice, dryish finish. Nice gear, very drinkable for the abv, enjoyed this a lot.
Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Very hoppy smell with citrus, pine and grapefruit. Similar hoppy taste with a cookie-like maltbase. Nice strong bitterness.

I thought I liked this a lot but last time I had this it just didnt do it. The aroma is inviting typical lagunitas bouquet but I assume its the different grains in the flavor. Didnt blend well with the hops. Too bad because a 32 ounce bomber of this is a nice price

Pours a faintly hazy golden color with a great pillowy head. Aroma is hoppy, acidic, resin, pine, grapefruit rind, floral, herby, faint sweet malt at the end. Taste is huge malt backbone, grapefruit rind, an almost onion note(not bad by any means), spices, none of the 4 grains used stand out over another. Overall a good beer, not my favorite from Lagunitas though due to their high standards.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2015 "ill start by saying this does nothing to make it stand out as a holiday/winter offering, especially when you consider the pethora of ipas lagunitas puts out. that said, its pretty damn good as a nice, fresh, flavorful ipa. highly aromatic, spicy, piney, floral. lighter in body than expected, but super smooth, tasty, with a nice bittersweet finish. they stick to their strong point, which isnt anything new, but i like it better than the beer it temporarily replaced."

Poured from quart(!) bottle into tulip. Translucent golden yellow with foamy white head that sticks around. Scent has some floral hops and earthy grains. Flavor is a balance of sweet-ish grainy malt and fresh earthy floral hops. Feel is smooth and wet and creamy all at once. This is a great beer, perfect balance, great flavors.

Pours a beautifull golden color with a nice white head. Aroma is strange. Some slight onion and garlic with pine and hints of citrus. Also notes of tropical fruit and stone fruit like apricot or nectarines. Notes of strawberry as well. Definitely sweet on the nose. Taste is slight pine up front with milder citrus fruit, orange, lemon/lime. Sweet malt, hidden alcohol, finish is mild but lingering and works well. Not an offensive beer at all, super sessionable. Grains dont shine in this one, but it works. Body on this is tremendous for 8%.
Love the quart bottle and the golden beer that followed. Aroma of bread yeast and spice. Taste of bitter hop melded with malt for a cereal everspice with hint of liquorice. Medium length finish.
and words and stuff and words and stuff and words and stuff and words and stuff and words and stuff and words and stuff

It pours golden in color with a light peach colored head. it leaves lacing as the head retreats. It is hoppy with aromas of rye, oats, citrus, and a whiff of barley. There is strong flavors of rye, citrus, and a combination of oats and barley. It goes down well in a way that is fully complimentary of the burst of complex flavors.
I really liked this one. Pours a light gold color with a lot of pronounced aromas. Good price.

Pours a slightly hazy, very slightly hazed orange yellow with a super sticky white head that thins out quickly but leaves tons of lace, nice. Aroma of candied citrus, maybe some wheat or just tons of pale malt, very nice, excellent grass note but its got some more depth to it than just straight grassy hoppy bears, the sweet malt note holds up well. Flavor follows but is just a bit more sweet and sugary that I would like but only by a tad, drinks well but leaves some richness in the aftertaste that sticks around, but its winter and thats just fine. Citrus, candied wheat/pale malt, light metallic bitterness, bit of grapefruit and pine, and some grassy bitterness greeness as well. Excellent beer here.

Large 32oz bottle from Whole Foods Market, Bowery, New York, NY. A dark golden coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, citrus, tropical fruit, grapefruit aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit. Nicely complex beer from Lagunitas.

From 32 oz bomber. Golden, clear with a white foamy head. The aroma is floral, sweet fruit. Flavor is sweet malt, spicy rye, and resinous fruity hops. There's even a hint of creaminess from the oats. There's a lot going on in this beer. Very enjoyable!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours from 32 oz mega-bomber a medium golden hue, clear with a nice white foamy head. Aroma immediate floral, mangoes and papayas. Sweet bready malts come into play as well. Flavour is big chewy malt with tons of fruits and citus in the middle with a tart grapefruit near the finish. A resinous smack of bitter hops compliment the end too along with a light note of pine and tropical fruit. A big beer to be well enjoyed. Lagunitas has a big hit here.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: 32oz Btl pours a bright slightly hazy golden color with an orange tint. Massive pillowy white head with tight tiny bubbles hangs around forever,eventually leaving lots of lace. Smells of orange,tangerine,caramel mango and pine. Taste of sweet caramel,cookie dough, citrus, tropical fruits and hops. Medium body, soft silky mouthfeel, enormous carbonation and a smooth finish. A little sweet but almost perfectly balanced. A big beer that is very smooth and easy to drink. Both the hops and malt shine in this one! One of Lagunitas best!!!

Truly great beer; has to be a top 5 IPA(single or double) for me after just my first one. It's like the regular IPA, just more focused and intense.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Solid brew. Has everything you would want from a strong ale. Great mouth taste and not overwhelming with the hops. Very balanced!
Poured from 32 oz bottle....nose is all pine and citrus....taste is same....very tasty beer...i will do this one again for sure.
tried at recent bottle share. dont like overly hopped beers, and that all this was.

taster @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear light amber, good bubbly white head cover, light streaks of lace. Taste is straight malt that becomes aggressively hoppy in the palate, with only a hint of malt sticking around. Not exactly balanced, but, if not for the 7.85%, a good food beer.

Draught at the Euston Tap, London on 26 September. Poured a hazy golden, with a dense, thin white head. Aroma of floral hops, straw and tinned fruit. Grainy flavours, with some peach and mango fruitiness. Finish was quite light, with notes of straw, bready malt and melon.

Big 32 ounce bottle from chuckaduck, thanks man! Golden pour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, and resin hops
 Flavor is great balance of sweet malts and resinous hops. Tasty.

1qt bottle. Pours a clear, golden yellow with a fluffy, white head that sticks. Aroma has notes of pine, resin, tropical fruits, and citrus. Taste is bitter but balanced. Orange citrus, resin, pine, and a slightly sweet aftertaste. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. A not resiny in the mouth with a big, dry finish. Overall really nice. Would get again!

A hazed golden amber ale with a thin light mocha head. In aroma, nice fruity biscuit malt with resinous floral hops, pungent notes, light sulfur, nice. In mouth, a nice fruity caramel malt with floral hops, grapefruit pulp, fruity esters, orange pulp, alcohol warmth, very nice. As Holiday Ale.

12K joint milestone tasting (Lubiere gets most of the credit with 10K, I only get 2K). Small bottle, 2011. Dirty amber with an off white head. Citrus, sweet, apricot, more barleywine now but still good, some alcohol, full body, moderate carbonation. Good.
Excellent brew with a ton going on, dried fruit aroma almost belgian strong ale. Really nice spicy and hoppy almost conjoined. Very enjoyable BIG beer.
8% ABV. Nice hoppy strong ale. A bit like a double IPA. bottle at thai with marito and Neil.

20140920 32 oz bottle from Friendship. Well, this one was a big surprise that I never would have purchased if the enthusiastic beer dude at Friendship hadnt offered me a sample. Lovely to look at, with a sixteenth inch white creamy head that lasts throughout the drink. Clean pale amber in color with lazy eff. Aroma is garlic, green pepper, and lemongrass. I ate some five guys fries with this and it was a great pairing, where the mild acidity and soft eff cut through the fries fattiness. Just the mildest alcohol note gives appropriate warmth to the rich and bitter concoction. to me, this is a more refined Founders Double Trouble, and thats saying a lot because I love love love that beer. Despite my hesitancy about 32 oz, by the end I was wishing for more.

Keg at Euston Tap. Hazy gold, tiny head with loads of white lacing. Aroma of candy sugar, peaches, dill, strawberry, a bit of maple and a tiny bit of hairspray. Taste is a sweetish bitter with a watercressy umami. Bitter herby/medicinal finish and aftertaste. Weird. And certainly good but maybe not worthy of the hero worship displayed in other rates. Smells a lot better than it tastes.

Aroma: intense citrus, caramel, tropical fruits, mango. Appearance: clear gold, medium, creamy white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: citrus and lime creamy cookies, zest, refreshing, remains modestly sweet, soft carbonation. Overall: massive American Strong Ale, this is fantastic, excellent aroma and palate! Pint at Earl of Essex, Islington.

Nearly clear golden orange color, moderate head, good lace/retention. Aroma is tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus, herbal. Medium bodied, moderate to high bitterness, dingo/kiwi hops dominate with enough malt backing to balance.
Tap at blue door. Golden with small white head. Aroma is muted and sweet, citrus hops. Flavor is sweet clean and bitter. Nice beer.

32 oz bottle from Premier Gourmet. Pours a nearly clear golden colour with moderate-sized white head with solid retention. Aroma is floral and citrusy hops with rich biscuity and caramelly malts. Flavour is quite hoppy with floral, citric and even spicy notes and a robust maltiness with lots of biscuit and caramel. Body verging on full. Quite nice.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 Sep 2014 - Keg at Euston Tap.  Hazy orange, still, small foamy white head endures and leaves light lacing.  Aroma is peachy with mixed citrus.  Body is medium, spritzy, slightly foamy.  Taste is nice and fruity - orange, lime, peach, some straw and grass, caramel sweetness, soft bitterness.  Has an aftertaste similar to pithy orange juice.  Good to see this in the UK.(4.0)
Sep 2014 - Keg at London Fields as Brown Shugga Substitute.  This has less of the intense hoppiness about it than the last glass I had.  Less defined citrus.  Still drinking pretty well.  (3.7)

32 oz bottle poured into a teku style glass. The aromas are bright and fruity. Primarily lemon, lime, orange, mango, tangerine, and pineapple. There?s also notes of rye in there and a toasted quality. There?s also a hint of cream too. It?s a clear, pale orange, effervescent beer with a slightly off-white frothy head that retains a medium thick ring with a scattering of surface fuzz, and leaves ample puffy lacing. The taste is a medium high sweet with a pleasant, and medium bitterness that sneaks up in the finish. For a "big" beer, this slick, almost thick textured beverage has more of a medium body with a light, somewhere between fuzzy and prickly, carbonation. The taste is big on fruit, more on the tropical end of things, with a piney, bready, and citrus peel bitter finish. There?s a light,  alcohol warmth as it goes down, but nothing on the palate. The aftertaste is a bit minty spicy (pine, I suppose) with roasted grains and over-toasted bread (not quite burnt, but almost). It lingers for a while, but it?s not unpleasant, almost clean.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours amber, nose is toffee malt and pine, taste is sweet toffee, dry, pine.

[keg, the Hanging Bat, Edinburgh] Slightly hazy golden pour, thin white head. I get a lot of rye on the nose initially, which leads into a piney resonance on the aroma. Tastewise, follows along the same lines. Earthy, peppery at first, before the lions share of the flavour is sweeter, piney and caramel malt [30082014]

Couldnt pass up the price on this giant bottle. Has an attractive yellow-gold color with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus fruits and piney hops all day long. The taste is of course hop forward with fruits and just a bit grainy with a dryer finish. Reminds me more of an IPA than a Strong Ale, but unlike what the label says... it definitely doesnt Suck. Cheers to Lagunitas!

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2014 From a 32 ounce bottle. Pours clear bright amber with a bubbly off white head. Tastes like alcohol, nutty, roasted malt, caramel, orange, and grapefruit hops. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like musky orange, alcohol, resin, hops.

32 oz bottle. Pours clear gold with creamy white head. Aroma is grassy and floral hops, biscuit and toasted malts, light pineapple, and light spice. Flavor is medium floral hop bitterness, toasted malts, light citrus esters, and faint spice; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Slightly hazy golden body with a thin white head. Low carbonation. Faint lacing. Hoppy aroma of mango, orange, pine, honey and pot puri. Flavour of lime jelly, tangerine and resin. Sweet and bitter at the same time. Medium body with a very oily texture. Light fizz. More of an Imperial IPA than an American Strong Ale. A very good one, too.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2014 Draft at Victorias in a fluted glass. Pale golden with thin white head and minimal lacing. Very appealing hop presence, floral and orange zest. Well balanced with dry bitter finish... Excellent!
On tap at Hops & Glory Islington. Gold clear lasting white head. It?s a hoppy butter in your face beer. Yep tastes of 8% too. wow what a beer. Big blond and hoppy. Huge. Certainly grabbed me. Ok.

Im not sure why this is under the American Strong Ale category. It is undoubtedly a DIPA. I had the fortune of trying both my first Heady Topper & Pliny the Elder about a week before I had this, and Sucks did not disappoint in the face of those two legendary beers. Awesome citrusy hop smell & taste with the perfect amount of sweet malt to give this beer incredible balance. If this beer becomes more widely available year round like Lagunitas promised, Ill probably buy one of those big quarts once a week.

Electric orange pour. Pixie stick, tangerine candy aroma, sticky and super bright. High acid pineapple flavor, sometimes a grilled flavor, sometimes canned. Malt is fulsome and thick but rather blank for contributing flavor; some biscuit, and some caramel. The hops throughout are snappy and sweet, close to tropical overkill, especially in concert with so much sugar. Good drinkability at this alcohol level. Though it leans heavy at times, it always stays punchy; the finish however is syrupy, candy fruit, sticky smack.

Keg at Euston Tap, London. Slightly hazy golden colour. White head, lace. Aroma is loaded with piney hops. Taste opens with caramel malt before a hop assault takes hold. Medium to full bodied mouthfeel. Pretty decent on the whole but hard to grasp what its trying to be. Seems maltier than a DIPA but not malty enough to be an American barleywine. Enjoyable though.

Transfer from BA review on 2-13-13-
 Served on tap in a pint glass

 Appearance  Served a golden amber color with a one finger white head. The head slowly fades over time to give a light level of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma is a nice mix of citrus hop and tropical fruit. The tropical fruit is a nice mix of pineapple, mango and tangerine with the hop being mainly of a grapefruit aroma mixed with a hint of pine hop.

 Taste  The taste begins with a nice bready and tropical fruit flavor of mango and papaya and some tangerine mixed within. With these flavors is a lighter caramel flavor which grows stronger more toward the middle and end of the taste. Also as the flavor advances, some hop flavors, mainly of a grapefruit nature, come to the tongue. While the hop flavors grow stronger in nature as the taste advances further, they never really drown out the sweeter and malty flavors as they seem to keep pace with the hop. In the end, a sweeter and malty hopped taste is left on the tongue. It is very balanced and very nice.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thicker and creamier side with a carbonation level that is on the lower side. The thicker body helps the hop flavors stand out and is great for the bready body of the beer with the lower carbonation accentuating these flavors and helping to create a very soothing mouthfeel. 

 Overall  This is a fantastic, slightly sweeter but very balanced IPA. A great drinking brew and one I will certainly seek out more often.

Bottle from Total Wine, Summerlin. Clear golden pour, thin white head. Aroma of fruity hops, caramel, wheat, slightly spicy, and grassy. Flavor is quite bitter, fruity, sweet malty with quite a huge body and a very nice balance. Great brew.

Draught keg at Euston Tap. Could smell it across the bar as soon as it was poured - like peachy hops. When sniffed up close its more like a big whiff of full-on cat pee hiding beneath the tight creamy head. Huge fruit flavours without having too sweet or heavy a backbone. Peach, guava, mango, kiwifruit. Long fruity finish with a slight dryness at the end. Soft rather than acidic. Pretty yummy all round (understatement!).
Draught at Lagunitas Taphouse. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with cotrus, floral hops, resin, peach, mango and pine. Bitter finish with floral hops, citrus, resin and peach. Exquisite brew.

Pours a nice amber gold, with a white head. Aroma has hops, with hints of apricot, caramel, and fruit. Not too dry not too sweet, creamy, and very drinkable. Taste is some hops, caramel, apricot, and the hints of fruit. Balanced taste. Nice.

32oz from a brown paper bag straight to the dome. Thanks jw. I dont know what this beer looks like but in this paper bag I feel 18 again. Sugar and hops aroma eminate from the little hole in the bag. Tastes like I might be blind in about an hour. Thank you sir may I have another.
Cloudy color with white head. Toasted malt and citrus aroma. Flavor is caramel malt with toasted notes sweet tropical fruit flavor with a pine finish.

Om man dricker sig så full på Lagunitas Sucks att man måste sjukskriva sig dagen efter kan man åberopa force majeure. Det här är en naturkraft som ogiltigförklarar alla regelverk. "Fröjda er med bävan", som det står i Bibeln. Ett finare bevingat ord om den här upplevelsen kan man inte fånga i det grovmaskiga nät som språket utgör. "Man måste alltid vara berusad. Det avgör allt: det är den enda frågan."

Very very tasty. Well integrated complexity from the 4 grains. Pours a light golden with a chunky white head. Aromas are fantastic! Notes of some pine and tropical fruits, pineapple. Palate is smooth and round with great depth. Definitely living up to the hype here.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass, 2014 release.
Aroma: malt and citrus, floral hints.
Appearance: clear, golden yellow with medium white head and moderate lacing.
Taste: citrus/grapefruit, pineapple, earthy tones, pine.
Palate: smooth, medium carbonation with a long citrus hoppy finish.
Overall: really good replacement for Brown Shugga, which I really like.

355ml bottle.
Pours a clear, medium gold, with a white head.
Hoppy, resiny aroma, spruce, apricot, caramel, grass, mineral, passion fruit, peach, faint yeast.
Off-dry, medium to full bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Hoppy, resiny, faintly grainy taste, caramel, apricot, grass, butterscotch, spruce.
End slightly grainy, and with the tiniest hint of astringency. Feels as if the hops are slightly tired (whisps of cheese?). Otherwise pretty nice. (2014-07-20)

Lagunitas Sucks is a medium hazy copper amber liquid with a full thick head of off white bubbles. Cedar hops are strong on the front of the scent profile. There might be a bit of citrus as well. Taste is tangy on the front with cedar notes prevailing, some undertones of sweetness follow as the taste finishes with a touch of bitters. Body is lively with active carbonation. I like this beer a great deal. Wish i had picked up more.

Very delicious beer left over from the holidays obviously can Tate's the IPA on the beer. Great advice don't "Don't sip life is short!"


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a golden orange with a decent, off-white head. Aroma is quite a lot of caramelly maltiness, but a lot of citrusy hoppiness as well. Taste is somewhat piney and rather resinous. Some caramel, but more citrus and mango grapefruit. Medium carbonation, rather full in the mouth. A nice sipper.

Sweet fruity aroma. Cute and very well-hopped taste. Sweet bitterness that fills the mouth a long time. Heavenly taste. I just shiver when I drink it. I really miss word for this beer. This beer is as close to perfection as you can get according to me. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear dark golden with a white head. Aroma is pine, resin, biscuit, passionfruit, some earthy and mineral notes as well. Taste is medium sweet caramel and resin, a lasting dry piney and grassy bitterness. Medium bodied and average carbonation.

Light orange colored clear beer with big white head leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma has fructosey sweet tropical fruits and berries, as well as piney hops and some caramel malts. Flavor is resinous bitter, citrusy and caramelly sweet. Palate is thick with moderate carbonation and stinging bitterness. Finishes with quite strong bitterness, leaving a sticky syrupy caramelly sweet, pale malty and resinous aftertaste. Gets progressively worse, aroma is better than flavor and aftertaste is the least good part of this. Still decent. Kind of a bridge between a DIPA and a Barley Wine. Still a bit too much syrupy caramel for me.

A - is straw yellow with white head 
A - citrus on the nose that hits you in the face. 
M - good to fair carbonation 
T - very good beer but no sub for brown shugga 
O - enjoyed the hop aroma and taste but was expecting more of a malt backbone 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Pours clear bronze/amber with a tiny head that quickly fades. Nose is sweet, syrupy, grapefruit, brown sugar and some lemon peel. Taste is sweet, malty, grapefruit and again sweet. Finishes medium bitter.

Very average but tasty ipa. We liked it it wasn't exceptional 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Golden color with a nice white head. The nose is loaded with grapefruits, tropical fruits, bread and floral notes. The taste is pine, caramel, malt and hops. A good example on a nice American Strong Ale.
Pours a nice clear golden color with white head. Pine, citrus, and some light fruit on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with more citrusy pine.
Bottle. Amber color, decent head. Aroma is citrus, source. Taste is like a sweet IPA.

Klar gyllenbrun färg med ett fluffigt lätt skum som ligger kvar länge.

Fruktig och fyllig arom med mycket humle och syrliga frukter. Citrusfrukter och gräs, den typen på tomten, inte i 

pipan. 

Riktigt bra balanserad beska. Lagom små syrliga bubblor i kolsyran. 
Syrlig åt citrushållet med en bra avslutande sötma. Toner av kola och den bästa humlen man kan välja. 

En sjukt bra överjäst ale som förtjänar en plats i någon typ av hall of fame! Does it sucks? HELL NO!
På flaska från systemet. Luktar härligt blommigt. Mörk gul färg. Bra smak av humle som avrundas med en perfekt beska som ligger kvar länge i gommen.
Clear golden color sticky foam. Some pine and citrus aroma. Big taste, bitterness with complex profile.

Bottle, swap with hackobock. Pours in clear pale body with low white head. Aroma is loaded with grapefruit, tropical fruits, watermelon, mango. Pretty complex. Taste has medium tropical sweetness with grapefruit bitterness, really fruit, well balanced. Body is full, medium carbonation, oily. Awesome.

Blindprovning med Gambrinus Uppsala (vad som visar sig vara en Lagunitasprovning). Första tanken är att alla fyra bärs är samma öl!. Dominerade husprofil? När värmen stiger i glasen så blir dock skillnaderna tydligare. Gyllene och klar. Bra humlad och lite örtigt. Aningen spretig ihängande beska men bäst av de fyra Lagunitas för kvällen.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2014 Flaske: Hjemme ovenpå en hård ølfestival. Gul klar øl med et stor skumhoved. Lidt gammel men stadig tydelig lagunitas med citrus humle og lækker mundfylde. God smag hvor man kan ane lagunitas terroir, men ikke nok for min smag.
RERATE: Quarts flaske købt på bryggeriet. Gulorange let diset brygget for en uge siden. Ekstrem frisk masser af citrus og mango i smagen. Superlækker og ærgeligt tap room var lukket en mandag.

Bottle: clear yellow colour, nice big head. Aroma is dominated of lots of citrus, orange, sweeet maltynes, and flowers. Flavors had a dominas of sweet malts, orange , citrus, dry bitternes, medium body, medium fruity/ flowery finsh! Well done!!

Flaska från SB. Gyllengul, klar, centimeterhögt krämigt skum som ligger kvar länge. Fin torr stram humleprofil, tänker östkust, kalk, citronzest, lime, grapecitrusblommig, aprikos. Rena smaker, bra balans mellan maltkropp och humle, medelstorbeska. För mig som inte har superkoll är det här en östkust-IPA och en riktigt bra sådan.
