355 ml bottle. Golden, off white head. Aroma fruity; grapefruit, lemon, apricot and pine. Taste is similar and leaves a burnt, fermented-sugar-y taste, pine and apricot in the mouth.

Bottle. Semi hazy golden amber beer with a large white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of caramel, peaches, citrus and pine needles. Flavor is fruity with notes of citrus, tropical fruit, peaches and pine needles. Great balance.

355ml bottle, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is clear golden with a medium sized frothy off-white head, that when settled left a little lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, orange peels, lemon zest and pine. Flavours of grapefruit, orange peels, lemon zest, caramel and spices. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Another great beer from Lagunitas Brewing Company.

Bottle/SB Gävle. Golden clear. Fresh hoppy nose - citrus, but sort of soft, and with a well blended caramel backing. Stone fruity, peachy apricot. Full smooth soft body. Caramel sweetness, but just enough bitters too. This is pretty well balanced. Super sort, easy to drink. Good flavour. Slightly resinous green hoppy finish. Really pretty good, silky smooth drink.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2014 10oz pour at Brewery. Real good aroma. Sweet. Citrus. Lemon orange. Jazzed golden orange. Good initial head faded to a ring. Spotty lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body thick creamy mouthfeel bitter sweet dry finish. Real good. aroma is wonderful. Told its mosaic hops. Sold as double dry hopped
 Earlier Rating: 11/29/2011 Total Score: 3.5Pint at Tylers Apex. Good aroma, sweet.  Pine, little orange. Clean golden orange. Small head, minor lace. Bittersweet. Medium, oily creamy mouthfeel, Bittersweet finish. Nice, why not an IPA?
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Peach, a lot of grapefruit, very fruity smell. Body is really light, and quite dry, fantastic for an IPA, taste is very fresh and a lot of grapefruit, very mellowed out bitterness and well balanced.

12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy amber with a medium creamy white head. Aroma has notes of citrus, bitter hops, malt and pine. Has a sweet citrus, malt flavor with hops and a strong, bitter, resinous finish.

Well balanced beer. It has a nice full body with just right amount of sweatiness that works really nice with its hoppiness. One of the best of its style, that I've tasted, I would say. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear light amber with medium white head
Aromas are hoppy of pineapple, mango, citrus, caramel
Taste also freshly hopped of citrusy and tropical fruits, with nice caramel body and resin
Very nice!

Rating from memory from a few months back. Poured golden and fairly clear. Aroma of caramel, bread,cereal, and a bit of citrus. Taste was fairly sweet from beginning to end, mostly caramel and sugary. Body was pretty light. This is listed as an American strong ale, but I found it more like a Pale. Very good beer though and this was my first time getting it. Will buy more next years release.
Poured from 12 fl oz bottle. Clear golden yellow with white head. Caramel malt, light hops and a little funk. Finishes a little light and dry.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2014 Look: pours a clear golden color. White head that disappears quickly. Lacing stays around glass.
Smell: strong hop smell. Very fruity. Tropical fruits. Very sweet. Tangerines, pineapple.
Taste: bitter taste from the hops. Some pepper. Lemons and tangerines. 
Feel: light mouth feel. But still leaves a film on your teeth. 
Overall: ok beer, not as sweet as I had hoped. Definitely a bitter hops flavor. Not What I consider a Xmas ale, but still a good beer.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours tiny hazy golden with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some lacing and trace on the glass. Smell is fruity with caramel, grapefruit juice, mango sorbet, kiwi, lemon zest, lime zest, freshly cut grass, pine needles, mineral water, peach skins and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, fruity and slightly herbal with caramel, mango puree, pineapple juice, grapefruit rinds, oily pine cones, moist grass, lemon balm, peaches, star fruit and hints of alcohol, minerals and resin. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, bitter, slightly fruity and slightly herbal with caramel, mango, kiwi, grapefruit rinds, moist grass, pine needles, lemon balm, mineral water and peaches. Feels remarkably fresh which Im pretty sure it isnt. Very nice IIPA which Id love to try proper fresh some day.

Bottle.
Clear light amber with a frothy white head. 
Aroma has pine, mango, lemon, malt.
Taste has caramel malt, pine, peppery notes.
Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth mouth feel.
Peppery piney bitter after taste.
Had expected something bigger but this is really nice!
Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, persika, aprikos, honung, granskott, örter och citrus. Lagom sötma, bra fruktighet med en lite pepprig och örtig beska. Riktigt fin.
Ljuvlig öl, kraftig humlig, sötma, fruktig i aromen. Smaken har en balanserad kraftig beska kanske lite kryddig på slutet. ABVn rundas in fint och kroppen är fyllig och perfekt kolsyard

Flaska från Systembolaget. Doft av ananas och andra tropiska inslag. En liten spritighet i smaken som för övrigt är söt, karamell, tropisk. Aningen vass men väldigt god.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. 
Golden, white head, lacing. 
Peach, cantaloupe and other tropical fruits, oranges and tangerines, some pine, caramel. 
Very nice.

Pours clear amber with medium tall frothy off-white head. Aroma of rye, caramel, light toffee, hints of citrus, light resin. Taste is initial caramel sweet followed by a long resin bitter finish that lingers. Body is fairly light and somewhat oily with soft carbonation.

Doften helt fantastisk fräsch tydliga amerikanska Humletoner. Smaken lite tunnare å lätt med medelbeska. Efter en stund tydliga toner av Padron 1964 Maduro i doften. Underligt men fantastiskt gott ihop.
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Hm, den här var nice. Mycket smak och relativt söt. Fin färg. Lagunitas levererar som vanligt.
Quite ok without picking up to any higher altitudes. Plenty of hops and thin malt.

Det här var inte dumt, smaken var fint balaserad med toner av äpple, grapefrukt, honungsmelon och tallbarr. Kroppen var härligt stabil och balansen var, som tidigare påpekats, riktigt fin. Slutsats; köp den och drick den!

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Hoppy fruity aroma, pine, mango, grass, biscuits, caramel, some nuts. Hoppy pine flavor, grassy, peach, hay, biscuits, some caramel. Fruity hop finish with pine notes. Nice.

(Bottle). Really nice hop aromatic fragrance with aromas of pine, raspberry and tangy tropical fruits like passion fruit, orange and citrus. Good and balanced taste of hops and malt, finished with a very prominent flavor of tangy fruit juice and hop bitterness. Nice!

Pours clear and golden, big, cloudy white foam with lots of lacings. Aroma is fresh juicy hops, orange, pine, some sweets. Taste is a great balance between a sweeter and a bitter side, and these two battles on throughout the entire moutfeel until the very end, where the lingering bitterness takes over. Very nice. All along its a mash-up of rye, caramell, grass, orange, citrus, hops and so on. Like an american IPA, mixed with an oily bitter and some seeds thrown in. Medium to big body, medium carbo, oily texture.

@ Havregatan. Flaska (355ml) från Systembolaget (29:-). Fruktig och rejält humlig, grapefrukt och tallbarr, tropiska frukter, rejäl beska, medelsötma, medelfyllig. Lång avslutningen som är besk och humlig.
355 ml bottle. Clear golden with white head. Smell is very much pine and grapefruit. Taste is complex malty sweet with high bitterness.
Klar gul med ljust gul-orange skum. Doft: Humle, malt, kåda, ananas, grape, lite gräs. Smak: Humle, malt, lite deg, gräs, ananas, grape. God, man vill verkligen ha mer när man smakat.
Golden, almost clear, lasting laces. Pineapple and raspberry aroma. Rather sweet taste, but well balanced with grapefruit and bitterness. Full bodied.

Bottle. Almost clear deep golden liquid with small white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, bread, mango, marmalade and biscuit. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of tangerine, citrus, mango, biscuit and caramel. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Quite nice. Ok.
UPDATED: MAY 20, 2014 Kopparfärgad med stort ljust skum. Doftar friskt och fruktigt av annanas och tropisk frukt. Samma i smaken fast lite mindre. Ok beska men lite sämre än väntat!

Bottle. Clear orange with nice compact white head. Aroma: big hoppy aroma, fruits, lots of citrus and tropical fruits . smells really fresh! Taste: big bitterness with a grapefruit note at the end, a lot of fruits and a slight dankiness, a small bready bisquity note in there. Really nice stuff!
Bottle from SB. Golden with a thick white head. Fruity and piney tones. Malt, fruit, pine neddles and hops. medium to full body with a nice bitter sweet after taste.

Lagunitas Sucks is a resin heavy, mango nosed, bitter and sweet ale. The complexity and deep hop profile here makes it an interesting and multi-layered beer with a unique taste. Highly rated by many, this is now becoming more widely distributed and will become a staple.
Great hoppy aroma with a bit of citric in it. Light golden colour with long lasting head. Hoppy taste with quite los of alcohol feel, but very smooth palate and easy to drink. Good one!

Grapefruit, citric, resinous, bready, caramely malts, tropical fruits, pine.
Amber colour, medium white head, lacing.
Big resinous bite, mid-sweet, grapefruity, noticable, but not overpowering maltbase, ABV well integrated.
Medium/fullbodied soft carbonation, bitter finish.
Very similar to a little sumpin sumpin
Flaska från Systembolaget. Guldfärgad vätska med vitt skum. Doftar grape och tropiska frukter. Maffig humlesmak med en stadig beska. Ingen antydan till alkohol. Riktigt smarrig

Flaska från SB. 
Ganska klar mörkgul med vitt luftigt skum. 
Doftar ljuvligt av humlen, tropiskt, citrus. Tror Amarillon finns där. 
Otroligt frisk och pigg, söt men går över nästan direkt i beskan. 
Bra!

@Nedre Mölla 3/5-14. Flaska från Systembolaget. Arom: Persika, aprikos(?), citrus, tallbarr, grapefrukt. Smak: Grapefrukt, citrus, tallbarr, sötma, tydlig beska. Kroppen är medelfyllig, avslutningen bjuder i sin tur på en ganska lång och rejäl beska.
Rich aroma of fresh fruits and hay, pours without a lot of head. Golden to amber color. Taste is at the same time too bitter and too sweet with hints of cough-syrup.

Bottle from SB cons 2014-05-02 Göteborg
AR: peach, pine, apricot, grape fruit, lemon juice, wee peppery
AP: copper clear, high frothy fizzy white head
F: heavy bitterness and carbonation, pine cones, apricot, lemon juice, peppery, really refreshing brew

Bottle (35 cl) from Systembolaget.  Clear amber, mmedium white head. Bready and bisquity malt aroma with piney, perfuymy tropical fruit hop aromas. Medium bodied, medium carboantion. Dry with firm bitterness.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Deep golden with a white head. 
Resinous and grassy aroma along with sweet malts. 
Sweet and oily palate. Some alcoholic notes. 
Toffee and grassy, resinous hoppiness in the flavour. Also some cough-syrup; Benylan. 
Medium bitterness.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Clear deep golden, rich head. Huge perfumy nose with lychee, pears and sweaty citrus. Mid sweet with medium-fill body and slick, well rounded mouthfeel. Rich bready malt, concentrated juicy hops - spices, tropical fruits, caramel. Really bitter finish. An impressive well balanced hop bomb.

Rating #100!
33 cl bottle. Pours clear gold with medium, creamy head. Aroma and flavor is full of pine, resin, clay, grapefruit and alcohol. Nicely balanced with clear sweet and bitter spikes in finish. Lagunitas always deliver!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska från systembolaget. Klar äppeljuicefärgad vätska med lätt, vitt skum. doft av knäck och tropiska frukter. Mango ananas och guava. Rostad och relativt fruktig smak med bra beska
355ml bottle. Hazy amber body with a medium white head. Lacing. Pine, citrus, fudge, and sweet malts. Dry finish.
Söt, väldigt syrlig smak med tydligt inslag av malt. Ljust brun i färgen. Eftersmaken söt, det bruna sockret är tydligt.

12oz bottle from Brewmasters in Wilson. Golden hue, murky clarity (I can still see my finger on the other side of the glass) with one finger thick white frothy head. Good lacing, but there was quite a bit of sediment floating around. Strong citrus hop, lemon zest, soap and floral aromas. Moderate bitter citrus hop up front with a short light lemon finish. Watery texture, soft carbonation. Good brew!!
Bottle. Pours clear dark golden. Huge fluffy white head. Great lacing. Nice pineapple hop aroma and flavor.

Notes from 1/14/2014

A - 5 - The beer is a nice golden amber color with a thick white frothy head. Leaves a nice lumpy lacing on the glass.
S - 9 - Super fresh grapefruit, orange, lemon zest, pineapple, pine. Maybe some bready malt in there but the hops are so forward they pretty much cover it up.
T - 9 - Tastes like a bag of whole hops smells. Super piney, fresh, grapefruit, mango, pineapple, citrus zest. Balanced by nice sweet malt backbone.
M - 5 - The bitterness lingers on the back of your tongue, begging you to drink more. Alc covered, aftertaste is graprfruit/piney hops. Carbonation perfect.
O - 18/20 - tomorrows plan, buy another six pack of this.

Comparables: Oskar Blues Deviant Dales, Hop Stoopid, Ruination
Flaska. Lagunitas levererar! Härlig fruktdoft. Fin väl balanserad smak som mycket bra döljer alkoholen. Myvket god lättdrucken öl.
Poured from a quart bottle. Color is a gold clear beer with a thin white head. Great carbonation. Aroma is sweet and taste is great. Truly an amazing beer to me. Something heavy yet light and crispy.

sorry... i like a variety of microbrews & i thought id like this one since the description sounded ok (& ive liked other types by this brewery), but i could not stand it & in fact its sitting in the kitchen almost totally full. i wonder why it is that i HATE this so much that i cant even finish 1/5 of the bottle?

i need to find others who disliked it as much as i did since i might find beers they like more palatable. (sorry for the non-technical review!)
Hazy yellow. Small white head. Amazing aroma of honey and hops and grass. Taste of the same. Brown sugar too. Smooth and complex. Great beer.

Mildly hazy orange with moderate carbonation, good lacing and a thin foamy head. Aroma of toffee, caramel malts, brown sugar, citrus hops and and a slight rye scent. Very malt forward with notes of caramel malts, mango, citrus hops, brown sugar, and a slight rye spiciness. Light body and moderate carbonation. Very good!
Poured from a 32 ounce bottle into a snifter. Grapefruit and pine aroma. Clear deep gold color. Grapefruit flavor balances bitterness well. A wonderful west coast ipa.
Had a pint on tap at Ashleys. Quite hoppy, a slight sweet edge on the finish. Solid, not my style.
pours gold with a one finger head. aroma is citra hops. taste is grapefruit with pineapple an a great citrus hop finish. very good beer

Bottle. Pours a clear amber with a huge bubbly white head that leaves a lot of lacing behind. Aroma is big, sweet and hoppy, of brown sugar, malt, pine hope, and a hint of candied citrus. Rich taste, of candied citrus, malt, sugar, toffee, then picks up a big hoppy bite. Lingering sweet hops. Very tasty.

On tap at Prohibition Pig, Waterbury Vermont. Golden like an IPA. Aroma is hops - smells like an IPA. Taste is the same (like an IPA). Mild hop bite on finish. Overall, just a solid, balanced India Pale.

A- pours a golden orange hue with a thick, creamy, 2 finger head.

s- smell is heavenly. Pine, sweet, malty, fruity goodness

t - pine up front followed by tangerine, orange and citrus which follows I n to a lingering bitterness.

m - thick with ample carbonation.

d - great beer. Excellent to sip on.
Pours a clear gold, with some lacing and fun carbonation. Tastes of hops, grapefruit, and just a little funk. Not really for me, but I get why others like it.

Had this on tap and from many, many bottles. OK, I dont know why they have this labeled as a strong ale, as it is a double IPA. Pours clear amber with a white head. Nose is of citrus and tropical fruits. Taste is a delicious mix of grapefruit, tangerine and tropical fruits. Mouthfeel is creamy with a nice bitter hop bite. I love this brew so much and the fact that it is only about $10 per six-pack doesnt hurt a bit. I kept searching and buying this while it was in stock. Drank cases of this stuff. Would love for this to be a regular in their lineup instead of just a seasonal.
12 ounce bottle available at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $9.99/6-pack. Very good!
Ironically better than what it was made to replace. LIght sweet, and pine taste in great balance with a great light lingering after taste.

I rate high, but this is a great beer. Lots of lacing on the glass. Thin head, crystal clear gold to orange color. Aroma of citrus fruits and slight dank malt. It has a smooth dry taste and a dry finish but lingering citrus and malt notes. I bought this because I enjoyed Brown Shugga, very very happy it is totally not even close to that beer...freakin awesome.

[Bottle] Pours a clear shade of amber. Not much head to it. Fresh and hoppy aroma. Grapefruit notes, pineapple and sweet caramel in the taste. High bitterness level lingers well into the finish. Oily texture. A solid beer overall. Tasting notes from 2/2014.

After reading the c0mmercial descripti0n, I had n0 idea what t0 expect, s0 I decided t0 rate this brew with0ut trying it. (Yes, I am kidding.) Nice p0ur, g0lden b0died, plenty 0f fast m0ving bubbles, and a tall, sustained creamy head. The ar0ma was resin0us with a t0uch 0f zest, and a (dirty) earthiness 0ver s0me grainy sweetness. Nice spritzy m0uthfeel, tickling my t0ngue. The flav0r is a bit muddled, the sweet graininess being clean, but the h0p flav0rs c0lliding with 0ne an0ther... albeit pr0viding a steady bitterness that this h0plessly h0p-headed imbiber enj0ys. Fun drink.

Clear and bright yellow! Nose: WOW! Incredible notes of resin, citrus balanced and mixed with bred malts. Amazing mouth: sweetness and tropical fruit but also caramel and fantastic hops! Great!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1- Piney aroma with some bitter orange notes. A hint of caramel.
2- Dark straw to light orange with a lacey egg white head. Brilliant clarity.
3- A medium bop bitterness followed by a big hop flavor. Pine tree chewiness. A light caramel sweetness lingers in the background.
4- Medium-full bodied with a medium-high carbonation level. A sticky mouthfeel from the high amount of hops. Finishes slightly astringent.
5- Overall I prefer the other Lagunitas beers over this one. I realize that this was a last minute beer created and for that I give it an A for effort.

Very "simple"taste. And I say simple in the best if ways. Good to sip on and let time pass by. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle:
Pours nearly clear, light amber with a creamy off-white head.
Grapefruit peel, orange nectar aroma.
Strong peel bitter and sweet tangerine flavor.
Outstanding.
Pours a hazy amber color. Citrusy, floral grass notes with a sticky resinous finish. Definitely better than the last batch of Lagunitas Sucks. Very impressed.

I know Ive had this at a bar; this time Im reviewing it at home. The aroma is hoppy (I was expecting that from Lagunitas), grassy with a ton of grapefruit and pine. Looks like most mainstream beers, only a little darker and with a longer lasting stickier head. Nothing extraordinary about the aroma or appearance. Tastes slightly sweet, pale malt first, then the trademark bitter hops that I knew were coming. The bitter taste is very short, then the sweetness comes back to combine with the hops. Very distinct and balanced taste. Palate is fairly oily, and the carbonation is just right. I would drink this again; its not too hard to find and reasonably priced. Plus, you can get a six-pack, you dont have to buy bombers. If youve never had it, you should drink it. Not 100, but pretty good.

Bottled January 4th. Poured January 29th into a Sam Adams Perfect Pint.

Appearance: A sunset orange sort of color. Very slight haze. Fantastic white, foamy head floating on top leaving tons of lacing. One hell of a sexy looking brew.

Smell: $#@&, thats GOOD. Trademark Lagunitas tea-like aroma (well, I think it smells like tea... reminds me of it...), with a wallop of grapefruit and maybe some pineapple as well. Really tropical. A nice, sweet, bright-as-all-hell, fresh picked hops. It smells phenomenal, to say the least. Nearly perfect.

Taste/feel: Again with that trademark reminds-me-of-tea Lagunitas flavor. That with the unbelievable blend of all the tropical fruit flavors you can think of (...not durian. Thats tropical, right?), a hint of grass, resinous hops, and the absolute slightest alcohol warmth... this is... really almost unreal. I was worried that Sucks would be a bit too sweet, and it starts off that way, but then theres a perfect amount of bitterness on the back of the tongue on the finish that is unbelievable. The mouthfeel is medium in texture and carbonation. The carbonation really helps to "pop" the taste buds, and it works extremely well in this brew.

Well, ladies and gentlemen, here we have probably the best beer Ive ever tasted. It pours beautifully, the smell is glorious, and the taste is a religious experience. Ive tried to think of reasons not to give this beer my first perfect rating in taste and overall rating, but I cant think of one -- this is a double IPA that every single person needs to try. The sweet, tropical, tea flavors on the front, the incredible amount of bittering hops on the finish... Sucks is every bit as good as what the majority says it is. Im kicking myself for only getting a single bottle. Lagunitas must make this year-round.

Im a Michigan boy, so it pains me to say this, but... this is a better brew than Bells Hopslam. I only had Hopslam this year once (on-tap), and it was GOOD, but it was harsher than I remember it being. I know this is 2% lower than Hopslam, but I really couldnt give a shit. This is THEE Imperial IPA.

Pours a rich yellow with a fairly thick white head. Highly carbonated. Aroma is heavy with grapefruit, pine, and citrus. Flavor is all sorts of bitter with grapefruit dominant. It never really sweetens up. Its good but it would be hard to drink more than one per sitting.
From the bottle, white head, clear yellow body. Nose is citrus and mango. Body is light, slightly dry on the finish. Mostly citrus and grass flavors. Nice beer.
Has on draft at mellow mushroom. Kids were with me. Great hop aroma stout double ipa with bitter balance.
Great pale ale packed with flavor. A hint of citrus on the pallet. This beer has a tan appearance, with little head.
So love this! Bright grassy hoppy aromas. Sweet, syrupy, citrussy. So good. Juicy hops, pine, hay?

12 oz. bottle poured into mason jar glass. Sparkling amber color with a generous white head and healthy amount of carbonation. Head retention and lacing are both good. Signature big grapefruit Lagunitas hop aroma. Flavor follows suit with the citrusy flavors up front with a smooth caramel finish. Another winner from Lagunitas.
Pours a clear amber color. One finger diminishing head. Aroma is lots of barley malts and citrus hops. Taste is hoppy as youd expect from Lagunitas. This version is a great ale.

Hoppy kind of brown. Decent, with a little roast complex. Some citrus. Pours clear mahogany with decent head and lacing. Finishes with light bitterness. Average carbonation. Thanks to bmoosey! Bottle.
Pours straw yellow with a white head. Aroma of grapefruit, caramel, pine, and hint of yeast. Well-balanced flavor with grapefruit, rye, pine, and caramel with touch of hops. Great beer.

Pour from a bottle. Nice golden haze with a medium head. Aroma is well balanced with hops, citrus, grass, malt and a hint of yeast. Taste is very crisp and refreshing. Near perfect balance of citrus, grass, pine and hops. Palate is smooth, crisp, refreshing and dances through different varieties of hops. Probably my favorite beer Lagunitas makes!

Light grapefruit nose with a hint of tropical fruit and a bit of malt. Slightly brothy as it warmed up in the glass. Medium bitterness, a bit harsh and coarse, but with a pleasant bitter finish. A good beer, but the flavors didnt quite hang together in the way that they do for great beers of this type.
32oz bottle pours a pale amber color with a bit of head. Full hop flavor yet very mellow. Mild maltiness.

12 oz. pour, on tap at Luckys 13 in Bloomington, MN. Consumed on 3-9-14. Weak aroma of light hops and cream. The smell is overwhelmed by my girlfriends nearby quesadillas. The beer doesnt smell bad, but I get very little aroma at all. Pours a clear gold with a small to moderate amount of long-lasting, off-white/cream-colored head. Produces good lacing. Hoppy, tangy, piney, dry, and slightly sour taste. Very IPA-like taste. Tangyness from the rye. Grainy flavor. Medium body. Lively and soft in the palate. Overall, the beer tastes pretty good but I can barely smell it. I count it as quite the disappointment. One of the most overrated beers Ive encountered recently, according to me.

Pale orange pour. Crystal clear. Thin white head. Aroma is knock your socks off fresh hop pellets, peach and apricot. Tangerine, bits of white grapefruit. Flavor is on the sweet side. Malt flavors are hidden behind fruity hops. About as juicy as an IPA gets. Canned peaches, dried apricots dominate the hop flavors. Bitterness is nowhere to be found. Definite focus on sweet and juicy character but still balanced. Nothin like an overtly sweet crystal bomb. Simple but absolutely mouth-watering.
Clear gold pour with white head. Aroma is grapefruit and mango. Taste follows nose with addition of zest. One of my favorites.

Draft sample. Gold in colour with medium carbonation. Great aromas of mango, white grapefruit and guava. Very tropical hoppy in the mouth as well, but with a substantial herbal note too. Theres a lean grain element there too thats hard to describe, but it definitely provides some balance. Substantial hop bitterness. Nicely done overall.
Appearance: just like everyone said. Aroma: awesome. This beer is the tits! Drink it! A superb IIPA

Pours a clear golden color. Aroma is dank pungent hops. Flavor is more pungent hops with a slightly garlic/onion character. Finishes bone dry with a very smooth bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very solid imperial IPA from Lagunitas. Has a large amount of hops and bitterness but it goes down pretty smooth.

Golden with a thick white head. Aroma is piney hops with a bit of resinous sap. Flavor is restrained pine hops with a somewhat sweet malt backbone. Very drinkable.

Wife: 3.75

Very clear amber colored pour, lots of bubbles, durable head. The looks remind me of Sierra Nevada Celebration, and thats a very good start. The smell was highly potent out of the glass at an arms length. Very citric hops with a touch of pear, and the intensity is great. I could just smell this beer for a while. The taste another hop assault, as the grapefruit, tangerine, and bitter orange flavors just hit all at once. The malt is not much of a presence here except providing some sticky sweetness. Medium dense and creamy feeling in the mouth. This was a very well crafted DIPA. There is of course no substitute for Brown Shugga, but I hope they keep this one around too. Otherwise they would really suck :)

Pours a dark straw to very light copper color. Thin white head. Hoppy aroma with a bit of grain/rye. Complex flavor. Can pick up the rye. Crisp. Lots of hop flavor. Bitterness from start to finish but seems to hit different parts of the tongue.

An almost perfect west coast IPA. Crystal clear amber in color, with a sticky white head. Intensely hoppy nose, with a flavor to match. A really amazing example of the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[5309-20130429] 12floz bottle. Fruity orange hops aroma. Slightly hazy, bright orange red body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Fruity orange citrus grain flavour. Medium body has a bitter bite. Good, nice balance. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5
(@ The Farmhouse, Burlington, VT)

Received, pleasingly unexpected, in a trade with BMoosey. Bottle poured into my IPA glass. Nice clear golden pour with amazing aroma. Flavor is very nice more malt driven than I expected. Very nice beer would like more please.

Bottles from my local grocery that carries a solid selection of beers. Drank most of the six pack from the bottle but I poured one out for the purposes of a review. Pale amber pour. Hoppy, grassy, resin-forward aroma. Medium bitter with a pleasant sweetness at the end ostensibly giving the beer its "Brown Shugga Substitute" moniker. Slightly oily, bittersweet finish. Nice beer.

Pours slightly hazy rich gold, white head. Aroma of fruity and floral hops. A touch of sweetness and some interesting flavors that I think are coming from the addition of multiple grains. Hops dominate though and are more citrus than the nose. Hop character lasts for the long, pleasantly evolving finish. An interesting little twist on a hop-forward American IPA.
bottle. Amber with one finger head. This is an absolutely glorious IPA. Huge fruity flavor with a major hop punch. Awesome. One of my favorite beers ever.

It has beautiful color and a big, creamy head... Aroma is intensely hoppy; I find it to be dominated by floral/spiciness, herbs, some faint bread, very earthy. Taste is less bitter than other IPAs but extremely flavorful, balanced sweetness with a dry finish that always makes it hard to appreciate the beer at higher temperatures.

Pours a crystal clear orange with a golden tint. Fresh examples show strong, dank hops. Bright, juicy citrus hop flavors lead to some resinous notes on the back of the palate. Crisp, dry & refreshing. Very easy to drink. Hoppy bitterness lingers on the palate & it is nearly impossible to stop reaching for the glass. A benchmark IPA.
Clear golden pour with a nice white head and nice white lacing. Hoppy citrus and slight pine nose. Very hop aggressive taste without much bitterness.

How have I not had this before!?! By far the best Lagunitas beer Ive had and one of my new top 5 IPAs Ive had so far. Heavy on the citrus and tropical fruit notes which I love in an easy drinking IPA. Cant wait until next years release!

Drank from a tulip, pour a clear copper color and had a slight wheat and hoppy nose, the tast is excellent it starts out with a simple hop forward taste, then goes has a wheat/oat body and finishes with a clean hoppy aftertaste. that lingers. overall at 7.8% its insanely drinkable and enjoyable
Pretty good beer. I was a bit let down. Wish it had a hoppier taste. Thanks Kevy. Maybe their best beer.
Pours clear gold/orange with a thick white head. Aroma is citrus, a little pine and straw. Taste is... well, think a little sumpin sumpin but a bit stronger, with more malt, a bit sweeter.

Other than being a very clear golden brew it smells and tastes like grapefruit juice. It has that sweetness that is followed by the acidic bitterness, just about like drinking grapefruit juice. So while yes that is the initial reaction after a few drinks there is more to it but it is not a major contribution to the overall taste. Luckily I like grapefruit juice so its a pretty good brew in my book.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2014 Always been a bigger want from me especially from this brewery. Pours a really nice golden color. Looks better than the average IPA and more distinct. Huge pine aroma. Big hoppy pine taste upfront. Taste blends into a citrusy grapefruit and orange based flavor that is really spot on. Hop feel lingers on the tongue. EXTREMELY drinkable. Really good stuff.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a Dogfish Head pint glass.

The color is a clear orange/gold with a finger or so of foamy white head and some thick lacing left on the glass.

The smell is hops with a backup of sweet malt aroma that sits towards the back but can not be ignored. There is a candy-like aroma there that has a touch of grape Fundip.

The taste is less hoppy then expected, the malt is there first with some sweetness to start things off before going quickly into some flavorful fruity hop bitterness. This beer may have some age on it so its a little drawn back from what I remember from having a fresh one in the past. This still holds up and in some ways is more flavorful with the bitterness in the back seat and more of fruit flavor is detectable without being over shadowed.

The feel of this beer is medium bodied and is a better drinker then anticipated. Its smooth going down and does not give as much punch to the pallet.
Pours hazy gold with white head, the haze is big chunks of sediment. Aroma is tropical fruit. Nice tropical fruit and citrus hop profile. Caramel malts, not terribly bitter. Really good.
Alright, whatever this is, it is okay. It has a complex maltiness and some nice grain accents. Im not in love with this thing like many on here seem to be.

2013 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours a clear light amber-copper color with a frothy off-white head with sticky lacing. Aroma is piney and herbal hops with caramel and some mango and other tropical fruits. Taste is sweet caramel malt with a slight flowery and herbal bitterness. Also a strange, almost minty taste that I can't quit put my finger on. Possibly some alcohol coming through. A dry medium mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Havent had the BrownShugga ale, which this is a substitue for, but this tastes pretty good to me! It has guava and orange in the aroma, and a light, clear, golden color. Great hoppy, flowery taste.

Growler fill from tasty bev. Tastes very much like a normal lagunitas brew. The main defining feature of this beer is its very floral and fruity nose. More so than the normal lagunitas lineup. Smells like a garden, not very bitter, with a good bit of piney hoppiness (Which is expected from them). Smells great, tastes ordinary for them.

Medium amber body floats a creamy off white head that leaves decent lacing. Smells of citrus and juniper and cut hay, mango and orange, caramel. Taste is mango and juniper, bitter orange, faint honey in the finish. Palate is rich and thick, carbonation is fine and light, perfect. This is really fine beer. Just a touch bitter on the finish to be something I want all day, but so close!

Fresh Winter 2014 bottle, drunk 2/21/14As I get towards the bottom, Im not too concerned to be careful to not pour yeast sediment in to the glass, since its Lagunitas. Thusly, a clear pour is amber-gold and produces a small white head that fizzles away to light cover, quickly.Damn. The nose does smell really nicely hoppy and balanced. Juicy fruits, very light orange rind and pine on the end, and just a bit of pale malt sweetness. Clean, no esters, alcohol or vapors. Just fresh hops and malt.Orangey hop flavor washes over the palate as a soft but rich honeyed-sweetness balances. The carbonation is stiff and too peppery, disrupting the continuity at first. Very bitter throughout and ending with Heavy pine bitterness. It quickly builds up and soon Im not reaching for my glass quickly any more. At 8%, thats fine and this is a good sipper. Its clean, with alcohol warming and pine resin to the max, but very well-done production-wise (aside from the fact that I still wont concede to filtering being good).

Caramel, grapefruit, and pine resin in the aroma. Bitter, fruity pine flavor with a little lingering fruit sweetness and some alcohol in the finish. More of an IPA than a pale ale, but still really tasty.

Bottle in hotel room crystal river.. Light golden amber... Massive pineapple and passion fruit nose... Very sweet fruit front... Very floral ... Light bitter juicy orange and passion .. Little herbal.. Ok

Tap. Pours golden with a small white head. Tropical fruit, light pine, sweet bread, and floral hops come to mind. Bitter citrus and fruity hops galore! Drinks pretty good and moderate carbonation. Nice stuff

Pours a golden yellow color that has a sparkle to it. Aroma is distinctly floral along with its taste. Notes of grass, herbs, and high amounts of malt are tasted in this beer. A decent IPA that was complex and made with quality.

Golden straw with a big head. Smells mostly like tropical fruit with hints of grass and hops. Flavor is at first subtle and unremarkable but blooms into bread, hops, fruit and just a hint of brown sugar. Foamy in the mouth. Very different and quite good.

On tap at PreFunk Boise. Very nice clear golden with a dense and lasting off white head. Big fresh citrusy aroma. A big bitter flavor. Ligt malts but something else. Similar to the "wild" IPAs of their past. Some tropical fruit as well. Smooth creamy body and mild carbonation.

Draft at the Distillery in Savannah, GA. Holy shit! Beautiful, almost Pilsner looking pour with a two finger pillow white head. I could smell the aroma from about 2 ft away. Pine resin, pine tree, Christmas tree, spruce, douglas fir, you name it....it smelled like pine. Walking through a damned Oregon Pine forest pine. The taste...pine! Great, fairly light IPA taste but the pine and pine bitterness was amazing and fresh. Little cereal and bread. Great carbonation. Finish is pine. Fuck it...probably the best DIPA Ive ever had. I could drink this until the cows come home. I dont have any cows so that would be a long time.
Definitely one of the best beers I?ve had. Perfect balance of smooth and happy with a clean finish.

Bottle from 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. Pours a dull copper color, little to no head. Aroma burnished resin, some caramel malt notes, too. Body full and round, with a well-balanced, if slightly syrupy finish. Not a go-to for me, but I get why people like it.

(bottle - 12 oz) Gold orange pour with a fizzy head. Lots of pine and grapefruit in the aroma. Flavor has a good amount of grapefruit which helps to balance out the bitter resin flavors. Really smooth and really easy to drink.
12oz bottle pours a pure amber with a thick white head excellent lacing. Aromas of, citrus, spruce, and fresh hops. TG Pseudo Sue might get jealous. This is one excellent brew.
Bottle from trader joes. Aromas of tea, grass, notes of honey. Taste is bitter, with balance, and long length.
Wow!!. This is a great beer for Budweiser prices. If u see this beer in a liquor store you should definitely buy it.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass. An enjoyable IPA. Strongly bitter balanced out by a strong malt presence. While they keep each other in check, this is an intense IPA. Still, for the abv, a fairly easy drinker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Outstanding because, although ordinary-looking in the glass, and nice-smelling on the aromas, this beer is incredibly complicated on the palate and tastes like a dream. Simultaneously dark and sweet, hoppy and light, with all of the juicy grapefruit, orange notes you want in an IPA and all of the lavender and floral notes you want from a tripel. Beautiful stuff.

12 oz bottle. Poured a clear straw color with a white top and some lacing. Strong hoppy aroma. Tastes much of the same, floral, spruce, citrus, and herbs. Medium-high carbonation, medium body. Overall, nice hop flavor, not overly bitter.
Pours amber colored with small white head. Small lacing on the glass. Floral and citrus aroma. Taste is very hoppy, slighty bitter, goes down smooth with a musky aftertaste. Overall a very good IPA

"Brown sugga substitute" bottle. Pours a clear rich gold, effervescent, large long lasting dull white head and a ton of lace on the glass. Aroma is pine, grapefruit, lightly spicy, and a decent malty backbone. Flavour is pine, citrus, tropical fruits, medium-high bitterness, mild alcohol warming, mildly spicy and bready + caramel malt backbone. Enjoyable, pretty easy drinking, well balanced and if you dont watch itll get you drunk!

On tap at Toronado, February 2014.

Golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, grapefruit and some malt. Similar taste. Relaxed, balanced and easy to drink. An descent one.

Bottle to glass, the aroma was fantastic. Aroma was grapefruits and citrus, spiciness of rye as well. Very pleasant nose. Cloudy in appearance. Very good malt backing to match the hops, more balanced than I expected. A little sweeter than I would have liked but it wasn't that out of place when the aftertaste of the hops comes in.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours light gold, good presentation. Beer has a strong hop flavor, but not overwhelming like Hopslam or similar beers. Palate sits in the bitter zone for about 2-3 mins then fades out. Not boozy at all despite relatively high ABV.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2014 The only thing that sucks about this is I didnt try it sooner. Aroma is malt, citrus, rye and wheat. Poured into glass. Pale gold, moderate lacing and head. Taste is malt, citrus and lingering bitterness. Nice mouthful not to dry. Very good easy to drink, especially at 7 plus percent. Another great beer from a great brewery! Cheers
Bottle. Big citrus hops in the nose. Holy cow! Taste is a mash of grapefruit and grains. Definitely get a little rye and wheat.

Bottle. As for the nose, the room is filled with orange-citric and dank wooden hops before I even get the crown all the way off, strong caramel base with dough and spice, plenty of rindy-pithy character and wonderful lychee and mango, guava. Pours rich clear golden with lower-than-average carbonation and a large creamy white head. Taste medium bitter, lightly sweet but drying out somewhat and resolving to that nice bread, which meets a subtle warmth at the back of the throat. Very oily with lighter resinous qualities, strong hoppy flavors remain and have additional grassy/herbal notes here on the down-low. Clean medium body not as crisp as Id like. Very bright, alive, and yes, joyous! Awesome stuff.
Bottle pour avg gold. Nose grapefruit citrus on resin. Taste grapefruit bite up font followed by resinous hop. Early palate through mid sweetness. Nice bitter finish.

Pours a lovely amber with a quickly dissipating head and a noticeable amount of carbonation. Smell is rather complex; a variety of malts and hops of the citrus variety. The taste is surprisingly bitter. So very easy to put down for such taste, flavor, and alcohol content.

12 oz bottle picked up in Asheville only to find Lagunitas is now in Ohio. Pours a clear dark golden/light amber color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have nice citrus, orange, tangerine, some resiny hops, lightly toasted bread, a hint of spicy character with mild to moderate bitterness. Very tasty beer at a reasonable cost.
Six pack from BevMo. Easy drinker with a tropical aroma. Stands up to Sculpin and costs a bit less. On the go to list from now on.
Bottle. One of the better "six-pack" IPAs out there. Smells good but taste is better -- a nicely bitter grapefruit bomb. Easy drinker. Hard to beat for the price.

2/10/14. Bottle. Classic Lagunitas profile. A little heavier and more complex malt profile than their IPA. Same hop nose and mouth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nose and taste are of grapefruit and pine. Another outstanding effort from Lagunitas. They can mix the four cereals any time they like.

Looks gorgeous. Golden honey-yellow color, light, very transparent. Head is slightly cream-colored but frothy. Smells of citrus and hops. Tastes sweet and fruity. Pineapple and grapefruit and a lot of it. Slight spice from the rye. Kind of sticky at the end though. Incredible aromatics from the hops balance things out at the end; maybe it could afford a little more?

Format: Bottle from Whole Foods, Redwood City
Appearance: Light orange amber
Aroma: Pine, floral hops, citrus rinds, marijuana
Taste: Pineapple, refreshing hoppy bitterness, oranges, some rye sharpness
Texture: Crisp with some resiny aftertaste
Overall: So light, refreshing, raw, bitter and rich at the same time... someone turn up the Cutty Ranks Sound System.

Nearly clear orange pour with a 1 finger, creamy, soapy white head. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, cereal and citrus, fruity, floral and light tropical fruit hops. Flavor is nice toasty cereal and sweet malt up front, lots of citrus hops, straw, dull, doughy yeast, very faint medicinal notes and dirty minerality to the finish. Medium body, syrupy to chewy entry, medium, blanketing carbonation. Pretty good overall, a little syrupy and kind of simply, but tasty.

Pour is mostly clear orange amber with a fairly tight white head and strong lacing. Nose has a bit of caramel malt and notes of bread. The hops are citrusy and piney. Taste is balanced as well, sweeter caramel malt, bread is a bit lighter. Hops in back, more bright than the nose, lots of grapefruit and pineapple. Lighter body, strong carbonation, dry clean finish.

Pours unclear yellow golden. Medium, very creamy white head, fairly lasting with lace. Great, aromatic, hoppy aroma; super fruity, citrus, light pine, grapefruit especially, hint of peppery/spiciness, weedy. Flavor follows. Full body. Pulpy grapefruit. Great balance. Moderate sweetness and bitterness. Shockingly smooth and easy to drink. Smooth. Rounded. Great subtle rye. Soft and creamy. Awesome... Love it.
It smells so good, I just want to bathe in this. Very hoppy, grapefruit, citrus, some spices, citrus, a little pine. Taste is so smooth, citrus, grapefruit, pine. Light smooth finish. Super.
From a bottle. Awesome pine smell, gold color w/ nice foamy top. Hops hit you hard but finishes amazingly smooth. Im new at this beer rating stuff but I suspect this one is hard to beat!

Draft at Caliente in Pittsburgh. First sips reveal strong hops and a mellow creaminess going down the throat. Plenty of complexities and a strong body, perhaps a little on the flat side. Not perfect, but close to excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2014 On tap at Blackthorn Pub, Holly,MI...beautiful golden pour with white lacy head. I was in love at the first sip...bursting with a citrus grove and pine forest with each a distinct and awesome presence. This has an especially woody flavor that finished with a dry resinous bite. I have to have more!
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Draft: pours golden orange with a foamy head. Aromas of grapefruit, citrus and caramel. Taste is wonderfully balanced, bitter hops playing side by side with a breadiness. Ckean finish... Tasty.

Pours a nice golden color with a thin white head and decent lacing. Aroma is reminiscent of an ipa but with a rye undertone and malt sweetness. Tatse is a great mix of bitter hops, sweet malts, and rye. Very well balanced. Great beer!

Great aroma pour from bottle. Notes citrus, great not overpowering hop bite asks you to drink more! Great pick up.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

yellow golden pictorial summer hay beautiful clarity, white head holds to the tulip glass, builds rings tat stick around to the sides of the glass, 
low malt aroma, a subtle biscuit character, strong hop presence, fruitiness, piney, grapefruit rind, sweet orange, alcoholic aroma, a bit of an earthy, grassy note, 
big fruit peel, clean bitterness, low malt presence, medium hop flavor, for the amount of alcohol in this beers its hiding its self well. a soft bitterness hangs around with a taste of sugary sweetness(honestly i think its a play from the hops)
semi dry, light medium body, the liquid glides over the taste buds, medium carbonation.
overall, a great beverage one i look forward to every year. it has a great fruity hop flavor and is not over the top with the hop bitterness, its like an American west coast light triple with chico yeast.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Pours golden amber with a finger of thick white head. Smells of pine, hops, citrus and grapefruit. Taste bitter but super smooth. Huge pine needle taste, grapefruit and resinous hops. Medium body, light carbonation.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance is a light orange/yellow colored yet somewhat hazy body, foamy white head appears and dies to a film coating the top of the beer. Some nice rings are left sticking to the sides of the chalice.
The smell is an abundance of grapefruit up front backed up nicely by some light lime, lemon and pine. It comes across very strong as the beer sits on my coaster less than a foot away from my nose and I can still smell it. Some other hops are there but not as intrusive as the grapefruit ones. The malts are there slightly.
The taste is bitter and eventually gets slightly sweet as the beer warms. The grapefruit is tasted all the way down.
The palate is about a medium but doesnt come across that sessionable with a sticky aftertaste, and gets slightly syrupy and the finish is dry, The ABV is hidden well.
Overall, this is probably the most forward grapefruit DIPA Ive ever had, no worries, I liked it a lot and cant wait to see this next year.
12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of cereal, resin, citrus, and caramel. Taste is citrus pine and a Hint of the malt

Bottle; Pour is fairly clear, light golden, with a frothy, fine bubbled, two finger white head into this glass. It retains fairly well, with a ton of cobweb present. The nose is floral, piney, caramel, biscuits.... The flavor profile is clean initial ; it moves to bread, cereal, tropical sweetness presents itself with grapefruit notes and light grasses - Bittering notes are modest, with cracker crust and pine rounding things out. I found my tastebuds wanting more out of this one - a more robust version, basically.
Clear golden well-carbonated body w/ white head & amazing lace. Tropical, grapefruit, floral nose. Light hop flavors finish dry & clean.

Pours a somewhat hazy golden/orange with solid fluffy head. On the nose are floral hops, fresh oranges/orange juice, grapefruit, definitely fruity on the nose mellowing out the hops. Taste is very fruity, much orange juice, grapefruit, strong but balanced hop character, somewhat sweet, touch of resin, moderate carb. Quite literally bursting with flavor, extremely balanced. A top tier IPA.

Rating #947 - February 2nd, 2014 - #beerguychrisgeekbeer Week 5. Super Bowl Beer. Special order bottle from coop. Love beers with a haphazard story line, and mumble mumble, this beer speaks volumes about thrown together for the helluvit. Pours a copper amber, and exudes hoppiness right from the get go, powerful citrusy, grapefruity, fruity hops on the nose. Medium heavy carbonation, medium alcohol warmth. ABV disguised by hop character, truly and boldly. Extremely balanced, pleasant sweetness, smooth bitterness. Lots of fruit, lots of rye and malt, lots of hop bitterness. So gewd. Doesnt suck at all.

Bottle. Pours clear gold/orange with good carbonation. Citrus and floral nose with strong dank hop notes. Good hop bite & bitterness with solid balanced malt sweetness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What a great beer. No surprise though coming from Lagunitas. Aroma has a pleasant, mild pine aroma. Appearence is clear orange. Nothing special. Head disappeared fairly quickly. Taste is, on the other hand, very special. Sweet carmely start, with a rich, hoppy middle that melts away. Sucks? Ha!
Bottle. Golden orange color with small white head. Big citrus hops and sweet malt. Light body and easy to drink. Hides the alcohol very well.
Pours a clear light gold with white head. Has a strong floral aroma. Taste is strong with floral hops, some citrus, and light spices. Has a light bitter aftertaste but not overwhelming.

On tap as part of a flight at Brewers Tasting Room, St. Pete, FL, on January 22, 2014.Clear honey color, white head. Citrus, hoppy, sweet, caramel scent. Caramel, citrus aftertaste. Medium to fizzy mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Resin bitter finish. Sweet, caramel, hoppy, citrus scent.

Bottle shared with northropfrye. Colour of cognac or whiskey or something. Lacing is appealing. Luminous and entrancing colour like a jewel. Flavour is filled with sweet bitterness that keeps me coming back for more. Id like to have more of it.

A fabulous APA. Reminds me a bit of TG PseudoSue. Fabulous citrus aroma, lots of tropical fruit. Body is a light amber with white head and some lacing. Taste is wonderfully balanced, bitter, sweet and fruity, hoppy, pine, citrus, resin. Really great APA.
Oh, I see now this is an ASA, not an APA. Nevertheless, would would you call this a double APA?

Has a aroma of sweet pine or soured fruit. The pour was a perfect golden crisp color of a fresh Budweiser. Kick, smash, boom! Beer hits the tongue and you the fresh lemon zest taste and it rolls into a smooth bitter, maybe sour finish on the palate. Overall , eh!

Pours out golden and with an orange blush on it. Fat creamy head of off white foam that lasts and leaves sticky lace. I was expecting a bigger nose but its a bit shy. Sultry even. It has a tropical fruit sweetness and bit of mango. Soft suggestion of pine but nothing sharp. Fresh ripe orange and a bit of sugar for a malt presence on the nose. Some orange peel to really sweeten it and brighten it. Taste is a light delicious juicy mouthful of liquid fruit. Fresh orange with tropical underpinnings. Gentle pine. The malt is supple and graceful and like a bit of sugar. It drinks with a bit of hop oil on the body of the beer, thin and has a touch of sticky resin to coat the mouth and leave a softly moderate bitter. Dries the palate and finishes with a faint spice and a bit more bitter with a pleasant aftertaste like fresh orange juice. There is no alcohol on this beer save for a touch of warmth. Drinks so easily and has an amazing lightness .

Tap at New	Bohemia. Truly a great representation of the style. A visually appealing beer with an orange color and well-clinged lacing. Incredibly smooth and easy to drink. Malt driven sweetness but that presence of hop throughout. This is a very solid brewery and I would put this double IPA up as their best effort.

Pours a clear golden orange with a fluffy white head. A somewhat soapy note on the nose, lots of citrusy hops, sticky pine, and a nice bit of malt. Very smooth taste, pineapple and mango, orange rind, and a nice bready malt note. Super fresh juicy tasting citrus and tropical fruits, and a nice malt backbone. Delicious.

Grapefruit and pine aroma. Pours a cloudy honey gold with a thick white head that fades relatively quickly leaving lots of lacing. Graefruit. Pretty sweet. Mouth coating. Hard candy like texture. Very smooth. I thought this was going to be really bitter but it's not. It's very smooth.

wonderful aroma of pine and resin perhaps a grapefruit or lemony hint as well..nice clear amber gold color thin white head..taste..NOW you get the rye and oats nice and strong to balance the hoppiness mentioned in the aroma,very well done..the palate is rather light-med bodied and well carbonated with a bitter dry finish overall its cool that a beer called "sucks" might actually be one of their best beers
On tap at the Saucer. Light pour with a white head. Aroma is sweet, sticky, an drywall. Taste is pine, dry spice, and
On tap at Flying Saucer. Golden orange color. Smells of sharp citrus and pine. Taste has a slight body odor? Not quite sure what that is. Not terrible...
Very balanced. Tastes like a much lower abv beer. Slightly sweet with citrus hop character.
Great citrusy flavor. Tastes like a lower alcohol beer. Hops flavor doesn't have an overly bitter aftertaste.

Pours a highly carbonated golden color with a bright white head. Aromas of lemons, sweet ruby grapefruit, and pines. A lemony and bready taste. A very lively carbonation and slightly oily mouthfeel. A pleasnt dyness in the finish. It does suck that there is no Brown Sugga available but this will do well as a substitution.

Lagunitas Sucks pours a mostly cloudy bronze orange with an eggshell white head that lasts nicely and leaves excellent lacing. The aroma is rye bread, resin and earthy. The flavor is resin, rye bread and earthy. Overall this is a delicious brew that says just the opposite of the beers name - it does not suck. I would recommend anyone who enjoys some good hops to give this a try.
Very much a hoppy beer. Nice bottle pour, aroma is citrus hops, and appearance is golden with a decent head. Taste is very balanced! Solid malt background that is perked up by the hoppy goodness!
Most people Ive shared this will claim it to be a Sumpin Sumpin Round 2 but I think it is a step above. Definitely the beer I want to end my days with.

Pours a thick slightly off-white head, with descent carbonation and a nice lace. Color is a clear light gold. Smells very aromatic, complex with a strong hop aroma. Taste up front is piney and semi sweet leaving a hoppy bite on the finish. A very good beer that I would drink again and recommend to my friends.

Smells STRONGLY of pine. Im talking as strong as the smell I get around Christmas when I walk into my house right after my family has brought in the freshly chopped down pine tree and its opening up its boughs. Drinking the first one of the six pack straight out of the bottle so cant really rate appearance buuut it gets a five from the bottle. This is an amazing IPA with a wonderfully strong yet smooth pine and hop flavor. Nice bitterness, not overpowering but still there. A great beer.
Strong pine, grape fruit, malt and a mild sweetness in the aroma. Clear golden color and small head. Strong citrus and bitterness with a bit of roastyness on the back end. Good beer
I am in love with this IPA perhaps my favorite of all time. Cant wait for the 32oz bottles to some out!!

Pretty good. This does not suck. Not the Brown Shugga, but a different type of good.

Hoppy, piney aroma and taste. Clear yellow. Small white head.

Pours a golden color with small white head that goes quickly. Aroma is very fruity, lots of orange and citrus. Taste is also very fruity, with some bitterness to finish it off. ABV is barely noticeable. Overall a very smooth, easy drinking beer.

This beer is awesome! I literally wait for it to come out every year. So tasty, best Lagunitas out there. Also, the person from the brewery wrote a hilarious description of this beer so freekin cheers! Eliana says its the best beer shes ever smelled. F-yeah!

American strong ale? IIPA? Whatever the style is it is very damn good! Aroma hits strong and amazing smells like wriggles juicy fruit. Very interesting. Alcohol is very well hidden and sneaks up on you. Amazing beer. Never even heard of this one and ironically was searching for another 6er of brown shugga as I was gonna attempt to age a few bottles. Glad I discovered this. Great brew!

Bottled December 16, 2014.
Appearance: The body is crystal clear, showing off lazy and wide spread carbonation bubbles in the golden to light amber hued body. The head is short and soft looking, forming a dense white head.
Aroma: The aroma is heavy on citrus, lots of orange and apricot along with a hint of pineapple. The aroma isnt overly strong, but its not shy either.
Taste: This is a very nice flavorful and enjoyable IPA. Lots of citrus, like the aroma, with a lingering pineapple. The malt base is firm providing a mild sweetness to balance the beer out. The finish has a strong bitterness that almost comes off as astringent, grapefruit like.
Palate: Full-bodied and moderately carbonated.
Overall: This is a very enjoyable IPA, it reminds me a lot of Victorys Hop Ranch actually. This is a bit of a better value though and perhaps a bit better balanced. This is a must try for every hop head!

Great fruity citrus aroma as soon as opening the bottle. Color is orange gold with a nice off white head, disappearing quickly but with lots of nice lacing. Taste is floral, citrus, hoppy bitter, with some sweetness. Excellent iipa!

1/24/14 6 pack ($12.99) bought at CBO. 
GREAT GREAT BEER!!!
Easily one of my top 3 IIPA. 

Pours an orange-gold with an inch of foam, lacing throughout drinking it. The nose oozes tropical fruit. Dan asked of I out juice in the bottle I gave him. The taste had plenty of tropical fruit and just a hint of pine. 
GREAT GREAT BEER!!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Just a great experience throughout. Best part is the aroma that comes at the start. Classic smell. It finishes smooth and easy. A refreshing ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle. Appearance: finger of white head that diminishes quickly, small white film lasts, golden orange yellow color, clear, beautiful. Aroma: resin, floral, citrus, more citrus, bread, hay, nuts. Palate: light body, sticky texture, average-soft carbonation, bitter and lasting finish. Taste: light sweetness as it hits your tongue, then waves of bitterness wash over you. Overall, wonderful wonderful beer. Very hoppy, but in control and well balanced.

I dont think this is what the Lagunitas marketing experts had in mind, but I have looked at this brew in various coolers for several years, and getting past the Lagunitas Sucks label, I was still deterred by the Brown Sugar Substitute. I dont generally like my beer brown or sugary.

Well, my mistake for not trying it sooner. What a remarkable brew, and still in the Lagunitas style of full bodied and flavorful ales. Mentioned before that my sense of smell is not the greatest, but opening a bottle of this, I was knocked over by the fruity aroma... like a glass of fruit punch! Naturally enough, this carries over into the flavor which is nicely balanced and covers the high ABV kick. Damn great brew!

Bottle into a large snifter. Pours a perfect pale gold. Healthy amount of just off-white head that held pretty well, and faded into a medium-thin collar and a thin head that held until the glass emptied. Lacing is spotty, but pretty good. Aroma is a really interesting dance between pine and citrus hops with a nice supporting cast of a medium malt base. Though, the more I sniff, the more I pick up on the citrus over the pine. Taste is surprisingly malt centered. I get some tropical hops character in the front, that moves into more of the grapefruit, then some pine, then back to citrus; all being held up by this really great malt sweetness. Carbonation is a bit high for an IPA, but Im kinda digging that. Body is medium to full.

Whoa this one a quaffer, could not drink slowly....on draft...head was sticky beautiful ...color near perfect golden with slight orange.... Bready,,little yeast, fresh hops on front but NOT bitter.....hides strength well although very slight alchohol sweet......wolfed down 3 pints, delicious , I hope the bottle version is close to this......

Fresh bottle. Reddish gold pour with white head. Aroma is big citrus. Taste is exquisite - nice citrus with resin, pine of the hops and well balanced malt. Such a great balance here. This one is juicy and the light, semi-sweet finish lingers on the tongue. Refreshing and great.

As versatile as a beer can be. Pours to a huge head with graceful lacing. The gloriously hoppy aroma, mixing a pine forest and a citrus grove, does NOT lead to a tongue-curling bitterness. Instead you have that cereal combo platter creating the liquid version of MultiGrain Cheerios, nice and full bodied, with the bitterness just dancing around the edges. Long, long finish that eventually is dry but has gently rolling waves of sweetness and bitterness along the way.

Tap. Pint glass. Light gold with big frothy white head. Hoppy resin aroma. A bit of grapefruit taste, then oily and resin. Crisp with long lasting dry finish. Very lagunitas and very good. Does not suck.

Damn, this beer kicks arse! The pour is a golden yellow with a big frothy head with aromas of floral, fruity hops. This beer is sticky, resinous and seriously hopped with citrus and floral flavors backed with a malty, sweet body. Very fresh and very good!

Pours clear gold with a light creamy head which subsides to a light lacy topper. 

Major pine and citrus on the nose. Light bodies with medium carbonation. Lingers just a bit in the palate with a hint of bitterness. 

Drinks smooth with a perfect balance of hoppiness and malts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Surprisingly light looking. Toasted grains, caramel, grapefruit and a healthy amount of hop bitterness. Malty and a bit thick feeling. Alcohol is well hidden.

Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a nice transparent gold with very little head and a bit of lacing. Aroma of citrus, oranges and pineapples mostly, with subtle hoppy hints. Taste is almost reverse, with upfront bitterness that fades into a floral sweetness. Very very nice beer.

12oz bottle - pours a vibrant gold , off white head with heavy lacing . Piney resinous aromas . Mild grapefruit , mango and tangerine flavors . The upfront bitterness leads to an almost mildly sweet and fruity finish . Outstanding ! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
1/22/2014. From bottle. Amber color with a white head. Hoppy aromas, almost like an IPA with spice and tropical fruit. Bitter, malty, hoppy - so very good!

Good strong beer. Has a little bit of a different taste to it but it's still delicious. Not sure what it would pair with.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Despite what the label says, lol, this is a fine replacement for Brown Shugga. Hoppy like an IPA, not sure why its styled as an ASA, but thats fine, I would have maybe put it in the red/amber ale category, abv isnt high enough for an ASA. Reddish pour, thicker than thought, nice aroma of pine and citrus, maltier than an IPA, caramel and pancake like flavor. Nice one.

Bottle: Clear, deep straw or golden and good medium head. Massive hop lift. Very green aromatics. Slightly rubbery and certainly piney. You cant see the malt. Dry, not sour and bitter. Dense, good weight and long. Very hoppy palate. Massive resiny, piney flavor. 
Good beer. Its not a strong ale. Its a classics west coast IPA. 
Very long and massive.

Bottle poured into a tulip. Pours a honey gold with some tiny floaties, about a 3 finger off-white head. Decent webby lacing once the head recedes. Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, light dank. Tasting notes of big tropical fruit, citrus, caramel, floral hops, a little toffee. Medium body with a semi-dry finish.

Glad this came out again. Poured into a tulip, semi - clear bright gold with a medium white head. Sweet citrus nose, flavor is hop forward, was expecting a more balanced taste with that nose. Medium bodied a bit on the oily side with an abrupt finish. Hard to say, IPA or strong ale?

I got one bottle of this and split it with a friend. Its good but I I expected it to be better so Im not totally impressed. It tastes like what Id expect a generic American Strong Ale would taste like but with a lot of hops. Id probably get it again though since it is pretty good.

Aroma is great hoppy and citrus. Taste is pretty much just hops, theres not a whole lot of backbone. A lot of hops... I like it a lot, its happier than a lot of ipas Ive had. A great beer Id get it again!
Smells of citrus, dirty feet, floral hops. Hazy golden orange color. Taste is warming alcohol, herbs & citrus. I look forward to this beer every year. So great.

This fresh hopped beast anything but sucks. Opens with an excellent fresh hopped aroma and delivers on the fresh hop promise with a beautiful earthy taste and an almost orange peel after taste.

The smoothness and slight maltyness enhance the profile making the perfect American ipa.

Hats off!

On tap. Pours a really nice golden color. Small white head. Smells lightly of spices. Taste starts tangy then moves to just slightly bitter yet sweet. Ends smooth with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Good for Lagunitas! A good substitute! Would drink again.

Bright gold transparent color with small white head and minimal lacing. Aroma and flavor have strong vegetable, grassy hops, like broccoli or something. Its hardly the citrus, grapefruit, fruity, tropical bomb everyone is saying. If thats what you want there are better options. I got a 6 pack of it and am rating the last beer, but each experience has been the same. I really wanted to love this beer- may be a bit overhyped. With that said, it was still okay overall- and as always, good price.
Great overall flavor. Pours with nice head. Wonderful upfront hop flavors with a nice balanced finish and not too bitter.

On tap. Cloudy gold pour with a thick foamy white head. Tons of thick lacing. Aroma of grapefruit and sweet malts. Taste just like it smells. Sweet candies and citrus. Very refreshing. Full bodied. Almost chewy. Love it!
amber color; citrusy, bready aroma; lots of citrusy, grassy hops up front with an underlying bready malt base, and a dry, bitter finish; a really great beer

Bottle. The aroma is fresh cut grass. The pour is golden straw. The taste on this is aggressive hops and some faint malt complexity. Really great beer - maybe the best "substitute" anything ever made.

12oz into a tulip. Pours an orange marmelade light mixture with nice lacing and a faint bubbly head, 2cm. Aroma is sweet, hoppy, bursting with hop freshenss, is this not an ipa? Smells like one. Very sweet and resin like flowing to the nose, Orange, aprioct, mango, peach jam as well. Taste is sweet hops, just picked, orange, mango, bannana, peach, hops again, and sugar. Drinkability is wonderful, not too sweet and the hop fresheness prevails over it all, this is a nice ipa. Another stellar brew form Lagunitas.

Oh yeah this hits the IPA spot. Had it on tap at Jerrys Sandwich Shop in Wicker Park Chicago. Pours a rich clear copper hue with a medium white head. Great hop malt aroma that belies the delicious taste of this fine brewski!!!

Pours golden tan with a thick head. Immediate sweet sugary aroma. First taste is almost like dandelions with a brown sugar aftertaste that finishes with a metallic lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

I dont care what Geoff Abell (GAbell)says, this is delicious every year! Cheap and AMAZING! Golden halo in color with an amazing pine smell that either reminds me of a C9 lit Christmas tree or a glorious resin ball from a freshly used bong! Taste is spot on! Resiny goodness that makes me long for next Christmas. F Brown Shugga, this is where its at!

Bottle at home. Citrusy aroma. Pours clear gold. Think frothy head. Nice bitterness. Mild grapefruit lingers on the palate. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pours clear golden with big head. Aroma is juicy citrus and melon, taste is similar with a nice balanced finish.

The name Lagunitas gave to this beer is funny and ironic because of how far from the truth it is. It pours a nice amber color and generates about a finger to a finger and a half of head in the glass that laces nicely. The nose is a solid mix of the grapefruit citrus character and the nice resin notes from the hops. The taste is an almost perfectly balanced mix of hop character and malt backbone that is both refreshing and intense at the same time.

Clear orange pour with a nice white head that fades down to thick ring. Really nice lacing. Aroma is strong tropical fruit, pine, herbal, and a bit bready. Taste is a sweet citrus and caramel, with some resin and grapefruit. Nice bitterness with a sweet balance. Slick texture, medium body. Really enjoyable beer.

Golden pour with a nice head and lasting lacing. Very nice nose of grapefruit and other citrus against a slight spruce essence. Almost medium bodied with an average carbonation. The mouthfeel is almost creamy. An outstanding hop flavor with grapefruit the most forward. Spruce and a slight malt sweetness round out this well balanced ale. The alcohol content is totally hidden by the flavor. The finish is more smooth than crisp with a nice tartness and a soft bitterness. This is one of the best.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pale gold, quick dissipating white head. Hit of pine, then citrus, with some grain. Thicker mouthfeel , steady bitternes.
Bright orange in color. Fluffy white head. Sweet aroma. Smells like a cake baking in the oven. Bitter sour taste. Almost an onion apple taste, but in a good way. Good overall beer.

bread, cereal, resin, citrus, herbs, dough, pale, golden, orange, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, oily feel, lively, long finish.
Really tasty ipa juicy juicy i say. Would rated higher but i think i enjoy schafly tipa a little better, but this not to be passed up by any hop lover. Drinks so well for 7.85. get it.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2014 Bottle. Pours dark yellow/gold with a 2 finger off-white head with a lot of nice lacing. The aroma is hoppy fruit, citrus mostly tangerine, some pine and earthy notes. The taste is excellent. It’s full of fresh, dank resiny hops with a perfect malt balance, candied fruit. The palate is very smooth and light considering the hop flavors. Medium bitterness and light. This is very drinkable and smooth with tons of flavor and character.

Draft. Poured deep amber with a medium-sized off-white head. Aroma and flavor were grapefruit, tropical fruit, pine, hefty malt backbone with some interesting cereal notes. Struck me -- as it has many here -- as a DIPA.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orangish gold body under a beautiful one inch frothy off-white head that slowly faded. Lots of nice lacing remains. The nose is big and bright with boatloads of fresh and juicy hops, really resiny and dank, while the malt base just sits in the background and doesnt interfere. The flavor is just as bright and resiny as the nose hinted at. Lots and lots of fresh hop flavor in here while maintaing a restrained bitterness level that could impair the palate. Really mouthwatering with just a light pale bready and crackery malt base thats fairly dry. Theres maybe a touch of spiciness from the rye in here, but it pretty well gets drown out by the intense hopping. Medium bodied with sticky and juicy hops and nice soft fizzy carbonation. Crazy good IPA for my tastes, though its classified as an ASA on RB.

Bottle to glass. Pours a clear deep golden very light amber color with a small off-white head. Aroma is packed full of citrusy fleshy fruit hops and a hint of caramel sweetness. Flavor has a bit more malt balance, but certainly still shines through with fleshy tropical fruit goodness. Slight bitterness with a fruity sweetness lingers into the finish. Phenomenal beer, although Im not sure I agree with the Strong Ale category. More of an imperial IPA.

Lagunitas rarely disappoints. I like that they offer high end brews as well as some that are at a reasonable price. This one is no exception. Copper hue. Foamy head. Grapefruit, bitter taste. Hoppy. This is not an American Strong Beer. Its almost like a double IPA. Cloying wash down and yet delicious. Not a bad brew. An excellent way to end a work day.

On tap a Oblivion Taproom a lil while back. The aroma was pretty hoppy with lots of bready malts and brown sugar all around. As for the taste... plenty of caramel and brown sugar with a subtle bitterness from the mild hop profile. The finish suggested a stronger brew - which is a first for me. Drinkability is a lil low for me, but enjoyable nonetheless. Cheers!!!

BOD 339/13. Golden pour with a nice head and lasting lacing. Very nice nose of grapefruit and other citrus against a slight spruce essence. Almost medium bodied with an average carbonation. The mouthfeel is almost creamy. An outstanding hop flavor with grapefruit the most forward. Spruce and a slight malt sweetness round out this well balanced ale. The alcohol content is totally hidden by the flavor. The finish is more smooth than crisp with a nice tartness and a soft bitterness. This is one of the best.

If the resiny hops aroma isnt appealing to you, step away from the IPA rack. Beautiful golden color, a little pale maybe. Surprisingly, the hops in the nose doesnt come through as much as youd expect in the taste. To my tongue, this is more bittering hops and (too much) carbonation. What I detect in the aroma is there, but too much in the background. Makes me long for a Sixpoint Resin. Now. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear orange-tinted golden colored pour. Big white head that quickly falls, but remains fluffy and present. Tons of lacing. Big citrusy hop aroma. Some resiny pine notes as well. Big hop taste. Tons of peppery pine flavor. Finishes very dry, yet with a lingering sweetness and bitterness. Very good.
Had the most recent version on tap 1/13/14. Not as bright as I remembered, with a thicker body, but still retains that delicious Lagunitas-hop smell. Reminded me a lot of a fresher Hop Stoopid.

Draft. Pours dark orange with thin white head that lingers. Wonderful hop aroma with little carbonation. Great grapefruit hop flavor with nice complexity.

An orangish golden color with a small amount of white head that lingers around the rim. Citrus pine smells, caramel, brown sugar, sugary funk, almost an oak like quality as well. A slightly spicy salty carbonated first taste, with a tame consistent bitter throughout the drink. A little of the caramel sweetness, also a faint cotton candy, creme brûlée like taste. Citrus notes, orange, lemon. Hop complexity shows as it warms. A different overall taste, finishes dry, good hop notes combined with the subtle sweetness kept me interested.
