Tap: Because I wont buy their bottled beer anymore. Why? They Suck. Body is dark yellow piss. Take note. Aroma is sweet malt &grain, moderately to heavily hoppy extract resin, with notes of soap, sugar syrup, and celery. Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, bitter. Finish is too sweet, velvety syrupy texture, alcoholic. Basically grapefruit juice with chemical wax. Hop Stoopid Jr.!!

P: Orange copper body with a bubbly thin top of off white clouds. 

S: Super fruity and sweet. Grapefruit, blood orange, apricots, pomegranate, mango, honey dew and pineapple. Sweet candy malt and very subtle flower aroma. 

T/M: Clementine oranges, ruby red grapefruit with sugar sprinkled on top, apricots, and melon. Crystallized sugar accompanied by bitter lemon/line peel and timid spices. Overall palate is big time fruity and sweet, opposed to a harsh bitterness. Sticky medium body with gentle carbonation and a smooth but dry finish. 

O: All I can say is "I love this beer!" Hands down one of the best I gave had. Super excited to try the rest of the Lagunitas line up. Cheers!

I had been wanting to try this and was lucky enough to pickup a six pack and also a 64 oz growler. This review is based on the growler. Pours a golden/orange with a 2 finger white head and decent lacing. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus and some pine. The hop spectrum is covered extremely well. Taste is sweet up front with tropical fruit flavors and then the bitter citrus kicks in. There is just enough malt presence to keep things balanced. Medium Medium-light bodied bodied with a clean and dry finish. I preferred Fusion XVIII (which isnt a fair comparison since it is a 10% abv beer) but this beer is excellent.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2014 Light golden with two fingers of tight bottle conditioned beige head. Aromas of pine, honey, lemon, berries, maybe some light tropical like pineapple or mango. Taste follows the nose nicely. A nice fairly easy drinking beer.

Been waiting awhile to try this. Pours a lighter golden shade with long lasting head and nice lacing. This is as dank and meaty smelling of an ale as Ive ever smelled. Wow! Pretty amazing. You do get notes of lemon in here too. Flavors are malty at first.. Bit that intense meaty dank hop flavor confess through quickly with hints of citrus here and there. Awesome!

Fruity malty aroma. Taste is citrus and floral hop predominantly. Well balanced and full flavored. Really a solid beer.

This beer pours a dark gold color with a small white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Smells of hops, very fruity, and malt sweetness. The taste starts out with some hops character, some citrus other tropical fruits and later is balanced by the malt character. Good beer

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Deep gold, hazy, explosive head. Very full body, intense flavors, rich but refreshing mouthfeel, abundant carbonation, heat gives it a kick, lingering palate. High bitterness disguised by plenty of sweet malty background, less so in the finish, good acidity and balance. Simple in flavor, hoppy, citrus rind, passion fruit. Delicious but not great
Bottle, thanks to Bernatbeer. Golden colour with white head. Hoppy, fruity, malty aroma. Hoppy, bitter, fruity and resinous taste, some sweetness and maltiness. Medium to full body, very drinkable.

12oz in Seattle. Glad to finally get my hands on a sixer of this. Ruddy dark gold with big white head. Amazing aroma of fresh skunky hop and dark sugars. Big grapefruit and gym sock, I love it. Rich beer, good carbonation, a bit thin in the middle but this is damn tasty. Great nose on this.

12oz bottle pours clear toasted orange with 2 finger head. Nose is big tangy grapefruit and citrus. Taste is bitter grapefruit, tropical fruit, pineapple, resin, some oniony notes. Finish is lasting bitter lemony citrus with just enough malt to offset the bursting hops. Tons of flavor but still very clean and crisp. Really nice IPA.
Tap at maxs taphouse, baltimore. Clear deep golden color, white head. Super hoppy and fruity aroma, just tempting. Perfect body with hops, fruits, grass, leafs, freshness.

Poured from bottle into tulip: Pours golden with a one finger white head. Aroma a little citrus, resiny, little malty. Taste is a little sweet up front, followed up with cracker malt, hoppy deliciousness, lots of citrus and pine, with a smooth finish. Medium body, perfect carbonation, not overly bitter or sweet. A really excellent well balanced IPA.
Enjoyable. Its a bit bitter for the roof of the mouth, but it starts a bit juicy.

Draft WOB. 
Bright, clear yellow body, golden hue.
Big dank nose. Columbus? 
Softly sweet malts with a resinous hop balance. Green, leafy.
My go to beer these days. Liquid gold, fresh hop aroma, sweet almost. Tastes like heaven, bitter but not too much, burnt caramel sweetness. I cant find anything wrong with the almighty Sucks

12oz bottle into nonic. Pours clear golden with a white head that settles to a cap and leaves some patches of lace. Aroma is pine, tropical fruit, bread, alcohol. Taste is firm bitter orange peel, pine resin, and tobacco followed by subtle bread and caramel sweetness. Medium bodied, oily, creamy, and thick texture, average-to-lively carbonation, and a long, bitter finish.

Tops Tempe bottle. Big hoppy, skunky, resinous aroma. Flavor is nicely hopped but not crazy. This is much more balanced than I would have ever guessed. Just the vaguest hint of the almost 8ABV. Enjoyable.

Bottle from Prufrockstar. 
After reading this thread: http://www.ratebeer.com/forums/sucks-vs-celebratio and recently trying SN celebration head-to-head with the very similar Ballast Point Big Eye PA, I was eager to do the head-to-head between Lagunitas sucks and celebration. I will freely admit that I came into this one with a huge bias: the arrival of celebration on the shelves has been an annual event for a decade now, whereas most of what Ive had from Lagunitas, well, sucks. So even though I freely concede that this years celebration is not the best, I expected it to take an easy victory over sucks. 
I poured the two beers out side by side into twin Duvel tulips. The first surprise is that the celebration is the darker, orangier of the two ales --- surprising given that I associate Lagunitas with crystal malt bombs. The real surprise, though, comes in the aroma. The Lagunitas has a big juicy grapefruit and mandarin orange peel thing going on, terrific aroma. The celebration, meanwhile, smells of canned corn and stewed vegetables, and barely that. Not a good year for aroma at all. This is a 6/10, giving an easy win for sucks that deserves an 8. Despite the huge difference in aroma, the quite different flavors of these two beers score relatively close to one another, a high 6 for lagunitas and a low 7 for celebration with the edge going to celebration because of its trademark pine-needle close. The lagunitas, while juicier, is also quite a bit sweeter, with a sort of confectionary-sugar-added taste. This is not a good thing, though I admit that when paired with various too-sweet chocolate christmas cookies, this was not so notable as a flaw. For mouthfeel, lagunitas should be able to take the day with its higher abv base, and does so, with a nice full syrupy mouthfeel that carries almost no heat. 

Final scores on this tasting are celebration 6/3/7/3/15=3.4, sucks 8/3/6/4/14=3.5, but the lagunitas victory on points is a bit misleading. While overall I greatly prefer smelling the lagunitas, Isomewhat prefer the celebration for actually drinking. A substantial part of that is that the long end of the finish for celebration is really pleasant, whereas the long finish of sucks is sort of sickly sweet with bitter resins underneath. A fun comparison, and perhaps worth trying again some year when celebration puts up a stronger showing. My overall lifetime experience with Celebration has been much more positive, meriting a 4.something, and Ill bump that down only a tenth or so unless they have another bad year in 2014.

Aroma is sweet and earthy. Delicious. Blah djsjs did gnd Lspdhsb lsjshsh baba an

Nose- grapefruit, pine, resin. Taste- citrus, piney, slight spicy tongue tingle. Very good IPA.
Pours a deep golden with a nice fluffy head. Wonderful aromas of grapefruit, pine, and more citrus. Complex with a great balance of sweet and some bitterness. What a great brew!

On Tap! Pours a orange color with a thick head. Aroma is sweet and musky. Taste is sweet hoppy and malty.

New Years Eve tasting Flight (3 of 3 11:16p) - bottled. White head. Golden brown body. Unusual hop aroma. Some resin and tar. Flavor of burnt rice. Definitely different.

Honey gold color. Wonderful fruity, floral aroma. Taste - also very fruity and floral with pleasant citrus and biscuit flavors. Has a long bitter grapefruity hop finish. Surprised how much I like this. Very good!

Bottle. Pours a golden color with big white head. Fresh, grassy, spicy, earthy, straw aromas. A nice, fresh hoppy, grassy, citrus flavor, yet balanced by a nice malt backbone. Really fucking nice beer.

Pours hazy gold-orange with a thick white head. Aroma is overripe red grapefruit, mango, & pineapple. Awesome aroma! Taste is all of the above without going overboard - actually, nicely balanced. The bitterness is sharp up front and then mellows for an easy bitter finish. Nice.

Citrus (grafefruit), floral hop aroma. Hop flavor is floral at first... Followed by a lot of fruity flavor: grapefruit, tropical, maybe passionfruit? Some hop spiciness, too. A little toasty malt in the background.

Aroma comes on like a Belgian tripel, so far so good! Light amber with sparse foamy head. Some spicy nature in the taste, also reminiscent of Belgians, with the ever present NW hops touch. This is a really, really good beer.

Pours a clear golden amber with a thick and rather persistent buff head. Aroma is strongly hoppy, more at an IPA, with hints of malt and caramel. Flavor is quite hoppy, yet more sweet than bitter, with hints of caramel and horehound in attendance. Texture is firm and smooth, yet lively and fizzy. IPA? Strong ale? Who cares - contrary to the name, it doesnt suck at all.
Big hop aroma. Nice hoppy, piney flavor. That beer definitely doesn't "suck"!
Pours clear dark gold. Half inch thick white head. Sweet resinous smell. Slick low carbonation mouthfeel. Hoppy flavor without harsh bitterness. Overall excellent beer.

A great IPA thats released during Imperial Porter time! As always another great beer from Lagunitas! Aroma comes off very hoppy and smooth with a very refreshing taste.....a good beer to finish off a hard days work!

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2014 Lagunitas is one of the best, bargain top shelf breweries out there. However, most of their stuff, while very good, is not really top tier stuff. There are a few exceptions however. Their Hop Stoopid, 100ibu, Imperial IPA, is really excellent, and simply impossible to beat for the price.

And then theres this years Lagunitas Sucks. Its, put simply, the best beer Lagunitas has made, even including previous iterations of Sucks. It has some of that dank, oniony character that has become a staple in Stones Enjoy-By series. Pouts a gorgeous amber, aroma is vibrant with onion, pine and grapefruit. Taste is sweet, lots of pine, dry aftertaste. Its superlatively balanced, and tastes huge for a 7.5%. 

Honestly, I wish they made this a year round. It obliterates their Little Sumpin series, which I also really like.

For 10.99 a six pack, there is no better beer.

This is the best beer Lagunitas makes (in my opinion). The hops and malts are balanced so well with the citrus flavor and you get all the flavors at once. The hops are not overwhelming in the beer at all and create a perfect contradiction to the malts. Bitter, but not too bitter. I love this beer and would recommend it to beer enthusiasts, experts, fans, and even craft beer beginners.
Extremely aromatic, juicy fruit on the nose. Flavor is rye spiciness, floral hops, citrus, sauv blanc grapes. Moderate bitterness. Pretty damn perfect IPA.

Bottle, thanks Paul. Amber with white head. Absolutely stinks of hops, resinius pine, mango, orange. Taste is very resinous and piney with mango and caramel. Little sweet and a bitter finish. Excellent.

Pours a bright gold color with a creamy white/gold head. Aroma is citrus and resin and a bit of sweetness underneath. Taste is, in the very first instant, sweet, then resin and grapefruit. There is a nice creaminess from the oats and a subtle touch of wheat. Finish is long and leaves your mouth watering, waiting for the next drink.

Appearance - Golden orange 

Aroma - pine and grapefruit. Very strong and fresh aroma 

Mouth - medium carb 

Taste - milder than expected. Still crisp but mild. Complex. Not as hoppy as others but very nice 

Overall excellent
Poured from a bottle with a rich golden color, thick white head, smell plenty of hops, full of flavor, one of the better beers I have had in a while.

Good retention and nice lacing. Smells of sweet malt and slight hop background. Malt, sugary notes up front, followed with a sweet bitterness in the end. Great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2014 12 oz. bottle from trade. No date but should be fresh since I got it today. Pours a deep clear golden orange with a small white head. Big malt aroma with bits of grapefruit, orange rind, caramel. This smells rather malty for what I expected. Flavor is a big malt bomb with caramel, honey, and densely sweet citrus. Waaay sweet for a sub-8% brew. Heavy slick mouthfeel, sweet and nearly syrupy, with medium carbonation. This was totally not what I expected from this beer. Not bad but not close to the hype. Like, this is wtf level short of hype. I wonder if this is an older bottle. There is a number on the neck but doesnt seem to be a Julian date so no effing clue.


Retrying this with a bottle I know is fresh. Pours golden and clear with a giant fluffy white head. Off the bat there is significantly more cat pee, pine, lemon peel, and huge florals than last time. Flavor is a mouthfeel of fresh hops, medium bitter, with honey, pine, pineapple, grapefruit, orange peel, and some sweet malts in the background. What a night and day difference! Medium slick mouthfeel with medium or a little less carbonation. A really nice brew that I could have again for sure. Maybe a step or two below my favorites but still very nice. Poured from a bottle. Found this one left over from a 4 pack in my basement. Its well past its prime, but drank some fresh ones back in the day, but never rated - so some of this will have to be from memory. Pours hazy orange/gold amber with foamy off-white head; disipates to a thin cap and leaves some splotchy lacing. Aroma is hoppy, but also filled with caramel malt. Also a nice dose of honey and tropical fruit. Taste is moderately sweet followed by mild bitterness (I recalled this being more bitey when fresh). Nice smooth beer with medium body and some tingly carbonation. Enjoyable beer; I look forward to getting some fresh ones this year.

One Good Note: I let this beer sit for 5 minutes to let it warm up and there were still lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom.

A: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, Great Foamy Head, Great Lacing

S: Piney, Floral 

T: Piney, Hybiscus, Oily

M: Great Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Dry, Bitter, Crisp

Overall, a decent DIPA with a nice floral/piney flavor that lingers around.
Nice white head that lingers, dry crisp finish, and a palate full of hop flavor. Nose reminds me of citrus and hints of mango/pineapple. You truly do suck for not making this year round.
This is my favorite beer. The floral hops are perfectly balanced by the malt and the finsih is dry in spite of a notable initial sweetness on the palate.
Citrus on the nose, bombarded with pine and citrus on the palate. Balanced, malty finish with lingering hop bitterness. Nice IPA, love the hop balance.
Definitely in my top 3 IPAs. Pours amber with a 2 finger head. Plenty of lacing. Lots of floral hop aroma, huge malt backbone with tons of hops too balance it out. My kind of IPA.

Pours a rich golden color with average head. Big nose of citrus, juicy hops, dank, and tropical fruit. Rich, smooth palate of hops, slightly sticky, citrus, orange peel, and slight booze. Excellent balance of malt and hops. This will get you buzzed quick. Choice.

This is one of my favorite IPA's because of the the strong floral hoppy notes combined with the sweet, malty finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The smell was the first thing I noticed when I opened the bottle. Very strong, very alcoholic. The head was pretty big, though I admit my glass was not up to par. The taste is clearly hoppy, but I get a large, yet not overwhelming sweet caramel malt flavor. 

Delicious, I think sweeter than last years.
The head is medium, the body golden and cloudy. It smells sweet-sugary, bit fruity. Taste is sweet, bit bitter, sugary, interesting. Ok, but in my opinion to much sugar. 11/10/9/9/12/9

Growler provided by jredmond at the 4th of July tasting. Pours clearish orange amber with a small white head. Aromas of sweet candy and tropical fruits with a dose of juicy hops. Taste is floral, fruity, sweet and slightly bitter.

Lagunitas beers are unbelievable. Once again they have made me super happy with this delicious double ipa. Closer to a single but don't let that stop you. Do whatever you can to get this beer. I have and always will. Very rare and should be because this beer is sooooo good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Thios is a great beer! There is just the right balance to give it an even body. Malt white fruits, pineaple on the tongue. Finishes crisp, sharp and cleanly bitter at the end.

12 fl.oz.-bottle - schön oragene Farbe, würzig-süßlicher Antrunk. Der Hauptteil ist von der malzigen Süße dominiert, der Hopfen harmoniert recht gut. Leicht alkoholisch-scharf. Der Nachgeschmack ist mittellang, süßlich-klebrig, leicht herb-frisch.
--> geht so. Zu süß und zu wenig andere Aromen spürbar. Sehr langweilig!
7/10/6/7

On tap. Pours a clear very gold with a thinner eggshell head of larger bubbles that laces quite nicely. Nose involves a healthy amount of pine resin, dry grapefruit, honey, floral perfume, and biscuit malt notes. Pretty sweet in flavor, but quite bitter. Medium bodied, oily, dry, with a long toasty piney bitter finish. A nice, enjoyable brew, pretty easy to drink for its size.

Bottle [12oz]. Pours a slightly hazy, bubbly, golden-orange with a large lasting frothy white head. A good amount of lacing. Lovely aroma of tropical fruit, citrus and hops -- resiny, citrusy, piney and more. Flavour follows the aroma with the aforementioned fruit and hops along with some bready malt and alcohol. Moderate bitter finish. Medium bodied. Not sure what style this would ultimately be but its a very pleasant, solid beer.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 25/V/13 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ home - BB: n/a (2013-497) Thanks to BelvidereIPA for the trade!
Clear orange beer, creamy off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, lots of passion fruits, pineapple. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: lots of citrus, exotic fruits, passion fruits, bit sweet, honey malts, bitter hops. Aftertaste: lots of exotic fruits, mango, bitter hops, bit sweet, honey.

Looks to be naturally carbonated - when did they make that switch?  Look is nothing special.  Confusing taste.  Very odd malt here.  Worth reading the (self abusive) description to make sense of it.  Okay, so 4 grains went into the malt.  I love this Brewer so Im going to float them some points for going so far outside the norm.  If you crack this open expecting an IPA, well, that is a WTF moment then.  For a beer that those dudes dreamed up to be out-there, it is a success.  As a beer in the glass, Meh.
Pours a clear amber color with thin dissipating head. Distinct floral aroma. Hoppy biting flavor. Goes down smooth. Great beer!

12 ounce bottles.  Pours a hazy, chunky, golden with a one inch white head.  Taste is of hops, pine, citrus, grapefruit, caramel, malt and yeast.  Similar aroma.  Has a full body with a dry finish.  Easy to drink and quite pleasant.

Okay, I like this beer quite a bit, but I think this is w/o question the wittiest (and longest) description of a beer I have seen yet on this site, so I gave it an extra couple of points for crafty self-deprecation of writing style........ "Whatever"
Very nicely balanced IPA. Very smooth and enjoyable. Strong pine and hop characteristics with a nice malt finish.

Tasted on 5/14/13 from a capped 12oz bottle purchased at Tops. Pours clear orange bronze with an average off-white head that slowly recedes to spotty lace. The nose is a classic, very nice combo of resin hops and caramel malt. The flavor is the same, very balanced, with some nice balance. The body is medium and somewhat sticky with fairly lively carbonation and a long resinous bitter hoos finish,
355 mL bottle.  An IPA that is leaning dangerously into ASA territory.  But thats okay; I love ASA.

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks zvikar. Clear golden orange, white head. Grapefruit, pine and rather delicate aroma, bitter, also piney and delicate taste. Rather light body, citrusy finish.

12oz bottle from Premier Gourmet - enjoyed in a Cantillon glass whilst watching game 6 of Leafs v. Bruins (so sucks might apply nicely).  Hazy gold, large white lasting head.  Hops.  Hopz.   HOPZ!!!!  Average body, light astringency, catty APA type finish - bloody nice.  These guys dont get enough love.

2013-04-29. Crisp bright orange body, small off white head. 3+ Aroma is pleasantly hoppy, oily resiny orange citrus. 7++ Flavour is similarly hoppy, with lots of resiny citrus oil characteristics, orange peel and light alcoholic undertones, particularly in the finish. Very smooth medium bodied palate, soft carbonation. 3++ Solid, relatively simple but very nice hop character throughout. Bottle at Farmhouse, Burlington
Great hop  aroma.  Generous head. Above average mouthfeel.  Good malt backing.  Nicely drinkable IPA. Recent bottle from Premier Gourmet.

355 ml bottle.
Pours a clear copper colour with a white creamy head. Aroma of caramel, resin, cereal and hay. Flavour of caramel malts, resin, floral hops, grass and some metallic notes, as Ive had on other Lagunitas brews as well. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a dry, floral, metallic finish. Somehow I dont like these Lagunitas beers that much as the metallic notes tend to ruin the flavour.

35,5 cl bottle @ olio, bottled 02/2013
Aroma has fruits, resin, some hops, caramel and biscuits. Flavour has resin, some fruity hops, some caramel and hay. A bit harsh finish with gooseberry bush and metal. Decent.

355ml bottle @ Super IPA tasting from a trade, thanks cp45
Bottled 6th February 2013 - Pours clear golden orange with a large foamy head. Aroma of fruity hops, grassy notes, biscuity malts and crisp caramel. Taste is crisp and hoppy with notes of fruits, grass, biscuity malts and hints of stingy metallic notes. Finish is malty, hoppy and fruity with some biscuity notes. Quite balanced malty IPA.

355 ml bottle.
Pours clear golden color with a small head. Aroma of toffee, floral notes, some caramel and some sweet fruits. Flavor of mild fruits, some toffee, mild metal notes, caramel and resin. Soft carbonation, some sweet fruits on the aftertaste.
3515
This beer is definitely a must have.  Its aroma and appearance alone make it a necessary buy.

Pours hazy gold with two finger white head that leaves nice lacing.  The aroma is very nice with grapefruit and peach notes.  The taste follows with a some malts in background.  It finishes with a moderate bitterness.  It has a nice feel, full body and a soft woolly texture.
Very good citrus hops. Not too bitter. Bright flavors and color.

Intense grapefruit citrus aroma. Flavor is smooth and slightly sweet. A nice malt body to balance things out. Finish is slightly bitter and piney. Well done. Sorry it took me so long to find this one or else it would have been on regular rotation for a bit.

Pours clear orange with a thin white head.  Mildly sweet aroma of malt and citrus hops.  Fairly balanced flavor with lots of citrus and pine hops and some bready malt.  This beer anything but sucks....

Bottle: &nbsp Golden, fairly clear, thin to moderate white head, sudsy, sparce lacing, light carbonation. &nbsp Sharp pithy aroma, citrus peel, hoppy, smells just like a Lagunitas Strong Ale. &nbsp Big citrusy bitterness up front, 

hoppy, with a moderate malt base. &nbsp Seems like a big Hoppy Red Ale. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Finish is citrusy, lots of that orange pithy bits, and of course hops. &nbsp This seems like crappy a replacement for Brown 

Shugga. &nbsp Sorry, but this is just like every other Lagunitas Strong Ale, decent, but nothing to write home about.

Bottle (12 oz). Clear golden/orange with a frothy off-white and good lacing. Aroma is of tropical fruits (grapefruits, mango, pineapple), piney notes and rye distinctive presence. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with a moderate resinous presence and slight tropical fruits notes. Moderate bitterness. Medium body. Slightly dry mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. Very good IPA. Refreshing and drinkable.

Thanks to 5000 for sending this bottle. Yellow with a white head. Aroma is heavy on the pine and oranges. Flavor is strong pine and orange, a well as some biscuit malt. Low to medium bitterness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Bottle from CBB. Very nice citrus fruit salad nose, orange, grapefruit, tropical stuff too. Deep gold with a tall, fine head. Fabulous hop flavor. Citrus, tropical fruit, stone fruit too. Nice sweetness without much caramel, Sprite, tangy, peppery finish but not overwhelmingly bitter. Excellent stuff, though just a bit too much like a soda pop.

12 oz. bottle. Lots of aromatic citrus hops with a touch of pine. Smells great! The taste is pine and resin upfront followed by grapefruit pith, peaches and touch of spiciness. Malty cracker or crystal malts added nicely to balance the brew. Bitterness only hangs for a short duration. The bitterness comes from pine. Medium-bodied with a creamy texture with active carbonation. 7.85 ABV isnt anywhere to be found. It drinks like a 5% IPA. Overall for how widely available this brew is, I feel this is worth the price of a six pack. Its a flavorful brew that is easy to drink and for the price its hard to match. Another nice offering from this brewery.

Pours amber with a frothy white head that leaves a ton of lacing.  Nose is grain and a bit of citrus.  Flavor is nutty with a malty sweetness and there is a bit of a citrus hop component.  A nice beer, but I dont fully understand the hype with this one.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold color with a nice frothy white head. Lacing is decent. Aroma is tropical grapefruit and pine. Taste is similar with a bit of sweetness from the grain. Not very bitter. Medium bodied with a dry finish. In general, I usually rave about Lagunitas; but this one leaves me wanting more. See eevryone in Chi town soon!
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: The Christmas beer that tastes like summer in a glass! Huge tropical fruit nose - sunshine beaming out of the glass. Light, but solid malt backbone giving the hop explosion ample room to work off. A great IPA - full on, balls to the walls hops in your crotch.

Bottle at Antenna America. Golden colour, small off white head. Aroma is hoppy, tropical fruit and skunky. Lots of bitterness. Taste is less harsh, nice fruitiness with slight spicy maltiness, tangerine. Very nice but quite full on.

In my opinion I agree this beer reflects its name rhymes with bucks. Def not an ipa I would search and buy again. All round loser with so many wonderful ipas out there, hard to believe that it is limited edition, yikes!

12oz. bottle.  Strongly citric and fruity aroma, full of leafy hops, fresh and lightly sweet with notes of mango, lemon, grapefruit, pine and faint honey.  Clear medium golden in color with a lasting, uneven, fine head.  Flavor profile is strongly hoppy from beginning to end, with plenty of citrus and tropical fruit, more pine and resin to be found, along with a touch of pale malt sweetness that appears just before the finish, which is then easily dominated by a lasting hop bitterness, with more jammy fruit appearing late.  Dry and moderately effervescent on the palate, which has some heft to it, body is medium-full.  Very nice.  Lagunitas sucks!

This is a winner...strong pine aroma comes through.. It's like smelling the business end of a pine comb...has a super smooth taste... Piney there too.. You do suck lags! Wow really smooth drinking a great ipa!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz bottle. cloudy gold, fluffy white head. very piney resin aroma. pine and citrus taste, a little sweetness just behind that seems a little out of place. different but enjoyable
caramel, spruce, leaves, good stuff, really liked it, will buy again!medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Smells like your typically heavy IPA, then took a sip and it has a heavy hop mouthful, but with this weird sweetness. Not bitter like I was expecting. Not the best, but not bad either. 12 oz bottle in tulip.

Draft. Golden body with a frothy, white head, mostly lasting. Aroma of grapefruit and resin and notes of toasted grain, citrus. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body, syrupy texture, lively carbonation. Lots of grapefruit and resin in the taste with a touch of raw grain in the finish. Its not offensive. Theres just not a lot going on in this beer. So, yes, Lagunitas does suck for not making a more creative IPA for its holiday ale.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Tom. Pours shiny yellow with a nice head, aroma of citra, litchi, melon and onion, flavor is bitter, not sweet, fresh, lemon, pine, medium bodied
Aromas of grapefruit, pine, and earthiness. Taste is much of the same with a sweet malty backbone. Dry, slightly astringent finish.

Sweet, hop forward and yummy.  I wouldn't buy this in replacement of the regular IPA but it  is good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2014 From the bottle.  Pours a relatively light yellow with large white, puffy head.  Aroma of citrus and grapefruit.  Taste is very similar, with just a touch of malt backbone.  Similar to many Lagunitas beers, but a little lighter in color and with slightly less malth backbone.  Finishes dry and leaves you wanting more.  Wish this was available year round.

re-rate from a fresh bottle in November 2014.  upped the score from 7 to 8 on aroma, all else same.

Lots of grapefruit citrus in this one.  The scent was citrus and so was the taste.  The bitterness was spot on and I felt this was a solid brew.  
This poured golden with some very noticeable carbonation bubbles.

Hop forward with strong citrus and pine tones.  Has a nice and sweet malty backbone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a five plus finger white head that fades slowly leaving tons of lace.  Crystal clear amber color. Medium carbonation and medium bodied.  Nose is hemlock/pine hops, flavor is caramel and hemlock. Light lingering bitter finish.  Decent Imperial IPA. $2.45 for a 12oz bottle from Julios Liquors Westborough, MA.

Excellent beer!  One of Lagunitas best efforts.  Golden in color.  But, dont let the lighter color fool you.  This is a strong, flavorful beer with a earthy aroma & sweet taste.  Strongly recommend this beer.

In my honest opinion, this is a perfect beer. Its balance like youve never seen and taste perfect. I would drink this everyday if I could. Great product, I loved it. Cant wait to get down to Lagunitas.

[Bottle] Pours amber with a nice off-white head that quickly reduces to a thin, lingering film and some larger bubbles. Aroma is very vibrant, with mango, candied pineapple, pine, and grapefruit. Sort of a wood spiciness in there as well. The taste is quite bitter, lots of papaya and grapefruit, mild alcohol, and malt in the finish. Average mouthfeel, fairly smooth, lingering finish. Overall, a really solid beer that I hope Lagunitas makes one of their year-round offerings.

Fresh bottle thanks to Bruce. It pours clear orange-amber with a medium off-white head. The nose is fresh pine, orange, ripe tangerine, juicy mango, passion fruit, peach and marmalade. The taste is pine, pleasant bitterness, resin, straw, pithy orange, peach, grapefruit and touch of pepper with a bitter, resinous finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Pretty great stuff all-round. One of the best IPAs out there.
Fantastic like all of their recent outputs. Really well put together and balanced.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2015 From BandC. Very malty and sweet for a standard IPA. It felt like a mini-DIPA. Big fruity ale flavors, crisp herbal hops and spiceiness from the rye but slightly oily texture from the oats. It works quite well. and Serving: Bottle

Pours a cloudy orange with a copious amount of slightly off-white, frothy head.  Brown sugar very prominent in the nose.  Nice mouthfeel.  starts off with a very crisp citrus hops that fades into a bitter aftertaste.  Actually very good, a hop beer with some character.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Oren. Clear golden with an off-white head. Wonderful hoppy aroma with lots of citrus and tropical fruits. Bitter hoppy flavor with a bit of piney spiciness, fruits and a bit of honey-ish maltiness. Medium-bodied. Pretty awesome.

Red Solo Cup Tour of Grant Park - Beer 2 of 4 -  Split this with my wife.  As it was drank from a Solo Cup, the appearance rating should be taken with a grain of salt.  Pours a rich gold with a solid head, despite its pedestrian vessel.  Smells of citrus.  Perfectly carbonated palate.  There is a very pleasing sweet flavor accompanying the hop finish.  An all around excellent beer.

Pours a bit lighter and crisper than expected. The frothy white head doesnt stick around for long. Hops completely dominate the aroma. Yeah, a double IPA for sure. Hop oils assault the palate. Grapefruit and pine, mostly. Hint of heat from the 7.8% ABV. Rye comes through a bit in the finish. But this is all about the hops. Surprisingly, its only 65 IBUs. Thought this would push closer to 100.

Hop heads, get it!

Please hold the scallions. Pours amber with an off white head. Aroma has a bite of scallion, pine, lemon, and slightly citrus. Taste is pine, slight malt character, and citrus. Finish is really nice: crisp, clean, and dry. It gets better as it warms.

Draft. Tan color. Piney taste more then hoppy. Sweet and syrupy. A little too grassy and piney for my liking

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Muted pine, tropical fruit, citrus, and floral aromas. Flavor is sweet pine into citrus zest and a bit of spicy rye. Theres some grain on the back end, rounded out by a crisp bitterness and a lingering sweet flavor that isnt cloying, at all. I like the balance and the body of this one. Its not overpowering, nor underwhelming. A nice, pleasant middle ground with a lot going for it.

Pours a clear golden with a very thin cap of head that dissipates quickly. Decent amount of carbonation that runs off quickly. Nose is awesome. Very citrusy and sweet with grapefruit, tangerine and sour apple notes. Mouth is very bitter and hoppy with a slight maltiness. Surprised to see only 60 IBUs. Citrus notes, mainly grapefruit, shine through again. A strong finish that leaves a slight stickiness in your mouth. An awesome IPA. My favorite beer from Lagunitas.

pours golden with a lasting white head and lacing.  very fresh, floral aroma with a hint of syrup.  taste is pine and citrus with some sweetness initially and a floral bitterness at the end.  finish is long lasting.  the body is on the thin side but with this much taste, i can forgive it.
tap.   pleasant tropical fruit,   grapefruit, orangepeel.     toasted grains.   booze well hidden.   good.

Hazy golden with a thin laceful fluffy white head.  Aroma is strong with notes of citric rind and floral resinous leafy hops, with plenty of lupulin.  But mostly a sort of orange rind nose.  Flavor is pretty complex with wheat and oat and rye malt building a weird cereal malt semi-earthy sweet base, built upon by a quick swift kick in the butt of lupulin-full leafy hops, grapefruit zest, orange peel, and a touch of fresh spring grass.  Bitterness is strong but suitable next to a weird but enjoyable grain bill of rye and oats and wheat.

Pours a clear medium golden color with 1 finger head that dissipates leaving heavy lacing. Prominent toasted malt flavor hits you with moderate  pine > cittrus hops. You can taste the rye grain. Medium to full bodied, chewy. Long, smooth, but bitter finish. This is a incredibly well balanced IPA that still have plenty of hops, but has a good malt backbone.

Pours a golden orange with a frothy white head. Aroma of pungent pine. Taste is syrupy sweet followed closely by pine, resin bitterness. As the taste fades, orange citrus lingers as the bitterness fades. Very bitter but finishes well. Mouthfeel is slick with a full body. A little too bitter for multiples, but good once and a while. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at What Cheer in Providence RI. The pour is a clear golden color with a white head. Somewhat hoppy with a nice citrus and floral hop character. The flavor is quite similar to the aroma. A lot of citrus peel and floral hop flavors. A light spicy hop character as well. Medium carbonation and the body is light/medium.

Surprisingly good. Lagunitas definitely did a good job with this one. Lots of good flavors in'Sucks'

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow this is a roller coaster of flavours! Pours clear yellow with some head and good lacing. Nose is candy and maybe some pine. Aromas of cereal, rye pepper-y, candy, and tropical fruit with a great resiny fjnish. Taste is big bitter and some sweet. Medium body with lively carbonation. Each sip seems to stick around in my mouth forever.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2013 A clear golden yellow color with huge white sudsy head with good retention that leaves good lacing.  Nice melding of ripe tropical fruits, cracker malt and some spiciness.  A nice caramel sweetness with some fruitiness and a subdued piney bitterness in initial taste.  Can taste some cracker malt with some spiciness in finish.  Semi sticky mouthfeel with a medium body and medium/high carbonation.  This may be my favorite IPA.  I like that the bitterness doesnt follow through too strongly in the finish and enjoy the complexity of the sweetness, bitterness and bit of spiciness.  Very drinkable.

---Jeremy H
Bottle pours a hazy golden/amber with a lasting white top. Scent is pine and herbal. Taste is pine, caramel, herbal and crisp.

Pours a clear classic golden color with a short white head. Not much head formed due to how carefully the beer was poured by the bartender. The bouquet might be the best of any beer Ive ever had. Fresh grapefruit right up front with some underlying cannabis. Just a wonderful aroma. Mouthfeel is full, wet, and a bit oily. Carbonation bites just a bit on the finish. The flavor is magnificent. Grapefruit! A lot more pine in the flavor than appeared in the bouquet. Just enough rye in this beer to set all the flavors and aromas off in a more vibrant fashion. A remarkably well-engineered brew.

Bottled, that doesnt suck.  What does suck, is the fact that this is distributed to Alaska, but not North Dakota.  It sucks that I really really enjoyed this, but will likely not run across it again for quite some time.  I love hoppy brews, maybe Im a Lagunitas fan boy too cause I dig most of their beers; this is no exception.  Beautiful pour, big hoppy nose and taste, this is so solid.  Bonus points for being so potent and flavorful, while being extremely refreshing.  Has that same effect on me that SNPA did 10 years ago, sort like a little voice in your head shouting "I should be drinking stuff like this all the time!"  Thanks Jeremy for sending a bottle.

Bottle @ Bruces. Cheers, Bruce! The pours deep orange with a medium head. The nose is strong spiced orange peel, some marmalade, red berry compote, a bit of dirty spruce, pacific hops and honeyed bread. The taste is bright pine and spruce. Nice resinous hop profile. Orange peel and berry fruits. Moderately chewy malts. Medium bitterness on the finish. Full body, definitely not a lawnmower beverage. Active carbonation. Overall, pretty nice stuff.

Lots of hop grapefruitish flavor, mild hop bitterness, smooth as a bare babys bottom on the end. The beer does everything well and definitly does not SUCK! All that I can say is damn what a great beer!

12oz bottle.  Pours a very light golden color with a thin white foam head that leaves a few rings of lace.  Aroma has a big hit of grapefruit and piney hops in the nose with a decent amount of sweet malt in the background. Taste is slightly sweet up front, some caramel, cream, and cracker. Hops make thier push through the middle. Finish is dry and crisp with some resin and hints of pineapple, mangos, and oranges. There is also some pine bitterness on the finish as well. Mouthfeel is pretty full, smooth, with crisp carbonation.
Holy crap, this is a tasty beverage.  Its not overly hopped like many IPAs today, and has a very complex flavor from all the grains.  Freakin delicious.
bottle thanks to iantbonewilson. Dark gold, orange, copper color. Carbonation is medium but is nice! High bitterness. Very balanced aroma: hops all around, herby and light fruit.

Bottled. Pours a clear gold with a frothy white head. Big hoppy aroma, earthy, grapefruit. Very resinous, grapefruit flavored IPA in its most classic form. Finishes a little oily and a touch astringent. Terrific IPA.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a dark gold with a lasting white head.  The nose is a potent mix of tropical fruit, citrus, and a hint of malt sweetness.  Full bodied and smooth on the tongue, this brew blasts your tongue with hops.  Tons of grapefruit, citrus zest, and tropical fruit notes all bound together with a great malt backbone.  A nice, long finish.  This brew is outstanding.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear deep golden color with 2 fingers of creamy white head. Aroma is all citrus and tropical fruits, resiny, with slight caramel note. Taste is amazing! Lemon, orange, grapefruit, pineapple, and mango.

Aroma swells of grapefruit, slight wet fur aroma reminds me of fido in the rain, but may be the glass. Appearance a nice golden color. Tastes fruity and floral citrus on the buds and carbonation cleanses the palate. Overall beautiful beer, though definitely not the Brown Shugga substitute I was expecting.

Pours a deep, golden color with a finger sized head that leaves good lacing.  Had aromas of grapefruit, pineapple, and citrusy notes.  Was slightly sweet on the tongue, and wasnt overly bitter.  Had a bittersweet grapefruit aftertaste.  Pretty light bodied and easy to drink.

Bottle from Bev4Less.  Pours a lovely shiny orange with a nice, if ephimeral, lacy white foam head.  Aroma is all of high AA hops... smells like it got attacked by the pound of Columbus living in my freezer!  Malts are only slightly more present in the taste than in the nose (where they were non-existent), and only at the end of the palate. Otherwise, there are ample hop flavors: resin in the smell and early palate, with passion fruits and mango coming through strongly in the middle and late palate.  Nice stuff.  Wasnt a fan when smelling it, but man did it get better in the taste.
Poors a nice copper color with a half inch head. Nice hoppy aroma! Big flavor and nice mouth feel. Bitterness lingers a little too long for my liking, but other than that this is a great beer!
Wonderful citrus notes. Beautiful golden honey color. Nice head which lingers through our the beer. Semi hoppy but not over powering. A wonderful beer could drink year round.
Clear golden pour with a fluffy head that leaves som lacing. Grapefruit and pine with a slick mouthfeel. Pretty good.

Bottle. Golden beer. Not much head. Hoppy aroma. Taste of grapefruit, resin, raisins. Slightly sticky mouthfeel. Hoppy finish. Considering I am not a fan of crazy hops I am surprised I like it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark golden color with a thicker white head which laces well.  The aroma......overwhelming citrus and most definitely grapefruit is the most dominant aroma with slight piney notes being drowned out.  Taste is grapefruit, then grapefruit, then a touch of malt and very slight bitterness, and the grapefruit lingers with a thick mouthfeel on the palette.  Though very citrusy it does not have that normal sour bitterness in the aftertaste.  Over the top but put together well.

Bottle to narrow chalice.  Honey colored pour with a splotchy white head.  Big tropical fruit nose; mango, papaya, and guava nectar coupled with grapefruit and other citrus juices.  Taste is as hoppy as the nose but with a little more resin and alcohol heat.  Its like a mini-Pliny the Younger.  Very hop-forward.  Moderate mouthfeel and the finish is the only thing you taste: hops.

Pours a crisp gold with nice white head. Smells of hops, citrus hops. Taste is nothing more than the same. Palate starts sweet and ends bitter, reminds me of Two Hearted but as we all know, not as good. No, but really this is an outstanding beer. Alcohol is there for sure. I have no idea what Brown Shugga tastes like but this is one helluva substitute.

Aroma: piney goodness, bright hop smell, citrus - hard time picking up malts over all the orange citrus/hop smell. Maybe some dry hay malt.
Appearance: light orange copper, white head, clear
Taste: bitter hops up front, balances out midpalate, sweet citrus finish, and it all beatifully lingers together once its down.
Palate: long finish - and I mean that as a good thing. Light body (tingly carbonation), oily sticky texture
Overall: this is one of my favorite beers. I was initially worried that it was going to be a one time thing - literally just a Brown Sugga substitute for one year, and I was ready to throw myself off a bridge accordingly. I couldnt live in a world where I knew this once existed, only for it to be no longer. Dramatic? Yes. True? Yes.

I hope this is not a 1 and done. Fantastic aroma. Bitter taste but balanced with the sweetness of the malt. Delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2014 Pours a golden orange hue with a nice carbonation bubbling up to the top. The head is a pale white that is fairly thick. Nose is a wonderful combination of hops with spice and pine and fruit notes; most notably grapefruit. It is a smooth brew when next to most IPAs especially one from the west coast. I like it.

Bottle pours golden with off crader rock off white head that coats my glass with lacing. Nose of malt, tangerine, pineapple, and pine cone. Taste is slightly bitter with solid malt presense. Hop flavors on finish coat my tongue. He whatd ya know.... an IPA thats actually an IPA. What a great marketing scheme.... Take note Founders.

Tasted from a 12oz brown bottle into tulip pint glass, thanks gregwilsonstl! It poured a clear, orangish amber colour with fast upward streams of bubbles, HUGE, everlasting sudsy off-white foam which, after many slow pours you finally manage to fill the glass and perhaps hours or days later (thats what it felt like, okay?!) you drink it down to the point where you see all the beautiful Belgian lace glued to the sides, too. It looked like a fuck!ng magic bubble bath which never dissipates. Aroma was profoundly strong citrusy/resiny American hops and not much else. I was prepared for this to be just another grapefruit bomb, but I was wrong. Thankfully, the flavours were much more complex than the aroma. Still extremely hops-forward, obviously, but I tasted layers of English marmalade, dried apricots, cranberries, mamosas, lemoncello...I could go on...but then held in balance by a crisp, firm, husky grainbill which reads like a Belgian farmhouse ale. Peppery, earthy, woodsy...getchasome! Light body, moderate carbonation, with a well-rounded mouthfeel, and harmonious hoppy tang that just wouldnt go away. Smooth not harsh, with high alcohol content completely hidden as well. Man, oh man, I gotta hand it to Lagunitas, this is another ridiculously well-crafted beer. Im not even a big fan of IPAs, but this is like a hop-bursted Saison, which I can most certainly get behind. Cheers!

I had this on tap at Dohertys last week. This rating is from the bottle. Pours out a light golden color. Fine carbonation with a foamy white head that settles to a heavy lace. Aroma is bright and hoppy. Flavor is of honey malts with a blend of citrusy-spice hops. Lingering bready and bitterness.

10oz. Draught at Alibi Room, Vancouver.
Big fan of their regular IPA. This one starts of nicely, but develops too sweetly. Pity

Aroma is hoppy, with a skunky weed nose to it.  Pours a light golden color with a big head, and nice lacing down the glass.  Taste is hoppy with a sweet finish, and a lingering alcohol burn.  Sucks has creamy mouth feel and.  Overall Its a solid DIPA.   I just dont get the weedy, grassy skunky nose.

Appearance is golden with slight haze and thick creamy white foam cap.  Intense hop aroma, with strong citrus and hints of pine.   Great bready malt flavor up front with a strong but well balanced hop bitterness that doesnt overpower.  Medium creamy mouthfeel, especially for an IPA.   Finishes with a clean hop bite and touch of warmth from the alcohol.

Aroma is a bit too sweet, but a good earthy grassy smell. Appearance is a bit  too yellow, but head was good. Taste is hoppy and not too sweet, actually a good bitterness. Palate is not too thick, and is a bit dry for an ipa. Like the mix of sweet aroma but dry palate.

The nose is glorious, beautiful hop cones. It smells like spring flower petals, if every spring flower produced hops. It is an absolutely gorgeous yellow-gold color with a barely off-white head. The flavor is, again, liquid hop. The best part, though, is that its not that cloying, bitter, over-hopped disaster that so many craft breweries are doing these days. Its just a smooth, delicious hop flavor. Dont get me wrong; the bitterness is there. Its just not overpowering. It leaves that great hop dryness in your mouth. This is a damn fine beer, and I cant recommend it highly enough to anyone who even kinda likes IPAs.
Gorgeous IPA.  Heavy citrus notes mix well with prominent hoppy flavors.  Smooth finish and pine undertones make this a must have pale ale.

Ill let a brewer off the hook for not making a yearly and traditional beer when they replace it with an even better one - like this IPA!  If Lagunitas hasnt already, they should give this beer a permanent name and make it a fixture in the year-round lineup.  This guy is right up there with the Maximus, as well as some of the other best IPAs in the land.  The beer pours a fairly light gold color with a voluptuous white head.  The head leaves a ton of sticky lace around the edge of the glass.  The nose is bright, pungent and spicy, with notes of wood, grapefruit, tangerine, orange and grapes.  The body is full and silky smooth.  This beer is absoutely delicious!  I cannot drink enough of this.  Before I knew it, three bottles were gone.  The flavors are seriously dry and spicy, but with a ton of tropical fruit notes.  This IPA has the balance of a champion.  There is a ton of bready maltiness and light yeasty flavor to compliment the faceful of hops.  Lagunitas Sucks is a hop-lovers dream!

Gold pour with a finger of head.  Gobs of white lace.  Pine hops in the aroma - fairly bitter.  Papaya and Mango as well.  Taste of pine, An assortment of citrus fruit, guava, mango, papaya, grapefruit rinds.  solid.  Medium body.  Resiny aftertaste. everything integrates well.  Very easy drinking.

Pour is dark golden/light copper with a nose of hops hops hops highlighted with pine and flowers. Head is thick and creamy with a noticeable hearty bubble.   Taste is super bitter with very hoppy overtones. Again the pine and flowers come out in the flavor. Mouthfeel is thick and oily. Aftertaste lingers a while. Nice lacing on the glass as I imbibe. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle->SA.  Pours copper with frothy white head.  Aroma: nice grapefruit and pine hops.  Taste: sweet malt and hops, lingering pine bitterness.  Very smooth, great balance.  Excellent.

Reviewed 2/22/13.Thanks to Momar42 for the bottle! 12 oz bottle into a nonic pint glass.

A: Pours a nasty-looking dark piss color. The head is a two finger spoiled milk shade that looks like cottage fuckin cheese. Why is there so much ugly-ass lacing left on my glass?

S: This is full of gross melon, gross papaya, gross herbal pine, gross mango, and...well, its just gross. Smells like an awesome-- ERR I mean wet ass.

T: Yikes, and just when I thought it couldnt get any nastier, it does! The opening is nothing but mellow-- I mean nasty tropical fruits. Bah, who really likes tropical fruits? It tastes like a damn rainforest! It finishes with a soft, malty sweetness, which totally sucks n stuff, too. And ewww, is that onion on the aftertaste? Who wants onion in their beer? NOT ME, GOOD SIR!

M: Light, delicate, subtle, and crisp - and it sucks. Yeah, it fuckin sucks. Ive never stated my preference toward light and delicate DIPAs before in my life, youre all nuts! /angryface I mean, sure, its drinkable, but thats only because I want to get rid of it so quickly! Aw crap, Im not near a drain...I guess Ill just pour it into my mouth more. Because it fuckin sucks so much.

O: Yuck! Lagunitas Sucks indeed. Its so bad Im discouraging everyone out there of buying it...so I can snatch the remainder up for-- I mean, cuz its gross an shit. Yeah, thats it. This is most definitely not a fantastic DIPA that I wish I could drink a case of, no, you guys are all reading into things WAY too much. Like I said, this sucks I WANT MORE I WANT MORE NOW!

On tap at alibi room in gas town Vancouver. Very citrusy. Very hoppy. A bit too boozy for my liking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear amber with a fluffy off-white head.  Nose is toffee, cream, molasses, pineapple, grapefruit hops.  Flavor is wonderful malty sweetness with big hops balancing it.  Alcohol is present only to volatilize the flavors on your tongue.  Rather creamy mouthfeel. God its good.

12 ounce bottle from six-pack which I luckily found at the Escondido BevMo...hard finding this gem ($10.99 for six-pack).  Pours a clear golden amber with two full fingers of fluffy white foam that leaves some quality lacing.  Aroma of honey, caramel, tropical fruit, fresh-cut flowers, light citrus, and light pine.  Flavor of prickly-spicy hops, nice tropical fruit, wet grains (spicy rye is there), some citrus, and honey.  Moderate bitterness with a nice low level of sweetness.  A qualitatively different IPA with a decent level of complexity relative to some other west coast IPAs...I really like the tropical fruit here.  (713, 775)

Poured from a bottle into dogfish IPA glass. Orange amber golden pour with a thick white head. Smells heavily resinous with some sweet overtones. Tastes full of hops that range from sweet and fruity to piney and grassy. Bitter finish with a citrus backbone. Really complex, quite impressive.

12oz bottle. Pour was a orangy copper color with a finger of head that disappeared quick but stuck to the sides. Aroma is wonderful. Full of floral and citrus goodness. A hint of caramel too. Mouth is bit sour but the grapefruit, pineapple and topical flavors burst through to a long lasting finish. Medium body. They live up to their reputation once again!

UPDATED: APR 12, 2013 Pours clear pale reddish yellow with a white head that sinks to a thin layer and great lacing. Wonderful rich aroma with floral notes of rose, citrus and butterscotch. Taste is medium bitter with light carbonation with a short bitter finish. Very nicely balanced, pretty darn good.

Hazy orange color, white head that sinks but sticks. Great aroma of fuzzy peaches and peach jolly ranchers. Flavor doesnt quite match up. Its got some fruit and some bitterness but its just good, not great. Little bit of alcohol, eh. People hyped this up and while its a good beer its not all that. I regret buying a second six pack honestly.

Serving type: bottle

01-20-2013 05:33:22
Again, another brew I've had my share of, but haven't rated. This stuff is unicorn jizz. Magical elixir.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear, light orange with minimal white head. Aroma is super tropical and citrus. Loads of pineapple and mango. Taste is light bitter and light sweet. Again, a bunch of pineapple and citrus. Light bodied with a thin texture. Soft carbonation and a super long finish. Overall, awesome. One of my favorites from lagunitas.
Pours. Light golden color with citrus aroma, very nice mouthfeel with nice balance of hops and citrus notes, please keep screwing up!

Look: Nice orange body, lively carbonation. 1/2 finger white head. Smell: Apricots, citrus (lemon grass, tangerine), mild mango, tobacco, wheat/ straw notes. Taste: Apricots, flowery citrus, pine needles, biscuit sweetness, fossil alcohol before the bitter finish. Feel: Medium-light body nice active carbonation. Overall: This reminds me of a more alcoholic Sculpin, (Im not complaining). The aroma shines bright. The alcohol flavor dampens the hops in the flavor for me. Yet it is still highly drinkable at almost 8% ABV. This brew is worthy.

Bottle from Village Wine and Spirits in Athens. Big sewery-citrus stink, swamp gas. Pale straw color. Hops + tropical fruit initial: peach. mango, some pine / weird mix in mid palate: sharp bitterness, strange maltiness (four types of grain), and even what seems like some funk / smooth aftertaste with some alc. Medium body. Extreme flavors for what really isnt such a big beer. Doesnt suck in the slightest.

Strong smell. Citrusy and hoppy. Would definitely buy again next season.  Love the strong hops!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Spiced citrus honey marmalade malt permeating the typical lagunitas IPA hop profile. Interesting yet balanced flavors from the different grains

Bottle.  Pours clear dark orange, near copper with a medium, frothy and bubbly white head, short retention with good lacing.  Aroma is citrus, earthy, herbal, and resin hops, sweaty gym sock notes, apricot and pear esters with light cracker malt.  Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness, light supporting malt, medium fruity esters and a dry finish.  Medium body and carbonation.

light golden with slight hop haze and with small fizzy white topper, modest lacing. one of the finest aromas ever on an ipa, all sorts of citrus and light fruity/flowery.  I think it smells the closest to Heady Topper I can recall at the moment.  The mixed malts really make on nice scaffold to hang the hops on with no overbearing carapils to ruin things. medium carbonation, refreshing and quaffable all day long.

pours a golden amber.white head wit light lacing.aroma is strong of mango and citrus with your typical grapefruit resinous aroma as well.flavor or mango,pine,grapefruit,spice and pepper.medium bodied,fizzy mouthfeel and a slight bitter finish for the style.well balanced.not over the top but definitely good and drinkable

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2015 Clear gold with shorth froth,spotty lacing. Good carb.
Great aroma of fruit/mild floral tropical,sweet melons,some peppery spice.Resiney sweetness.Cant really get much better/fresher smelling,nothing off or odd/weird .Flawless.
Great tasting beer overall. Very drinkable and  with a hoppy fruit,medium body, nice fresh citrus finish with some tangy shapness type bitter, resiney with sweetness but not too bitter.ot too grassy,yet hoppy.Pretty amazing.

Draft @ Southern Pacific Brewing, San Francisco, CA. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with a white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter peachy piney aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter peachy flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter peachy finish.
Great aroma and hop taste, but not too strong to bite back.  Seasonal late dec - january

Excellent IPA.  Im an IPA guy, and my two favorites are Two Hearted (OK, not an IPA, but a pale ale) and Zombie Dust.  Lagunitas Sucks is in between those two.  Citrusy hops and a lighter palate.  I really enjoyed it and will be finding a sixer or two to have at home.  On tap at Riverside Tap Room.

12 ounce bottle - $1.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a near clear, light pale copper-hued body with an inch of white suds.

Smell: Heady, fruity notes of tropical fruits, varied citruses with pith included, a little liquid soap, and some resinous grassy undertones.

Taste: Pale malts, a bit of breadiness, and a low, brief sweetness imparted. Resiny, grassy, floral, but rather fruity, with tastes of pithy tangerine, mango, white grapefruit, pineapple. Moderate bitterness. Sourish, fruit juice quality with a sliver of resin and soapiness on the drying, bitterish finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Overall: Another hoppy-something from Lagunitas.
Tap. Golden yellow. Monster lacing. Cloudy as Pittsburgh. Smooyh IPA flavors.
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2013 light amber with an off-white head and a bunch of sediment. lots of lacing. grapefruit, spicy hops, pine. caramel, rind, onion. exceptionally well balanced.

Pours a clear amber with a brief head with continual lacing. The aroma is huge on hops, mostly pine notes, but some floral qualities, too. The flavor is great. Hoppy and bitter through and through, but a rich malt in the background and some caramel and molasses.

On draft at HOTB. Hoppy piney aroma. Great lacing down the glass. Clean bitter bite. I'm glad I got the chance to try this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Casanovas in Hudson, WI. Big time hop resin/pine with pineapple sweetness. Taste is similar with a nice dry bitter bite.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear orange with white head.  Good lacing.  Nose of litter box and citrus.  Dirty litter box, citrus and mild to moderate bitter.  Really solid.
Pours a pale golden yellow with a full firm white head. Great nose, light but full, hops, citrus, dry grass, pine. A surprisingly light taste that is loaded with all the IPA staples. Great beer.

Draft. Poured a clear golden color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate spruce and citrus hop aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations where met.

12 oz. bottle.  pours slightly hazed, white cap.  nose is grassy and lush citrus oil.  mouth is resinous, citrinous, crisp and clean, nice hop medley.  overall lagunitas makes nice hopped beers, albeit similar tasting.
Light golden, light white head. Aroma of pine, orange. Rate of big pine, orange, grapefruit, smooth bitter bite, pine lasts with a sweetness that lingers.
Light golden, light white head. Aroma of pine, orange. Rate of big pine, orange, grapefruit, smooth bitter bite, pine lasts with a sweetness that lingers.
Pours a pale to copper orange color with a soapy white head.  Aroma of grapefruit and earthiness with some caramel mixed in.  Sweet grapefruit taste with a rough hop hit.   Tasty.

12oz Bottle A - Pours clear golden orange with a fluffy white head. Good retention/lacing. S - Tang! Candied tangerine. T - Intense citrus. Tangerine, grapefruit, & apricot. Sweet malt. M - Light/medium bodied. Lively carbonation. Crisp. Mild citrus rind finish. O - Outstanding.

Bottle from 1 stop beer shop.  Pours a translusent orange with very good lace and head retention. Aromas of strong west coast hops with pine and grapefruit. Taste starts with a hit of bitterness but there is also a balance from the malt.   With that ABV suprised not a DIPA.  Not as malty as most DIPAs though.  Still, very good and enjoyable beer.

Into a goblet with a finger of head on a clear, straw colored body.
The aroma is wonderful bright citrus: orange, mandarin and grapefruit.
The taste is a little disjointed: moderate bitterness throughout with lemon and grapefruit dominating. Theres a sweetness breaking the surface once in a while too.
Theres a soft texture with moderate carbonation.
The taste was a letdown because everything else was great.

pours golden with white head.   aroma is hops - mostly citrus (grapefruit), but some pine hoppiness as well.  taste is citrus hops, biscuit, light caramel and malt, and a bit of candied fruit.  finishes with piney hops and a touch of bitterness.

Bottle: golden orange pour with a large white head. Aroma is orange peel citrusy on top of  pine needles and a whiff of caramel. Flavor is grapefruit/orange hops with some sweet caramel running into some sticky pine resin woodiness. Palate is sticky thick with a nice sweetness crashing into a hoppy/resiny bitterness.  Rather easy and tasty drinking for a larger beer with a nice hoppy pop but not too bitter, will drink more soon.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2014 A: Pretty light on the aroma. Bit of citrus. Floral notes. The usual.
A: Pretty nice light amber. Pours thick. Good lacing.
T: This tastes really great. Very smooth bitterness. Great citrus note. A tinge of sourness adds something unique as well.
P: Pretty aggressive on the palate. Medium body. 

Overall this is a really great beer. There is a lot of citrus too it that is well balanced with the hops. which are also well under control. Alcohol is difficult to pick up on which is nice, and the beer is still able to maintain its subtleties. Also sour on the finish which is really unique. A must try.

Not gonna re rate this but picked up a 6 pack on accident that was two years old. Not very good. Not bad but drinks like a amber ale or something. A hint of alcohol sweetness but really no hops or maltiness or anything.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2014 Clear straw pour with a white head that hangs around for a while. Intense floral hop aromas with some citrus as well. Slight touch of sweetened grapefruit in there as well. Nicely bitter on the tounge, some residual sweetness but mostly finishes dry and bitter. Very good. Tangy bittering hops, some citrus but not too much. This is a damn good beer. Fucken A. 
UPDATE: this beer is fantastic in 32oz bottles. Upping the score to a solid 4.1
lear copper hue. Aromas of tropical fruit and citrus. Flavor is full of hop bitterness with lots of depth. Piney, citrusy, tropical, slightly astringent. Very enjoyable beer. Easy drinking.

Pours cloudy gold with a sudsy white head. Aroma is fresh tropical essence with floral hops, pine, and a clean and fresh essence. Taste is tropical fruit, pine, floral hops, lemon zest, and orange. Light with champagne qualities.
Superb.
Love this beer. Citrusy and great fresh hop smell. Well balanced. Smoothe and fresh.

Pours a golden orange. The aroma is intoxicating. Sticky sweet malts and citrusy hops. The taste is better than the aroma. This is a seriously fantastic IPA that took my by complete surprise. This cannot be a one time offering. Lagunitas needs to brew this thing around the clock.

From a 12 oz bottle. Could not determine when brewed. Purchased from HEB here in The Woodlands. Cracked it open into a Mad Elf snifter. Lots of carbonation with about an inch of head that calmed down eventually. Tons of floral bouquet and grapefruit mango notes.  Aroma wise on par with the best. As some have said before the taste doesnt live up to the aroma. As with a lot of Lagunitas beers, its really sweet and syrupy, almost like a barley wine. Good hop hit on the tongue. Decent carbonation. Abv not too high. Texas doesnt get a lot of good beers so I compare all my IPAs to Ballast Point Sculpin which I can get and Sucks is not quite there. If Sculpin is a 5.0 this is a decent 4.2. Also about $4 less a sixer than Sculpin. L Sucks runs about $10 here in Texas. Get it if you see it but I wouldnt go on a manhunt for it.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle.  The pour is a slightly hazy medium amber with a moderate off-white head that settles down.  The aroma is quite nice and generally my favorite aspect of this beer.  There is an unusual earthy, piney hop note on the nose with a slight brown sugar note. The body is medium and acidic. The taste starts out sweet but the hoppy character takes over quickly.  Not much in the way of lingering hops.  Decent enough but I think the hype is a bit off.

12 oz bottle: Pours yellow and orange with no head and little CO 2 release. Aroma is floral, bright, crisp and sweet. Taste is sweet with an unknown bitter taste. Brew is complex, smooth and thick. Fun, changes while it warms, complex. Great complex brew, fun to drink and great flavor.

Had on tap at Atwoods Tavern, 1:57 pm. To tulip it ours a hazy orangeade with a trim white head. Aromas of magnolia flowers, limes, chamomile, guava, white wine lees, and algae. Tastes of limes, kilned malt, hops, and whiskey dregs. Plastic, onions, and yeast by swallow. Honestly, whats all the commotion about?

Draft at the Alehouse
Aroma is bursting with tropical fruit, citrus, and grapefruit bitterness.  Flavor is a smooth, quenching blend of sweet malt, tangy citrus, orange juice, grapefruit, and a titillating bitterness on the finish.  Lovely
A great IPA. The aroma and flavors are near perfect. Its not as bitter as some IPAs Ive had but Im not sure thats a bad thing.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 Poured from a 12oz bottle.  Clear, golden, with a perfect white head.  Taste/Aroma is tropical fruit, grapefruit, and hops!  Big, fresh hops with a fruity finish.  Oh man.  6 pack says it is a "cereal medley" of barley, rye, wheat,and oats.  Lagunitas answer to Pliny the Elder.  Hops are Chinook, Simcoe, Apollo, Summit, Nugget and HBC342 hops but it tastes like Amarillo or Citra!  I buy this when I see it even if I have some in the beer cooler already.  7.85% well hidden.  My favorite brew from one of the best breweries.

12 oz. bottle.  Bright golden amber with a diminished white head.  Strong oily citrus hop and grapefruit aromas.  Outstanding experience of bold citrus hop flavors mixed with sweet malts and bitterness.  The hops follow thru to the dry finish.  Damn good!
Clear copper hue.  Aromas of tropical fruit and citrus.  Flavor is full of hop bitterness with lots of depth.  Piney, citrusy, tropical, slightly astringent.  Very enjoyable beer.  Easy drinking.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is dark yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately to heavily hoppy (grapefruit, resin), with notes of soap, sugar syrup, and celery.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, moderately alcoholic.

Basically grapefruit juice with some floor wax, a few minor off notes, and a sour flavor balance (as if grapefruit juice was actually added).  It doesnt suck or rock, its just a boring, average, one-dimensional grapefruit-heavy IPA.  There are a ton of beers out there exactly like this, and sadly this does nothing to stand out from the pack.
Pours a clear orange color with a medium sized bubbly canvas colored head. Notes of sunflower seeds, dried apricots, orange rind, and hop resin. Supple mouthfeel long finish.

Very intense aroma, similar to Zombie Dust. Very clear copper pour with 1/2 finger head and nice lacing. Flavor though is muted. Was hoping for a bit more based on the nose. I would say this has the nose of Zombie Dust and the taste of Two Hearted. It's better than Two Hearted, but not as good as Zombie Dust. Still a great beer and I can understand why it flies off the shelves. They should make this a year round offering. It would be a great Summertime brew. Worth checking out.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Aroma is great combination of caramel, pine, citrus (a lo of grapefruit, some orange?), more sugar, and then more floral hops.  Appearance:  Crystal clear orange amber with frothy white head that sticks around for awhile.  Attractive lacing.  Taste:  Well-balanced with bitter grapefruit punch in the face, followed by sweet malty caress, then more dank bitterness that lingers beautifully.
Palate:  Silky smooth.  Medium/full body.  
Overall:  This did not deliver the suckiness I was promised.
Intense floral and hoppy aroma that dissipates quickly. Silky mouthfeel. I wish the taste was as good as the initial aroma. Then this would be fantastic.

Bottle; poured a clear orange like color with an average off white head.  Aroma was vibrant; caramel, sugar, and hops; grapefruit, citrus, earth, and pine.  Flavor was hoppy, but very drinkable.  Quite sugary, but in a good way.  Alcohol in a good amount.  Hops were resiny and citrus.  Hoppy, but not overdone.  Good stuff.

An amazing aroma of Simcoe and Citra. Fresh, fresh hop flavor. A stunning brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap. Aroma is strong and reminiscent of Christmas with a light citrus character. Taste us the same with a nice malt character. Good clear bright orange pour. Good beer but the hype is overblown imo.
Amber orange hue and an off white head. Bold citrus and hop scents as well as flavor. Refreshing crisp and clean. TO BILL BRASKY

Bottle poured into tulip. Appearance is a translucent amber/orange with a medium off-white head. Aroma is strongly citrus, especially grapefruit, with some pine scent as well. Taste mostly follows the nose: citrus and pine. Good balance. Pretty good IPA.
Nice hop smell but really sweet.. was surprised that it didnt taste as sweet as the smell. Actually has a more overwhelming hop then expected. Good beer.

12oz bottle (2012). From the first sniff I was sure this was going to be the best IPA ever. Floral/citrus/pine smells were intoxicating. Beautiful deep amber color w/ good head. Unfortunately, the taste didnt deliver on the aromas promise. A decent beer but a real teaser.
Poured on draft. Appearance is a semihazy gold with a white head of foam. Aroma is pine and citrusy fruits. Taste is fruity bitterness.  Pretty pleasant. Overall a good beer.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2013 21st April 2012Light haze on this amber beer. Tidy pale cream coloured head. Crispy palate. Good malt base. Creamy pale malt with a little caramel. Layered over with fresh piney hops - light and airy. A little grass, sharp minerals and then a touch of tropical fruits. Finishes smooth with more creamy malt. Reliable Lagunitas satisfaction! 3.913th March 2013A fresher bottle thanks to Deeblo! Cheers Bruce. Lovely fresh hops - apricot, peach, other tropicals, little orange and pine. Finishes with more tropical fruits. Fantastic!

this is a delicous brew.  it is sweet, fruity, and hoppy.. you can taste the sweetness of the brown sugar ( not to poweful) and you can also taste the fruit side of the beer, and it also has a delicous hoppy punch.. by far one of the best brew i have ever had.. i will be looking for more of this..  if you like there hopstoopid.   its like that with brownsugar in it..   and priced very nice..

Gold, clear, white head. Aroma of citrusy, grassy hops, very fresh. Flavor of pronounced citrusy hops with some grassy fresh-hop character, biscuity malt with some caramel.

Clear and dark orange, with very good lace and head retention. Aromas of strong west coast hops with pine and grapefruit. Taste starts with a hit of bitterness but there's also a balance from the malt bill. Very flavorful and well made. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Finally got ahold of a sixer and on my second one. Really tasty and drinkable. One of my favorites from Lagunitas!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle to glass mug.  Pours a slightly amber yellow with an off white head.  Awesome nose of pine and citrus, grapefruit.  Delicious hop bite.  Deceptively strong, because its so smooth.

Aroma: resinous hops, somewhat floral, juicy ripe citrus, spicy rye, toasty malts.
Appearance: slightly hazy golden color, bordering on a light copper.  Off-white head with average retention, spotty lacing.
Flavor: lots of citrus and pine, some orange rind, biscuit and rye bread, medium bitterness is well balanced by the malts, slightly sweet finish.  Alcohol is well hidden for an 8% brew.
Palate: medium body and carbonation.
Overall: great brew, nicely balanced, very drinkable.
One of the better IPAs I have tasted, very fruity, quite hoppy, but not overwhelmingly so.

12 oz bottle with no date. Pours a kinda nasty piss brown. Light frothy head. Mouthfeel is sticky with nice carbonation. Taste is sweet and hoppy; very floral with pineapple. Overall decent but not great. It's got that signature Lagunitas yeast taste that I really don't like. Solid but not great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I think I prefer this to the Brown Sugga anyway...  by a long shot.  Sweeter, with a mild fruity, piney character in the nose on the palate.  Sweetness, bitterness, and perfect balance.  Way to go.  It would "suck" if this is retired.

On tap. Nice hoppy aroma and mild taste. Nothing earth-shaking but a solid IPA

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is one of the best smelling beers I have had yet. Big citrus and pine. Nice amber body. Huge citrus and hops bitterness. This is my favorite IPA this season. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks Brian for the extra!!

poured dark amber with a sweet citrus nose.  Resin stuck to my tongue, very nice lacing left on my FFF pint glass.  Very nice sweet hoppiness followed by a lingering citrus note.  Overall a very nice IPA

A pretty basic Lagunitas.  Great color, but falls short a bit. Nice hoppy background, just seems to be missing something. Aroma and taste have notes of honey.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blonde-amber with creamy head.  Powerful co-humulone and resiny hop nose, full of Simcoe that veers dangerously into cat urine splash. Resiny Chinook/Simcoe body with pine and catty notes. Bold hopping and enjoyable, on the whole. Sticky piny finish

Bottle. Pour is clear gold with a thin white head.  Aroma is thick with citrus and floral hops. Also some light pine notes.  Flavor is also loaded with citrus and floral notes. A light sweet malt backbone present as well.  There are so many good IPAs out these days. This is a great one as well and at a very competitive price. Solid beer. This bottle tastes slightly past prime but still very good and very worth trying.

On tap at Smokin Joes. Pours a clear light orange with a thin white head. Aroma of sweet fruits, sweet tarts candy, and piney hops. Flavor of a tart kick up front followed by grassy and piney hops. Its a little odd- sweet, tart fruity hops plus your regular bitter piney hops. Not bad, just different from your typical IIPA.
7/4/7/4/15 (3.7/5)
Golden Brown color, wonderful IPA aroma of hops, pine, and citrus.  Very easy to drink and with good balance of bitterness.  Definitely one of my top 10 IPAs.
Pint draft -- pale golden in color with a wonderful hop aroma.  Taste of hops and citrus.  Another excellent beer from Lagunitas.
Awesome beer. Tastes like a Pliny but less filtered and more carbonated. It does have the same hop profile and similar ABV, and until they run out of it, Sucks is more readily available.
