WHAT is this majesty? A delicious offering from Lagunitas Brewing Company full of a juicy, bitter hop. Pours very cloud but clears to a nice orange amber pour. A delightful medley of oats, rye, barley and wheat. The dry hopped offering creates the most delicious resin and hop flavors, and a wondrous aromatic experience.
Remember how good this brew was a couple years ago. This years is no different! Clear, dark golden color. Big scents & flavors of sweet, citrusy hops & a balanced malt backbone. A great, solid beer.

This golden brown beer pour with a thick head. It has a sweet but hoppy citrus aroma. It has a sweet hoppy flavor also. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap @ Shakespeares Pub.  Clear amber with a tall white head.  Taste is quite hoppy, pine, citrus. Pretty enjoyable.

Lagunitas sucks pours dark gold with a thick, fluffy off-white head.  First whiff is hoppy, grassy with a strong piney grapefruit nose. There is some lacing. The flavor is hoppy, sweet citris and pine with subtle grain & malt notes, ending with a dry bitter finish. This is definitely an easy drinking IPA abundant in complex, full flavors. It makes up for the lack of Brown Shugga for sure- although, I like the Shugga better.

You think this is an ipa but then you get a plethora of flavors that you wouldn't expect from an ipa. One of the best I've had this year.  I hope this one becomes a regular from Lagunitas. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz. draft from 1808, pours slightly hazy (which clears) golden with small white head into a shaker.  Some lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and light pine aroma.  Taste is wonderful rich citrus some pine, and slightly bitter finish.  Had this back to back with sculpin.  This one wins by a little bit.  My new favorite IPA.
The flavor palate of this beer is truly different. Hints of oats and grain, with a sweetness that I cant explain, this is definitely worth trying.

Aromas of orange zest, apricot and hops. Incredibly light on the palate, offering a blast of intense stone fruit and citrus, bready yeast complexity, and a finish of well-balanced, spicy hops that linger long and cover the ABV well. Sessionable, with a never ending finish. They should probably just keep making this one....
It's all about the pine. Smells and tastes great! Light honey and mostly clear, is a delightfully bitter IPA.

bottled. pours clear dark gold, with a moderate foamy off white head. aromas of pine, spruce and hay. a crips bitterness with a touch of acidity. fairly light bodied. fizzy and bitter finish that lingers. its decent but no brown shugga.
UPDATED: FEB 25, 2013 Crazy strong nose of citrus, pine, hops, skunk. Juicy and flavorful taste, strong hop bite without sourness/bitterness. Wanted more immediately after.

Gold color and light moderately carbonated. Sweet and sticky hops. It is dry and bitter, followed by some malt sweetness and a dry, flowery aftertaste. Full of flavor, and one of the more intense IPAs I have had in some time.
This is pretty good. Very citrusy and kinda a spiciness too. Beats the hell out of their Brown Shugga, which does indeed suck.

12 oz bottle. Pours a translucent honey with a thick off-white head. Bitter, piney nose. Taste is of an IPA, but more subtle. Less feeling of a battery shocking your tongue (which isnt necessarily bad). You get the bitter in the back of your throat if you gulp it, but it slowly fades away. Good. Another winner from this wonderful brewhouse.
American strong ale slash IPA yunmy a nice blend of Delicious ness baby drabj with GT!

Great beer!  Crisp...hoppy without overall bitterness...very pleasant and clean finish.  The aroma is absolutely amazing.  Pop one open and you can smell it across the room before pouring...and the smell is one of the best Ive come across.  The piney hop smell is there...but so much more.  Its almost as great out of the bottle as on draft.  Unfortunately they made so little of this most locations were out within days.  After having it on draft in two bars in two days...it took me five places to track down a case which Im slowly enjoying while I write this and definitely coveting.  Ill tell you Lagunitas will "suck" again if they make Brown Shugga next year at the expense of another batch of "Sucks"!

Beautiful orangey-gold with a large steady white head. Complex hoppy aroma; pine, mango and citrus. Resinous hop flavor with a touch of sweet malt. Very clean flavors for a Lagunitas beer. The alcohol is there but not intrusive. Very well done.

Very damn delicious. Great golden straw pour with fair ring of white head.  Nose is pineapple. Flavor is massive resinous pine hops and mango and grass.  Very hoppy profile, but not overly bitter.  I feel like drinking this while running around saying "I am a Golden God!"

Bottle to pint (thanks jmborggren).  Looks good; a semi-transparent orange with thin off-white lacing.  Smells good too; nice pine and floral hops.  Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel.  A great example of the style.
Have all the characteristics of a brew coming out of Lagunitas. Extremely hoppy, golden body but with very little head.  Very floral, stickiness on the palate.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2016 Pours a clear amber with a brief head with continual lacing.  The aroma is huge on hops, mostly pine notes,  but some floral qualities, too.  The flavor is great.  Hoppy and bitter through and through, but a rich malt in the background and some caramel and molasses.  This is one of the best brews Ive had form Lagunitas.

Bottle from Downtown Wine. Well, here is yet another Lagunitas beer that tastes like nearly every other thing they make. Its kind of like Sierra Nevada in that they have so many beers that taste alike but are delicious. While this is very subtly different from the IPA or Maximus or Dogtown, etc, I honestly dont think I could differentiate it from Little Sumpin Sumpin.  Basically, ifs that strong dank, resinous hop bitterness all over the aroma and flavor. Finish is herbal and leaves a long lasting hop explosion on the palate.

I suppose Im slightly lucky to have found the last remaining six-pack on Super Bowl Sunday. Honestly, I dont care so much for IPAs, but this one is exemplary of the style, and not disgustingly over-hopped.
Wow! I feel pretty lucky to find a six pack. Total score. 5. Enough said.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2014 12 oz bottle served in a snifter. Pours an orange-amber color; fairly clear but with some sediment floating in the ale.  {but a fresher sample had been very clear}.  Has a small and weak head despite a rather vigorous pour.. 

Smell - I decanted the beer and was immediately hit by a powerful smell of hops ... This is no typical "winter ale". Instead, the aroma clearly indicates IPA or DIPA; and that,, of course, is what we have. Even so, the high level of pine-tinged, citrusy hop aroma is striking, and a bit formidable. but do not fear, the taste is largely tamed by the substantial multi-grain malt load.  The rich and complex flavor really is both bitter and sweet; it does lack the bite or the challenging bitterness one might expect to find in an Ameri. IPA, particularly one with this level of hop aroma.  Clearly, Lagunitas did a great job of selecting the quantity and variety of malts to go with the hops. And there are no dank or off tastes despite some earthiness in the aromatics. Higher ABV is well hidden.  Very good (Medium-light) carbonation; medium body.

Overall - superb DIPA. Powerful yet very pleasant and easy to drink. Excellent aftertaste. Well worth seeking out. Ive had the very good Brown Shugga this replaced and, as good as that is, this is better ... no apologies (even tongue in cheek) needed, Lagunitas!

12oz bottle.  Pours a sparkling copper color with large foamy white head.  Aroma is dominated by hoppiness, with mostly citrus notes.  Powerful hoppy flavor.  Smooth, slick bitter finish.  This beer is as good as the story behind it.

6 pack from Chucks 85th. Pours bright golden orange with thick white head. Aroma is tart citrusy earthy hops with underlying sweetness. Taste is sweet lighter caramel malt followed by big fresh juicy hop flavors - grassy, grapefruit, and pine notes. Finishes cleanly bitter. Lots of hype around this one... and it passes the test. This is legitimately delicious. Kind of a de-tuned Stone Enjoy by... IPA.  Easily the best Lagunitas Ive had, and thats saying something. They need to find room for this in the regular lineup.

From me, for an IPA to score this high is unprecedented.  Not a big IPA fan usually do to the fact that the big name IPAs are too tart or sour.  This IPA is perfectly balanced, giving it good grapefruit tartness, but no bitter beer face pucker at the end.  Great fruity aroma without sweetness.  Really nice break from the stouts that flood the market in winter.
Pine, citrus on both aroma and body. Solid hop backbone that hides the alcohol very well

Draft. Dank and hoppy the aroma is. The appearance is a clear burnt golden with a creamy, white head. The taste starts hoppy an stays that way through out. A little citrus twist takes place in the middle then a spiciness hits the tongue at the end. Pretty nice. Palate is bitter hoppy with a hint of the lagunitas dank. Overall, a good beer. Will prolly order again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Pours a clear golden hue with a 2 finger off white head. Good retention and lots of sticky lace. Sinus clearing citrus hop aroma featuring grapefruit. Lots of pine resin as well. Bitter/sweet flavors with the hop bitterness perfectly balanced with malty sweetness. Full bodied with resinous tongue coating. Bitter, lingering finish.

Bottle pours dark gold fair head. Smells tastes of hops heavy. Pine. Some mango maybe.  Has nice crisp bite. Spices. Sweet at first turning bitter. Its semi thin. Not bad at all lots of flavor. I can see why people like it but so much flavor I dont think Id like more then one at a time.
roasty, earthy, cereal, woody, golden, cloudy, minimal head, medium sweetness, medium body, flat, long finish,

From a 12 bottle in Super Bowl Sunday.  Pours a clear amber with a thick white head.  Citrus and floral hop aromas.  Smooth honey-like mouthfeel with light carbonation.  Flavors of orange and grapefruit zest.  Nice IPA.

Growler. Clear light amber/orange with a dense white head and some lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, pine, candied oranges and some light cereal grain. Flavor is lots of hops with a firm bitterness, mild malt and some light bubble gum. Medium body with a long, dry, bitter finish. Fantastic beer, super fresh and hoppy.
Light, hoppy, fizzy, lots of carb. Needs more body. Also needs more flavor. Meh.

Bottle. Pours orange gold with white head. Nose and taste of peach, grapefruit, perfume, caramel malt and light resin. Hops are a bit too perfumy for my liking. Finishes dryish resin and malt with some tropical fruit. Medium body.
Bottle - dark gold with a nice head. Now this was one over the top beer. Strong citrus aroma and a grapefruit hoppy taste. Full body and a smooth finish. Excellent!

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Pours a deep golden orange with a small off white head.  Aroma is of citrus hops, pine, weed, tropical fruits, sweet malts, and some rye.   Taste is of nice resinous citrus hops, pine, tropical fruits, sweet malts, sour rye malts, and some fresh cut grass.  Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, pretty bitter, yet still refreshing finish.  Overall, a well made and drinkable IPA that I wish would be available all year now.

Pours a clear golden color with minimal white head. Smells of citrus... Mostly grapefruit. Taste is sweet citrus and tropical fruits... There is a subtle rye spice in there as well that makes it interesting. Kind of a watery mouth feel and good carbonation. Similar drinkability to their Daytime IPA although the alcohol is considerably higher. Another good hoppy offering from Lagunitas.

Bottle. Pours golden with a lingering fluffy white head. Aroma is huge resinous and citrusy hops and tropical fruits. Taste opens with the hop profile but adds a prominent earthy/malty note. Very full and smooth palate. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The concept behind this is awesome!  A self deprecating beer.  Dark gold.  Thin lacing.  Very dominating hop aroma....and quite hoppy, but melts away subtly.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2013 Bottle at home. At 45 degrees, pours a deep, clear copper with a frothy head. Strong, complex aroma of pine, orange and mango. Taste is spicy, minimally bitter - beautifully balanced. Aftertaste is subtle citrus. Eminently drinkable.  Fantastic.

Pour is a hazy red-orange with a large white head.  Aroma is a spicy hop and an even spicier rye malt.  Flavor is a very nice hop resin with a nice rye spicy malt and cereal grain.  Not totally mind blowing but a very nice rye/IPA.
On tap at Alibi Room in Gastown. Wow! This is  big hop mother! Big citrus hops way up front here. Nice one!
Spicy hops.  Good amount of pine.  Some rye.  Pretty good ipa.  Probably my fav from lagunitas.

lemony citrus hops on the nose. pours a nice pale golden orange color with light off white head. slightly piney and resinous. tropical and citrus fruits taste, a little sweeter than expected but i dig it.  damn fine ipa and sessionable but watch out for that 7.85% alc

Beer looks beautiful. Lush golden yellow color with a light foam. Aroma is hop pungent. Aromas of citrus, grapefruit, honey suckle, nectar. Taste is fresh and robust. Hoppy bitterness is there and full but restrained and gracefully done. This is another of those rolling beers that sits very well on the palate. I could drink a lot of this. Kind of reminds me of a drier and fuller bodied lil sumpthin. Great beer. Cant find any faults.
Mildly hazy orange with a solid 2 cm of white head.  Aroma is perfumey citrus hops, and taste is the same and sweet, with a bit of bitter pith and some tropical fruit into the finish.  $3/12oz

I cant believe Ive waited this long to rate it. Pours a somewhat clear orange with a white lacing. Pungent orange, tangerine and other citrus notes. Initially bitter but finishes sweet. Citrus lingers on the palate. One of the best uses of Citra Ive experienced
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2013 This and DayTime really suck.  Another pine bomb affair, and cat pee. Do not like these kinds of IPAs at all.

Pale yellow, boring appearance. Big floral hop nose. HUUUUUUGE hop flavor, piney and spicy. Amazing brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear orange, white head. Smells piney, resinous, Tastes very tropical, resinous, pineapple, bitter finish. Soooo tasty! This is a really delicious ipa!
Devine intervention.  Reminds me of the hop profile from daytime.  Lots for floral notes on the nose.  Hop bomb in the middle with subtle malt backbone.  Love it

Amber color with a small, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of pine, floral hops, citrus, resin, and light caramel. Taste of citrus, pine, resin, grapefruit, light tropical fruits, toasted malts, toffee, and a bitter, hop finish.

Earthy, spicy, and citrus hop aroma. Pours a golden straw color with a low retaining white head. Hop flavor starts small but then explodes: spicy, herbal, musty, piney, and citrus. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 12/19/2012.  Pours lightly hazy golden amber color with a nice 2 finger dense and fluffy white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Nice dense foamy lacing clings on the glass.  Aromas of big grapefruit, orange zest, orange rind, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, floral, grass, light pine, and earthy hops.  Fantastic aromas with great hop complexity, balance, and strength.  Taste of big grapefruit, orange zest, orange rind, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, pine, floral, honey, grass, and herbal hop earthiness.  Good amount of piney citrus bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus zests, citrus rind, pineapple, floral, pine, grass, honey, and herbal hop earthiness on the finish for a good bit.  Fantastic hop complexity, with a nice malt balance supporting the big hops; and zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy and very smooth mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic IPA.  Great hop complexity with nice malt balance; and very smooth to sip on.  A highly enjoyable offering as expected.
Had this on draft.  It was the opposite of its name sake.  The sweetness blended well with the hops and made me wish I had a DD to drink more.  Solid beer that just became one of my more favorites.
Light gold . Good lacing. Grapefruit nose that is really nice. Some pine in nose and taste. Hop forward with nice balance. Lingering bitter finish. Nice beer

Super nice. I loved. aroma is sweet, delicious, resinous hops and malty goodness. Appearance is crystal clear, golden amber, nice head and legs. Taste is sweet, malty brew crisp and the hops slide over the tongue and linger a bit along with some earthy spice. Overall great brew get it while ya can

Awesome beer.  Hoppy but balanced by the malt. Has a sweet finish. This beer is very easy to drink. One of my favorites. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear, golden pour with a rocky, white head.  The aroma has a lot of citrus mixed with spicy rye and mildly sweet malt.  It has a light, watery texture with average carbonation.  The taste is a little bland and finishes quickly to a dry, bitter end.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2013 Bottle.  Pours a clear golden orange color with a huge bright white head that fades very slowly.  Aroma is dank hops, mostly citrus and floral.  Caramel malt comes through a bit too.  Taste is heavy for an IPA and Im enjoying it.  Fresh hops dominate, reminds me of a harvest ale.  Mostly citrus and floral.  Finish is slightly dry and a little rye spiciness comes through.  Mouthfeel is oily and fairly thick.  A tad over-carbonated.  Overall really good IPA with a couple minor flaws.

Single bottle from Total Wine. Pours a clear copper with a decent sized white head. Good retention, spotty lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, pine hops, and fresh herbs. Big citrus and pine hops in the flavor, with some malt and a bright sweetness (honey, maybe) to balance it out. Finish is nice and spicy. Fairly thick for the style. Very good.

12oz Bottle Pours out a crisp gold topped with a small white head. Aroma fresh pine needles, caramel and some grass. Taste is more of the pine, lots of sweet caramel, with a nice bitter end. This is a tasty one.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a clear medium gold with a fluffy one finger white head. Really great head retention and awesome lacing leaving a nearly unbroken wall down the side of the glass.

Aroma is full of tropical fruit as is typical with Lagunitas. Lots of pineapple, tangerine, and mango with just a hint of bready malt and alcohol underneath. Not extremely complex but the citrus is very mouth watering.

A very juicy tropical fruit character on the taste that carries for a very long time. Tons of tangerine, mango, orange, and pineapple all backed up by a little bit of alcohol and bread. Bitterness is fairly mild for a double IPA and is just enough to balance out the sweetness. Mouthfeel is really perfect without any of the residual sugar all too often found in this style.

Overall, a really amazing IIPA. Extremely drinkable it feels more like 5% abv. Love the tropical, almost minty, hop character and the moderate bitterness. Definitely one to stock up on this time of year and one of the best from Lagunitas.

Pours a bright yet darker golden with a white head.  Very appealing aroma.  Fruity and full of citrus.  Grapefruit, peach, strawberry, orange, and pine.  Taste seems to be more similar to the aroma.  The fruity elements seem to stand out the most here.  I get a lot of peach and grapefruit.  I dont get much pine, and while they there is a good amount of grapefruit, I dont get a whole lot of hops or bitterness.  Medium in body.  Good carbonation.  This is very tasty.  It would be hard not to like this.

2013 bottle. Pours gold with a big, fluffy white head. Aroma is fresh, crisp, citrus and grassy hops. Taste is very smooth, not overly bitter or sweet. Tinges of orange and bubblegum. Finishes crisp. Very drinkable.

On tap at Petrol Station.  Pours clear copper.  All sorts of grapefruit and pine hops on the nose.  Delicious mouthful of resin, as in their signature IPA style. Scrumptious.  I could drink this all day, and I probably will.  Their six packs of IPA have been off lately (at least in the Houston area), but this on-draft item is fresh and spot-on.

Pours a crystal clear light golden color with a decent sized bone white head that leaves much stickage on the way down. Smells of hops in spades. Light green onion and garlic grow confidently under a shady pine tree while sipping on a hint of vodka. Light bready malt peaks through but barely musters the courage to stick around. The flavor is light cracker and bready malts with an onslaught of onion garlic and pine. Medium to light body with a moderate level of carbonation and a slick resinous mouthfeel. This is a very nice IPA Im glad I grabbed the six pack so I can enjoy this again.
Pours a copper brown from the bottle with foamy off-white head and good lacing. Aroma of piney hops and a slight caramel malt back. Taste follows, a well balanced malty west coast IPA. Damn good.

Draft at the Khyber. Hazy amber with a big fizzy foamy head. Loads of lace. Pithy piney hops. Tangerines. Lavender. Orange seeds. Pinecones. Caramel turpentine. Red pepper. Sage. Juniper. Light brown sugar. Juicy over syrupy. Piney amber hop bite in the finish. Bitter rye at the end.
This beer pours clean with little to no head. A nice eaaant beer that should be extended past its limited release status.

A clear fizzy yellow beer.  Aroma of green onions, soft malt and a hint of rye.  Really smooth and easy drinking IPA with a lower bitterness than the 63ibu implies.  Mild citrus and pineapple notes with some malt sweetness.  Another tasty beer from Lagunitas.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2014 Bottle from Wegman?s King of Prussia - should be ultra fresh.  Pours crystal clear light copper / orange with a small white head that quickly dissipates to a small film and huge carbonation action in the glass.  The aroma is hop heaven.. a big piney flow, followed by some resin, grass, citrus is present enough to balance the attack on your nostrils.  The taste is really big bitter up front.  A real dry, punch of hop juice followed by a lingering bitterness on the tongue.  There is a spicy balance of mild citrus, light caramel, and a good bit of rye character. Fantastic.

Pours a clean deep golden copper color with a finger of sticky eggshell foam. On the nose its full of inviting fruity spicy hop notes; candied citrus, pineapple, traces of earthy pine and some sugar sweet caramel malt backbone. On the palate it follows the nose with earthy pine on the front end some nice malty caramel midpalate and a heap of fruity bitter notes to finish it off. Wow this is crushable and delicious.  Even tastes good on the burp. Great hop appeal and balanced almost to perfection....

Golden color with a lasting creamy froth. Big hop aroma with a touch of wet herb. Full nectar with soft residual effers creating a wonderful creamy texture. This brew is balanced nicely with hops fore, mid and finish bittered. Excellent sense of maltmanship. Stupendous results!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

For being a fuck up its still pretty damn good.  A light amber color full of hops and spices.  No subsitute for the suga' but a tasty brew none the less.  Little lacing and pretty white head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Pours dark golden, less then half finger off white head nice small bubble lacing that sticks around for a while. Big fresh, dank, mostly floral and pine and citrus hops, then slight hint of caramel, bready malt.  Big hop flavor up front, dank, floral, pine, citrus, mid mouth more big hop flavor, slight caramel sweetness, finish more hop, a little spicy. Medium carbonation, bit of a spicy, hoppy, alcohol bite.  Overall excellent, nice dank, fresh, resiny hops, never bitter, alcohol well hidden, try this if you are a hop head.

Draught. Pours an amber color with a moderate white head. Nose has just a hint of sweetness to it, which was unexpected, along with some good floral notes. Taste has a healthy but light bitterness to it. Very smooth drink.

Bottle.  Pours a clear amber body with a smallish beige head.  A very pleasant and pungent aroma with juicy tangerines, peaches, mangoes, pineapples, zesty citrus rinds, and pine trees at the forefront along with hints of bubblegum and apricots in the background.  Goes down relatively medium to full-bodied with just enough crispness.  Slightly smooth.  A perfect mouthfeel for the style.  The taste starts with a bit of caramel and a biscuity malt presence.  Lots of juicy tropical citrusy flavors finish off the job.  Just a tad piney/resiny.  A touch of warming alcohol throughout.  Mouthwatering and tongue tingling.  I picked up a sixer of this as kind of an afterthought (as I do most Lagunitas) and I ended up extremely surprised.  Outstanding!

Certainty doesn't suck!  This is an amazing hop bomb ipa with a fantastic aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear light copper with white head.  Dissipates quickly.  Huge aroma, almost tropical and floral at the same time.  Up front bitterness with a lingering tropical notes.  Really nice finish on this beer!

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2013 Sucks?  NOT!!  On tap at Global Brew.  Pours a beautiful clear golden with a medium white head.  Sweet citrus hop aroma.  Sweet malts and a pleasant bitterness/sourness dominate the flavor.  Really good without being overly hoppy.
Golden orange, decent sized white head. Aggressive hop aroma, mostly grapefruit, but some earthy undertones. Flavor is also hop forward, with caramel and some earthy notes. Not bad...

Amber pour with a sparse white head. A very interesting and complex pale ale.  Nutty, fruity, and only slightly bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong and intriguing brown sugar aroma with an active lite brown pour, balanced taste and lingering mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Juicy hop aromas of pineapple, peach, mango, papaya, pine, resin, and flowers.  Clear, pale orange, with a moderately lasting, white head.  Very bitter initially, but quickly bolstered by rich, sweet malts.  Medium bodied, spicy, moderate carbonation, and a lasting fruity, bitter finish.

Draft at the Dig Pub Cedar Park TX. Pours bright gold and a little hazy with a leggy white head. Nose is aromatic piney hops. Taste is the same and along the lines of a Pliny the Elder-smooth, just a bit sweet, and tingly nose. Body is full and slightly sticky. Alcohol is well hidden but slightly noticeable. Sweet beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 Aromatics - Starts off straight hoppy, I get a lot of lemongrass, grapefruit, and passion fruit.

Appearance - Looks like piss. Small head that stays.

Taste - Taste a caramalt/ crystal malt like backbone that is quickly melded with a mild dose of hops. Lot of the same flavors that I smelled with an addition of pineapple (yeasty?).....

Palate - Is medium to full and very "good feeling." Creamy & slightly fizzy (in a good way).

On tap at Fat Heads. Great fresh hop aromas, grassy, spicy, light rubber, and piney. Mild malt sweetness. Dull golden amber clear with creamy off-white lacing head. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Starts medium sweet, pale malt, light caramel. Tons of fresh spicy hops. Big bitter finish that is not overwhelming or offensively bitter. Bitter finish with sweet bitter after.

bottle. lightly hazed pale gold with a fine white head.  Pliney-esque fruit nectar hops in the nose, lightly grassy, somewhat onion-like, but not taken too far in that direction.  soft malt body, creamy carbonation, zesty, prickly hop acid washing the tongue. a bit too much cooked / caramelized corn syrup with a touch too much toffee sugar, and a bit too chewy late. but for me its a rare likable beer from these guys. wish it were around 5%.

(bottle) Pours a clear gold color with a large white head that settles to a medium cap and leaves sheets of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is very potent with scents of kumquat, powdered Tang, grapefruit, light booze, and light pine.  Aroma gets more piney and herbal as it warms.  Flavor holds some tropical fruit, like papaya, with faint mango and tangelo also appearing.  Mouthfeel is rather full and rounded while the carbonation is subdued, which leads this to be very drinkable.  The finish is fairly bitter and quite dry which leads to a nice transition from the sweet fore and mid.  Overall this is a really solid beer that I wouldnt object to drinking again.

toast, citrus, petrol, intense hop aroma, golden, amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, 

Extremly balanced but pronounced hop flavour and hop taste.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2014 Update  Draft at Capones. Pours a lightly hazy gold with frothy white head and abundant lacing. Nose of apricot, peaches, mango, grapefruit, pineapple. Delicious apricot, tropical fruit, citrus flavor. A little hint of booze on the finish and a little rye spice and cheddar as well. I could drink this all day.

Original - 1/23/13 - 8/4/8/4/15
Draft at Capones.  Poured a clean golden orange with thin off-white head and ring lacing.  Aroma is pineapple, citrus, some light caramel.  Taste is big time grape flavor, some pineapple, citrus, mild onion.  This is a really good ipa but I remember a better version last year - less boozy, more onion.

On tap at Capone's in Norristown, PA. Does a perfect beer exist? I guess it's subjective, but I will say that this may be the single best beer I have had in my (admittedly brief) time as a hardcore beer drinker, and will be the basis on which I compare all other IPAs moving forward. I expected to have this reaction to Nugget Nectar when I cracked one of them open (picked up a 6 pack so that will happen later this week), so this was an amazingly pleasant surprise.

Ar: Juicy orange, pineapple - a bit of resin and lemon.
Ap: Golden-amber, clear - medium off-white head with moderate-good retention and a thin but solid cap of lacing.
T: Bright and bitter orange up front, pineapple - medium bitterness - moss and tangerine - lightly toasty malt sweetness with an edge of toasted caramel - hoppy finish with some lingering clean bitterness .
P: Medium body with medium-high carbonation - finish is medium-dry.
O: Nice beer, really seems like a big IPA - good hop flavor, which is quite assertive, and pleasant fully malt profile.
cant believe I waited so long ( this will hold me a few weeks til Nugget Nectar & hopefully hopslam)

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 12 oz bottle from Bevmo. Pours a clear copper color with a medium white head that has fair retention. The aroma is moderate in strength with sweet oranges, tangerines and spicy grains. The flavor is a big blast of ripe hoppy citrus fruits--mostly oranges, but also some lemons--with bready malts filling in the sides and back. The palate is full and a bit oily with lively carbonation. The finish long and bitter. Overall: Top shelf

Bottle. Pours a copper color with a white head. Nose is dank hops with grass and sweet resiny notes. Palate is smooth up front with a nice bitter finish and a sticky tongue. Flavors of resiny and piney hops, golden cereal malts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from bottle at Revolution brewery.  Orange yellow with thin white head. Delicious fruit and floral aroma. Hoppy and smooth bitterness. Love this one.
On tap.  Comes orange/gold with a nice white head.  Aroma of citrus, pine, florals, and malt.  Taste is grapefruit, lemons, malt, caramel, pine, and grain.  Very hoppy, very nice!

Clear, orange-pink pout, head dissipates quickly except along the side of the glass.  Grapefruit and peach in the aroma.  Flavor is a concentration of the aroma (initial peach/grapefruit, followed by grapefruit bitterness), and crisp.
Golden pour with a white head. Aroma is fruty hops/mango. Taste is fruity hops, malty backbone, nicely balanced. Another tasty beer from Lagunitas. Leaves a pleasant aftertaste.
Draft. Orange, nice white head. Good lacing. Nose is grapefruit, orange, biscuit. Taste is citrus fruits, rye, fruity progressively bitter finish. Oily mouthfeel.

12 oz bottle.  Pours clear golden with a white head.  Aroma strong of pine resin with herbal, floral hints.  Flavor is all hops, strong on grapefruit and pine resin, floral, with the citrus taking more of a lead over time.  Relatively clean finish.  Very nice, just not sure why it isnt classed as an (I)IPA.

Light resinous hop aroma. Thick white foamy head with long retention. Tastes of grapefruit citrus and resinous hops with a caramel and toffee background. Finishes with a long bitter hoppy bitterness. Full bodied with a medium carbonation. Very good hoppy beer.

12 oz. Clear burnt orange with a lasting film of cream. Big aroma of Fruit Loops, minty green herb and resin, with some catspray. Taste starts as the same powerful blend. Mostly stays that way, but later develops some peppery rye and toasted wheat bread flavors. Light-medium body is soft and airy in the mouth, and very much to the dry side.

Lagunitas attempt to make up for the very small batch of Brown Shugga brewed in 2012 really is a success! Very nice reddish, almost orangish color, just the right amount of carbonation for me, apparent,  fresh and strong hop taste thats very enjoyable and isnt too skunky or bitter. Brewed with a mix of 4 different grain malts. This beer goes down so greatly and can be chugged if desired and not leave you feeling discomforted. One of the the best beers ive ever had!
Hoppy in a pine resin and citrus way. Maybe Im just not in the mood tonight but whatever.
On tap at beerfest Sacramento. Color is copper. Taste is slightly hoppy with a bitter. Really nice finish

Nice IPA. Balanced, but towards the bitter end of IPAs -- which I expect from Lagunitas! Nice floral and citrus notes. Is deep in flavor. Recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

got this at champanes 9.99 for the 6er. poured a nice straw with a big off white head. aroma pine, citrus, myer lemon, orange sugar, floral. flavor the orange and myer lemon blend well together, yeast, a touch of alcohol, nice bitterness. this is a good beer
Appearance is orange with and off-white head.  Hoppy, citrusy, rye aroma.  Tangy, rye, citrus, bready flavor.   Very nice.

Slightly cloudy hay colored with minimal head.  Almost looks like a light wheat beer...similarities stop there.  Nice citrus floral hop and earthy malt nose.  Full bodied palate and very well balanced IPA.  Just a touch of the rye.  Delicious.

In first pour, a clear, straw color with a pale white head. Amazing nose - citrus and passion fruit, almost like bubble gum. While mouth feel was a bit flat, overall beer was easy drinking and buried any hint of the alcohol.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of pine, resin, spicy rye and toasted cereal malts.  Golden light amber hue with an average white head that mostly diminished and left good lace.  Flavor is medium sweet and very bitter.  Palate is full bodied and oily with average carbonation.  Overall a good spicy brew.

On tap at Eddies Roadhouse. Pours a yellow golden color with a 1 finger white head. Aroma of piney hops and tropical citrus fruit. Flavor is a great balance of hop bitterness, grapefruit/pineapple sweetness and a little malt. Body was to light to medium with moderate carbonation. Overall a very drinkable beer with a great balanced flavor.
hazy pale yellow with a bit of an orange hue. Very hoppy, double-IPA type palate with a piney, resin and citrus peel aroma. Fairly lingering finish of pine. resinous, oily mouthfeel.

Pours an amazing golden amber with a small amount of head. Aroma is amazingly seductive with a lots floral tones and smaller amounts of citrus. Amazing bitter taste that persists through the finish. Theres lots of citrus and a bit of a resin near the ned  Ends with a sweet finish that really helps to complement the earlier tastes. Awesome beer got to go get it on tap!!

12oz bottle into snifter glass.  Deep amberish golden color with off-white head.  Aroma of heavy hops (tropical, citrus,grapefruit, resin).  Taste is very hoppy, nicely balanced with sweet malt backbone.  Thin-medium mouth-feel medium carbonation with sharp finish.  Very good.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2013 12 oz. bottle. Pours a tremendous, rapidly collapsing white head, with some lacing, over a clear gold (SRM 5) body....nose is heavy grapefruit, grapefruit peel, pine, resin, bit of turpentine.....taste is heavy grapefruit peel, pine, resin, light toffee/caramel, citrus sweetness, finishing with a moderate bitterness....mouth feel medium, slightly creamy, minimal astringency, alcohol hidden, carbonation makes a foamy, creamy mouthful. This is an interesting hop profile, with the citrus tones in ascendancy over the often present pine, resin. The hops were done with a deft hand as the aroma, and flavor of the hops did not lead to heavy, heavy bitterness. They were so big as to hide the rye, however. The result is a hop forward beer with light contribution from the malt backbone. It is not well balanced between the two. BJCP 8/3/13/4/7

Awesome one from Lagunitas! Snifter pour of deep gold to copper liquid with a light head. Nose is healthy hop and hearty. Deep hops and heavy. Flavor is similar, fully hopped, juicy and green. Fresh and earthy. Lotsa resin and pine. All over, this is a killer beer. Almost a double ipa.

Bottle poured amber with orange hues, medium off-white head, and notable lacing.  Huge citrus aroma emerges from the bottle followed by resin and floral hop notes and hints of tropical fruit.  Taste similarly begins with big citrus and caramel malt followed by a wave of palatable hop bitterness leading to a smooth finish.  Wonderful citrus flavors linger on the palate after each sip.  Very drinkable, well-balanced IPA that hopped near the top of my list.  Well done.

Wow what a friggen Suprise! Saw Brown Sugga somewhere on the carton, got excited and bought a sixer. This is better than brown.  Especially after the third one....... Seriously though, pours a clear rustygold, mild head. No lacing.  Nice citrus, earthy and slight dank nose. Taste of grapefruit, light malt, yeast, alcohol, the the hops kick in and build for 3-4 seconds. Nice mouthfeel, slight astringent aftertaste.  Overall one of the better ipas Ive had from lagunitas.  I need this in keg size.........

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2015 Strong Ale, my a$$... this is a IPA(2x) all the way, and a really good one. Huge mango and citrus rind notes as soon as the beer hits the side of the glass. Pours a nice clear pale orange, with an off-white head-- which doesn?t stick around as long as this beer sticks to your mouth. Smells and has a mouth-feel like its gonna be bitter beyond bitter, but its a very balanced DIPA. Big fruit and pine at the front, but has a nice little sweetness that balances everything out. Well done!**** still don?t know why this is classified as an American Strong Ale..December 2013 releaseNit sure how they did it, but I actually like this year?s version a little better. Almost perfect. Right up there with the best of the best IIPAs.

pours dark orange with a nice soapy head.  Smells of citra hops and a bit of sweetness.  The flavor of this beer reminds me a lot of Zombie Dust.  This has a bit more sweetness, but citra hops are definitely front and center here.  Great beer.

this is not an "american strong ale"... its labelled as a "substitute" for brown shugga, but it has absolutely nothing to do with that brew. its basically another 8% ipa beverage from lagunitas.  its not as good as maximus when maximus is good... but when has maximus been any good lately?  the emphasis on aroma in ratebeers scoring system drags the overall score down, the actual overall score should be closer to 3.7 or 3.8... if youre lucky enough to see this around grab a six pack or two.

2013 bottle. Pours a clear light yellow with thin white head. Fantastic sweet aroma: tropical fruit and flowery. Sweet bready malt base with strong hop presence without too much bitterness. A great American ale.

---Rated whilst imbibing

Bottle - small foamy head, light copper color, nice big citrus grapefruit hop aroma and flavor, mild malt backbone - very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a clear golden color with plenty of bubbles and a big, frothy white head. Aroma is mango, spruce, floral, bubblegum, citrus, and herbs. Taste is mango, pine, lemon grass, bitter with a long bitter finish.

Big grapefruit and hop aroma.  Pours a pale light yellow, with just a dusting of white head.  This is a big hop bomb, with grapefruit and pine notes.  Not much else going on, but this is a fine hop bomb.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2013 Pours a crystal clear gold with a frothy white head. Smells very sweet, predominantly of candied grapefruit peel, tangerine, and honey - solid bready malt backbone. Tastes bitter and sweet (ha) and similar to the nose, more honey and some lemon. Medium bodied, kind of chewy and sticky, with a bit too much carbonation. Overall good but not great - very sweet. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pine, citrus, tropical fruit and sweet caramel. A bit Weak in the middle. Dry finish with a lingering bitterness. Tasty.

strong inviting aroma, good cloudy appearance, great IPA flavor without being overwhelming, notes are complimentary to the IPA style

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz draft poured at When Pigs Fly Pizzeria. Beautiful amber color with a thin white head. Looks really clean & clear. Immediate hit of citrusy hops. Totally reminiscent of a double ipa, this packs a delicious punch and is thick on the tongue. Floral & grapefruit hoppiness stick around for a while. Great bitterness! Best beer Ive had all day!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap from a cask in Vegas.  Thatll alter this rating in the positive direction a bit - but this is an awesome beer.

The aroma is tropical...pineapple, papaya...yes! Taste is hops hops and more hops! Yummm...but with a nice malt profile holding things in check. Nice balance. Sorry I only bought one of these.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Appearance: clear golden with quickly dissipating white head. Aroma: floral, piney, grassy and citrus hop bomb with sweet sugary and bready malt. Beautiful!  Taste: floral hops and pineapple throughout with just a little sweet breadiness but nothing as strong as the aroma, ends slightly peppery with piney, grassy bitterness. Mouthfeel: Thin to medium body with medium to high carbonation. Overall this beer is so freaking delicious. It's a perfectly hopped brew with a perfectly balancing complex malt profile. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle Whole Foods.  Light golden; smaller white frothy head dissipates to a very sparse covering with a medium ring; light lacing.  Aroma pineapple, pine, tropical fruit, bread, caramel.  Flavor has less of the tropical fruit than I expected and exhibits more pine and bread as is more typical of the style (and, sorry Ratebeer, but this is an IPA, not an American strong), but there is definitely a pineapple vibe throughout; piney bitter finish is really well balanced, as 60+ IBUs is nothing to scoff at but its certainly not out of place in here.  Medium body, frothy carbonation, barely sticky.  Ill take Brown Shugga over this any day but thats just personal preference, I suppose.  Definitely bears resemblance to Lagunitas Daytime with the pineapple aroma, just much bigger.  Good stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2013 New review - see below for old one. Clear orange, lots of foam but no lacing once it dissipates. Sprucey resin aroma. Strongly bitter flavor with the same resinous character and a touch of citrus. Bit of an unpleasant chemical aftertaste. Much much better than my first bottle. Clearly there was something wrong with that one.

Old review starts here: Bottle. Cloudy orange, no head or lacing. Cat piss aroma with some citrus and Christmas-tree pine. Very bitter, a bit of skunk-like flavor, acrid in its sharpness on the palate. I love very hoppy beers but this is just foul. Vile. I can?t fathom how anyone could like this beer. Lagunitas sucks indeed.

Bottle poured a clear tarnished gold with a lasting ivory head. Aromas of straw, skunk bud, pink grapefruit, pine and tangerine. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of strawe, pine resin, grapefruit and light tangerine with a smooth dry moderatly bitter lingering pine finish.
Hops on Hops! Resin,floral abound! Major after taste.Dry hops.Overall a great IPA!

Somewhat hazy golden pour. Thick white head with lots of lacing. Aroma is mostly hop. Spicy, floral, somewhat dank. Not a lot of malt in the aroma. Hop forward flavor as well, but more balanced than the aroma. Dry finish. 

---Rated via iPhone
Aroma is mango, pineapple, and hop resin. Appearance is bright orange with a fluffy white head. Taste follows aroma but adds a bite of rye spiciness. Excellent brew.

12oz bottle from Belmont Station. Purchased good and fresh.

A: Straw coloration drifting into orange. Clear with a good refraction through the glass. Fluffy almost white head. Aces. 

N: Fever for the hops. Pine and earth are dominant with the pineapple and mango playing back up. Its a deep full scent with that cracking, sweet nature I always attribute to a well done dry hopping. A deeper inhalation yields some clementine and passionfruit.

T: A taste that can only be referred to as dank. (Need to jazz that description up a bit.) Pine needles and evergreen forest floors. Bites and stings with lupulins. (Lupulins are sedatives. I will sleep well tonight.) Needs more citrus, though. 

M: Scraping and filling. Alcohols second string.

O: This beer makes me verbose and lyrical. (Or pretentious? I dont think Lagunitas has that aim, though.) This is an all star beer that I buy every time it comes out, which, now shouldnt be a problem with the expansion in place. Lagunitas sucks, indeed.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow giant foamy head. Aroma of floral hops. Taste is citrus grass crisp and clean finish. Drinks like a IPA.

Last time I had one of these it had sat too long and was not as good as I remembered. Man I'm glad they brought this to west michigan this year. Very clear straw/faint orange pour with a few inches of bright white head. Strong delicious juicy citrus hop aroma, grapefruit and orange, and resinous pine tar. Light mouth feel with surprisingly low carbonation.  Tastes like hoppy fresh orange juice. Finish is wet and only slightly bitter, not overdone at all. I prefer this over brown shugga any day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle.  Pours slightly hazy golden orange with a big fluffy white head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is some bready malts and a little sweet fruit with a ton of piney, resiny and slightly dank hops.

The flavor is sweet watery / washed out malts with a good sized piney, dank and tropical fruity hop bitterness (not as much as expected from the nose though).  The mouthfeel is medium bodied with low carbonation and a bit watery.

Overall, a very fine resiny, dank, fruity IPA - a little watery though.
Golden color. Slightly cloudy. Very floral and fruity hop forward aroma. Medium body. Clean flavor with noticable bitternes. Long lasting fruit hop flavor in the finish.

In appearance its quite golden in color, almost dark orange, with a frothy, bright-white head and steady, healthy carbonation that provides some great head retention.  The lacing is solid, sticky, and continuous.  The aroma is mostly of wet-like hops, fresh, green, and minty, with a sweet, grainy, and lightly caramelized malt profile making for a very attractive nose.  The flavor is an accurate representation of the aroma, with fresh, minty hops decorating a somewhat light-bodied, grainy beer with just enough caramel malt residual sweetness to give it a suppleness to counter-balance the minty, green hops.  It finishes with a lingering, fresh hop greenness thats more flavorful than bitter.Although its no Brown Shugga, its really great beer and almost tastes like the holidays.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2014 Pours a pale gold with healthy off white head that lasts forever and leaves amazing lacing.  Aroma is loaded with juicy, fleshy, citrusy hops, also with some pine.  Taste is grapefruit, tropical fruit, sweet caramel malts with an ideal bitterness.  Palate is medium bodied, super smooth, above average carbonation.  Overall everything works well together.  Rich and juicy.  

Pours golden orange with average-sized head that dissipates into a thin film.  Aroma is so good, with mango, pineapple, and hop resin.  Taste is more tropical fruits, piney hops, remaining very sweet into a mild bitterness and mild bready aftertaste.  Palate is medium-bodied with a healthy amount of carbonation.  Overall, very well done.   9+4+8+4+15=4.0

12 oz. Bottle. Pours a very slightly cloudy orange-copper with a two fingers of rocky white head. Good retention and lots of lacing. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, slight pine, hop resin. Flavor is hoppy up front, fading into creamy citrus tones, slight pine and herbal in the finish. Moderate carbonation, medium body, and a smooth, slightly oily texture. Very smooth, nice citrus hop profile, very good. Lagunitas rocks.

Poured from a 12oz bottle.  Pours deep golden copper with about a finger tip of head. Aroma of grapefruit pine resin and dish soap.  Tastes of grapefruit wild flowers and pine. Clean and relativity dry finish.  Drinks much more like a pale ale than a strong ale, regardless the category this is overall a great beer and its tough calling this sucks.

12 oz pours light copper, good head. Smells of pinapple, papaya, mango, and slight hay grain. Tastes like pineapple, citrus, flowers, slight bubblegum and boozy aftertaste. Wonderful hoppy balanced malty complexity.

Translucent bright golden pour with a thick white head. Resin, floral, and spruce along with cereal malt and citrus undertones. Crisp, light-bodied, lively carbonation, clean bitter finish. Would want a higher abv to call this an American Strong Ale, closer to an IPA

Bottle. Pours a clear golden-orange with a thin white head, excellent retention and decent lacing.  Nose is resinous hops with a bit of dankness and some tropical fruit notes (mainly guava). Mouth is medium bodies and typical of LBCs hop-forwardness profiles: pine, citrus, tropical fruit. Some candy notes on the middle, and a faint but lingering bitterness on the backend with some bready notes.  Out-fucking-standing! Who says the holidays are over?

On tap at the abbey. Pours orange with a frothy head. Aroma is super sweet and fruity. Flavor is grape tangy candy, amaze sweet tang. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
my favorite lagunitas beer right now hands down hoppy beer besides hopstupid. cheers

Bottle. This American Strong Ale skirts the line nicely between IPA and DIPA. Pours hazy butterscotch with a medium white head and nice lacing. Aroma is quite nice grapefruit, tropical fruits, and pine resin. Flavor is the same, lightly sweet with a light to medium bitterness. Not really picking anything up from the cereal medley, but what the hey. Medium body, oily mouthfeel. Nice beer.

growler from consumers beverages buffalo. shared by jsprime. huge freuity hop nose, mango, pineapple, grapefruit. the flavour is also hugely fruity hop. bitterness ismoderateto low for the style, which is IPA IMO. great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2014 12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy, golden color with a white head and sticky lacing.  Smells awesome!  Strong notes of citrus fruit, tangerine and perhaps mango as well as a powerful pine and floral aroma.  Smooth and creamy with a bitter but well balanced hoppy, fresh taste.  Nice long finish.  A really great strong ale/IPA.  Lagunitas most definitely does not suck! 9,4,8,4,15 4.0Update:  12 oz bottle from Evergreen Discount into a pint glass.  Gold and clear with a white head and sticky lacing.  Nice aroma of tropical/citrus fruits, pine, floral, fresh hops, toasted malts and light caramel.  Similar flavor, fresh, bitter, lightly sweet and lightly fruity.  Medium body with a dry feel and a lingering finish.  9,4,8,4,16 4.1

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2013 Bottle at home. Appearance is golden orange with a big white head and great lacing. Huge grapefruity, citrusy, resinous, ganja aroma, with light notes of caramel and biscuit. Taste is super dank, sweet caramel, grapefruit, orange peel, grass, pine, weed, and floral with a big bitter finish. Sticky mouthfeel with high carbonation. Great IPA, but not quite on Brown Shuggas level; nice stuff regardless.

Type: Draft 
Glass: Mason jar    
From: Ciros Pizza  
Price: $6.50  
Misc.: As part of Lagunitas Tap Takeover Night at Ciros Pizza; Got to keep the Lagunitas mason jar

Poured a golden orange color with one finger of white head when I got it. Good circular lacing on the sides all the way down. Average-to-above average retention on the top.

Holy bitter hops on the nose! Got healthy doses of pine, citrus (grapefruit, lemon) and floral hops. Also some resin. Very flavorful, definitely the best part of the beer.

Tasted bitter grapefruit hops right from the beginning, but not too lingering. Sweet floral taste as well. Also orange pulp. Reminded me a lot of the Daytime IPA. 

Light body. Oily texture. Average carbonation. Bitter finish.

I really, really liked this beer. Nice and smooth and would love to have it again. Well done Lagunitas.

Appearance was clear orangish gold with diminishing creamy white 1 finger head, rings of lacing. Aromas are mango, orange, lemon then sweet pale malts. Taste are citrus fruits of grapefruit, mango, lemon and orange, then sweet pale, caramel malts and hints of pine. Palate are smooth creamy CO2 with meduim body, then citrusy piney paleish lasting finish. A great citrusy ipa.

On tap 4 oz. pour at Lost Dog Cafe in McLean, VA.

Clear-but so dark it is almost opaque--burgundy-brown with small khaki head and fair lacing.  Head does not linger.

Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, toffee and dark fruit.

Taste of dark fruit, cherry, sweet roasted malt, toffee and alcohol. 

Full body and medium/high carbonation with foamy mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle---> snifter.  Pours a clear gold with a thick, fluffy white two finger head.  Smells like a sack of some of the dankest weed available.  Tastes of mango, pineapple, grass, and resin.  Nice medium bodied palate with good carbonation.  This is a fucking awesome beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear light gold with a modest head and great lacing. Aroma is amazing - pine & citrus, very pungent. Sweet, lightly spicy flavour gives way to enormous hop punch towards the end, with a lingering hop finish. Light pine, very present bitter orange - chinotto, perhaps. Moderate body with good carbonation. What a treat!

I was licky to find this in the M&M 6-pack rack of my favorite store today.  This is the 1st beer purchased that way that made me wake up and say WOW.  Lagunitas does not need to make any excuses for this one, which tastes very similar to my favorite APAs, Three Floyds Alpha King and Zombie Dust.  12 oz botttle pours a clear orange with white head and good lacing.  Aroma is full of citrus, and floral hops with just enough caramel malts to give it balance.  Taste is initially sweet with a short bitter finish. Medium body with a little carbonation.  If I could get this year round, I would drink it regularly

Hazy gold pour - thick, lasting, soapy lace - a lot of pine/resin and tropical hop notes in the nose, citrus rind - moderate acidic and sweetness in equal measure - fairly creamy texture - medium sweet up front, with a mix of wheat, toasted grain and light rye flavors - earthy citrus and pine late, some pepper, medium bitterness - a little sweet, but nice texture and bitterness, with high drinkablility - pretty nice, but I dont feel the love that others have.

Floral and citrus notes. Easily drinkable for a high IBU/ABV beer. Good beer overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft.  Medium-off-white head that leaves nice lacing atop clear light amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some catty, orange.  Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit/orange, some catty/pine, light bread.  Medium body, some acidity, light resin.

12 ounce bottle purchased from the Davis Beer Shoppe.  2012/13 Vintage.  The aroma on this is hoppy as hell, with significant mango, grapefruit, orange, and other citrus goodies.  A bit reminiscent of a fresh Sculpin.  Light dank.  Super hoppy, and super aromatic.  Mildly hazy orange-colored body with a medium, creamy off-yellow head.  Good retention.  Starts with some significant danky and citrus hop flavors.  More mango in this comes through in the middle.  The malts are lightly sweet, but there enough to balance the hops out.  I definitely do not detect any rye, oats, or wheat here.  They must be used in pretty small portions.  Finishes with more citrus hoppiness (huge mango!), and a moderate hop bitterness.  I dont know why this is classified as an ASA...its clearly an IIPA, a damn good one at that.

12oz bottle from Binnys-Des Plaines. Pours clear golden orange with a white head. Aromas of loads of perfumey hops, mango, pineapple, bright citrus, and a little malt. Flavors of clean bright orange citrus, mango, peaches, and good dose of bitter hops. Has a decent enough malt profile to keep it honest. This is my favorite type of hop profile where the malt profile is on the lighter cleaner side, but the there is a large hop flavor  without an overwhelming bitterness. Hard to not like this.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 Drank in pilsner glass from 12 oz bottle. Aroma- lovely citrus and dry hoppiness scents. Appearance- very appealing golden ale color..yelling drink me. Taste- the perfect blend or lemon and hoppiness. Could classify as IPA by tatse. Love it. Palate- spectacular moutfeel. Light acidic and hops. Overall- one of my favorite beers. So smooth and flavorful. Very drinkable

Now a year round beer, we can erase the Holiday Ale part!  Appearance is a dark golden color with a nice 1 finger white head. On the nose you get hit hard with lemon and grapefruit followed by some earthy/grass notes. On the palate there is a nice citrus taste followed by some grass and hay and finishing with the nice hop bite, nothing too over powering. Mouthfeel is light with mellow carbonation. I believe the aroma is what makes this beer so satisfying to many.
Draft; clear pale orange with small off-white head; aroma-grapefruit, lemon, rasberry, sweet; taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter. Great beee
Major hops: lemon and resin. But very smooth. Sticky feel. Best IPA (borders on imperial) yet from Lagunitas; shame its limited.

A: This is the best smelling IPA I have ever happened upon. Heavy citrus, tropical fruit, and some catty undertones. Malt takes a complete backseat.

A: Pretty average looking IPA; miniscule head and only moderate lacing. However, lastnight I saw this leave a ridiculous amount of lacing on another glass, so maybe I poured it wrong or the glass is different.

T: Heavily hop forward. A lot of tropical fruit and citrus as well as some cattiness/skunkiness. Good stuff!

P: Creamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. This aspect showcases the malt presence of this beer--truly a spectacular convergence of malt body and hop aggresiveness.

O: This is porbably the most unique IPA I have had in a long time; however, it showcases a completely different side of the hop spectrum.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2012 Bottle. Pours clear golden with moderate white head. Aroma is super piney with notes of citrus and tropical fruit and a hint of funk. Flavors of pine with notes of fresh cut grass. Light to medium body with bitter finish. Very good.

Fresh 2012 bottling. Delicious. Big, balanced, complex aromas and flavors of stonefruit, peach, mango, pine, skunky onion, florals and mild citrus. Wonderful, mildly bitter, lemon rind, ruby red grapefruit, citrus notes linger on the palate. Refreshing, yet full-bodied. Reminiscent of a DIPA and definitely hoppy, as the malt takes a backseat to the hops at this time. Tastes very fresh... as a new batch should. Dare I compare it to Stone Enjoy by 12.21.12... A good brew, which I wish was year-round. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Lagunitas Sucks pours a cloudy yellow-amber with a one-finger white head.  Scent is tropical: tons of peaches and mangoes, as well as earthy, citrus hops.  Taste is lemon and red grapefruit with a cereal malt backbone.  Very well balanced.  Palate is medium, with a creamy texture and lively carbonation.  Overall a great offering from Lagunitas that should be year-round.  
Bottled 12/17/12.   Rated 12/22/12

2011 Bottle: Pours a cloudy copperish orange with a small off-white head that diminishes rather quickly. Hoppy aroma is citrus with hints of pine. Sweet flavor is full of tropical fruit with a mild piney bitterness in the finish. Very delicious and refreshing!

An orange appearance with an off white head. Aroma contains tons of perfume and citrus. Flavor is very bitter but has a malty presence. Orange peels and lemons dominate the flavor. A bit of alcohol is showing in the aftertaste. Overall this does not suck.

12oz bottle (courtesy of Headbanger) poured into a Snifter at 40°.  Color is nice golden with a slight haze and good carbonation that produces a soft tight head.  Aroma is rich, sweet and hoppy.  Medium body with a light crisp mouth feel.  Flavor is citrus with a touch of pine then tropical fruit comes in leaning on pineapple and end with some toffee.  After taste is dry with a mild bitterness and a bit of grapefruit.  Overall its a great brew extremely complex and well balanced.  Thanks Larry.

Bottle shared by jayhawk73. Thanks Jeff.

The beer is clear and light orange hued with an inch of white head that coats the glass with lacing. Lasting head retention. A superb appearance.

The aroma is fabulous! Fresh hops. A bouquet of tropical fruits, including oranges, mango, pineapple. 

Wow, the taste follows suit. Utterly delicious. By far the best beer I have had from Lagunitas. A bit sweet from the onset - my only minor complaint about this beer. Alcohol and malt are afterthoughts. This beer is a showcase for hops. 

Ridiculously smooth and easy drinking. 

This beer shocked me to my core. A world class DIPA that wasnt even on my radar. At $10 per sixer, this is an absolute must try if you enjoy hop forward beers.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-04-2011
From iphone beerlicious app: great aroma.  Pale clear liquid.  Frothy white head.  Nice bitterness.  Light thin body.

Deep golden color with a thin off white head.  LIght sweet nose.  Warming alcohol, brown sugar on toast and some caramel apple notes.  Strong hop resin taste with the accompanying burn on the tongue.  It was very nice last Christmas and it held up well in the closet.

Remember back in the day when you would fall down the basement stairs drunk as shit at 4AM and be 100% convinced that you never woke your parents? Well, I just fell down the stairs and once again I am 100% convinced that they never heard because they live 30km away - still got the magic!
I feel great knowing that I pretty much bought the entire city supply and drank it all to myself - E-town crew loves me for this and so do I. Drink 72 beers and barely saved one for review because it was so god damn good. Make that 2 - I just drank the last surviving bottle on Earth that I left hanging around for my own funny time reminder. And yea, it still was AWESOME. So awesome. Rare beer does taste better! LOL. Rating goes back to early December 2011 and its just short notes as it was pretty much impossible to review this as it was just pure joy to drink it... even as I drained the entire citys supply solo. tung: Piles of citrus  - citrus that tears apart my mind on every freaking sip - oranges, rrgf, pine, grapefruit rind, cherry, floral greatness remeniscent ... how the hell is that spelt? - of fresh cut flowers, slight grain, honey, apricot, secretions of only the most heavenly of creatures, tropical fruits and soft malts. This beer has absolutely everything I want to smell. Hours... hours have been spent smelling this brewed treasure. Tasty bits: Aside from the outlandish amount of hops and citrus, sweetness and thickness there is a fuckload of malt backing this monster. Sweetness abounds. Pineapple flops around, pine goodness, peaches, lemon, mild caramel, something that might be spearmint, grapefruit, unique malt base darker than it normally is, orange, pepper, resin, light dose of brown sugar for the sweet base, aaaaaa soooo good! medium body that is supported both by the hop thickness and the healthy structure of yummo malts. Perfection.  Find me another ASA that beats this and I will marry your daughter that resembles an ugly donkey.

12 oz. bottle served in a Bells Tulip.

A: Pours a clear peach with some straw colored hues around the edges. A 1 finger white head forms on the pour and subsides to a nice ring. Nice sheets of lace are left down the glass.

S: Bursts of citrus and sweet fruits. Grapefruit, apple and mango are some of the great smells coming out. A very slight pine is on the backend.

T: The citrus just pops in your mouth. Grapefruit and orange citrus with a faint hint of sweet mango. Some light biscuit malts show themselves as well. The finish is a slight bitter pine.

M: Lively mouth with great carbonation. Light to medium bodied with a subtle sticky feel to it. Highly drinkable.

O: Just like everyone else, I was shocked and pleasantly surprised by this guy. The citrus bursts in your mouth and the malts and slight pine bitterness really balance it out. The drinkability is off the charts.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-04-2011
Drinking a bottle that was released almost a year ago and its still amazing.  It has however, lost the peach taste and aroma that I remember.

A: Pours a semi hazy amber color with a frothy/creamy white cap. Retention is excellent.

S: Wow, did not expect this! The aroma is mostly citrus, tropical fruit (pineapple, maybe mango), and sweetish. Kind of similar to Sculpin to me. Very impressive and nicely balanced.

T: Hop bomb...pineapple, grapefuit, mango, orange. There is a sweetness that balances the bitterness of the hops and strikes a real nice balance. This is the best beer that is widely available by far.

MF/D: Medium body (thought this was a single IPA at first), semi-aggressive carbonation, and a clean citrus finish.

Notes: Sorry Brown Shugga, move over for your replacement

Forgot to input this a while back...
Pours a clear orange/copper color with decent hops initially. Some good fruit hints in there with a strong finish. Surprised this is considered a strong ale, but regardless a beer I like very much

Poured orange/amber into a tulip. Nice 1/2 inch of foam. Dissipates to a film with a thick ring. Minimal lacing.

Smell is orangey hops.

Taste is citrus at the front, some malt and a mildly bitter finish.

Palate fairly light with good carbonation.

Overall a good beer. Nice hop aroma but the taste is lacking. Maybe my bottle is past its prime?

Draught at Alibi Room, VancouverHazy light amber color, creamy head. The aroma is an explosion of fruity hops. Sweetish toffee flavor, with strong fruity hopping, but unfortunately also a light soapy touch; strong bitterness; alcohol warmth. Good.
Taken from old notes. Fruity nose with grapefruit and others. Nice sweet/bitter taste that finishes mildly bitter.

Sampled June 2012<br
A steady pour produces a two-finger thick, pale tan colored head that leaves lots of layered lacing on the sides of my New Belgium Globe glass. The beer is a nice copper color that shows a brilliantly clear, bright copper-gold hue when held up to the light. The nose smells vibrantly hoppy with huge notes of lychee, perhaps a touch of guava, big kumquat zest aromatics, bright super ripe tangelo, as well as a much softer, but still quite present backdrop of pine, dankly herbaceous notes, and perhaps a touch of woody notes. This is the type of IPA I could just sit and smell forever.

Bitingly, bracingly, expressively bitter from the beginning through the end of my first sip; there is also a huge hop fruit character that is a mix of tangelo and kumquat zest, as well as a huge lychee character and hugely floral, tropical fruit notes. The biting bitterness is accentuated by a noticeable, though supporting herbal hop character that suggests of menthol, dank hemp oil, and pine. The fruitiness in the hops really accentuates a soft sweetness in this otherwise fairly dry beer; the finish is especially dry and clean, this drinks quite light and quaffable, though it does have enough of a body to stand up to the hop onslaught. There is a fair amount of prickly carbonation, perhaps a hint too much even. The malt character is barely noticeable, but does suggest at notes of crackers and perhaps a touch of English biscuit character in the finish.

I am quite happy that this beer is still hugely hoppy. I had a chance to taste this fresh this past winter, but never got around to procuring some bottles for a proper review: the aroma of this is still incredible, and is exactly what I like in an expressive IPA (Fruit focused with a solid herbaceous backdrop to balance things out). The flavor also does not disappoint and is much the same as the aroma. A beer for the hop head; I am thoroughly enjoying this. This still taste ridiculously fresh, though it has likely been stored cold since being released.

Bottle: Poured a deep amber color ale with a large off-white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of citrus and pine hoppy notes with light caramelized sugar notes. Taste is also a good mix between some caramelized sugar notes with a heavy dose of citrus and piney hops. Body is quite full with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Lagunitas is master in brewing this type of beer and this one doesnt disappoint.

Had on tap at mellow mushroom Tampa. Pale gold in appearance one finger head disapates to a ring of foam, great lacing. Aroma of intense citrus hops. Taste follows the nose, grapefruit, pineapple bitter with decent malt backbone. Really tasty, a great surprise from a brewery that hasnt impressed me in the past.

Bottle 355 ml  
Aroma very nice , soft spic , citrus, creamy nose, orange peel, caramel and lemon grass. 7+.
 Appearance  clear amber with plus sized white cap. Good contrast. 4-
Flavor and Palate : Medium bodied. Straight clean caramel malt bottom with equally balancing herbal-leafy hop. Clean sweet sided finish. Simple feel with solid approach.
big hoppy heady. Piney, citrusy big all the way. Excellent backbone. Dry. This is what American strong ale should all want to be
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2013 Pours a light tan without too much head. Strong smell of citrus and hops. Taste is hoppy and piney. Like the self depricating name! Very tasty.

355ml bottle. Aroma is sugary sweetness and pine and grapefruit hops. Pours a orangish gold with a small foamy head that went away, then the very active carbonation regenerated tighter, creamy head. Never saw that before. Taste is creamy and spicy with some clear dry hopped notes on the finish. Body is creamy and smooth, but a little light. Overall, rather tasty and unique. Thumbs way up.

In short: A superior blonde bitter IPA of high intensity
How: Bottle 12oz.  Consumed relatively fresh two months after the beer release.
The look: Clear blonde body topped by a small white head
In long: Nose encompasses almost all that is American hops with a grapefruits and other citrusy fruits, pine-tree, tropical fruits and fresh grass.  Taste has honeyed bready malts, pale crackers, kiwis, bitter grapefruits, pineapples, grass, more Bitterness is sharp and the bitterness intensity is in the medium-high range.  Relatively dry after-taste.  Balance is clearly toward the hops bitterness, the crisp crackery malts dont offer much of an opposition.  To me this is definitely a Double IIPA and not an American Strong Ale as currently classified on ratebeer.  Not sure who decided on the beer style, I guess what we have here is failure to communicate, wait, hold on, no, sorry, its my cat, I didnt recognize it at first because Im drunk and have a blurry vision.  What we have here is my cat.

Pours a gold yellow with thick white head, minimal lacing.  Aroma is of floral and herbal hops, resin, bread, and a earthy character.  Flavor matches well and is similar to a strong malt backbone pale ale, but with a lot of complexity.  Very solid and surprisingly different.
BOTTLE: Pour is golden. Aroma of  rye, earth and citrus. Taste of rye, earth, citrus, and maybe even flowers.

Poured into a pint glass

A - Fabulous filtered gold/orange color. White head that leaves light levels of lacing as its consumed. 

S - Pine and citrusy west-coast hops, awesome nose on this thing.

T - Pine, Grapefruit, pine, and bitter hops. Very good beer, ive gone through 18 bottles of this stuff.

M - Mild carbonation and well balanced finish.

O - One of the best double IPAs ive had in a long time. Unfortunately, this came out right around the time as Surly Abrasive ale. I was overloaded on IPAs for a month. While i prefer Abrasive over this, its still one of the better beers ive had lately. Lagunitas hit a home run with this brew.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-27-2012 21:43:01
dark gold, aroma of grapefruit and other citrus fruits, caramel, flavors of citrus/tropical fruits, caramel, biscuit, sweet malt, slight dry finish, great balance, great beer

On tap at Dexters in Madison, WI, pours a clear dark golden with a white frothy head and lacing through out the entire glass, the aroma has a huge citrus amount with some pine, the flavor has a good balance between the hops and the malt, very nice mouthfeel, good stuff here.
It poured a golden color with a white head. The aroma was grapefruit hops and light malt. The taste was well balanced with a grapefruit hop bitterness. A very good Holiday Ale.

Bottle @ Dans house. Thanks Armin! Clear, orange appearance with an off white head. Dull grapefruity, earthy hoppy, dull bready aroma. Tangy, orange citrusy, bready, toasty flavor. Not bad but need to try one fresh.
Slightly malty,citrusy aroma. Same with the favors, but weaker. This is a few months old, so Im not surprised.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2013 Pour out of bottle, thanks Caleb! Yellow-orange pour with thin to no head, big mango and pineapple, passionfruit notes, some sweet orange and some nice caramel, biscuity notes.  Taste is a nice mix of lemon and pineapple, caramel, slight orange notes, hints of biscuit, finish fairly sweet and slightly dry.  Would love to try this again next year fresh!
Golden orange color with thin white head. Pleasant grapefruit butterscotch aroma. Really unique tangy and citrusy clementine flavor with a monster sweet hoppy and buttery finish.

Bottled.  Poured bright golden with a short-lived white head.  The aroma picked up juicy mango, grapefruit, and floral hoppage over sweet honey and lesser bready notes.. this wasnt the freshest bottle, so the hops werent as brilliant as they used to be.  The flavor found honey, bready notes, and lighter fruit at the core.. mixed citrus and grassy bitterness around.. a little sharp on the finish.. OK, but again not super-fresh.  Medium-bodied and a bit sharp and bitter on the palate.. OK feel and flow.. Id drink it again (and will re-rate if I get a super fresh one).
I wish they made this year round. Quit apologizing, its better than Brown Shugga!

A - Pours a clear golden-orange color with a finger of frothy white head atop. The head fades down at a normal pace leaving behind some lace.

S - Aroma is full of citrus hops and candied pineapple, grapefruit, and mango, some floral hops, and some sweet caramel malts.

T - Starts off with a strong kick of grapefruit and pineapple hops with some good bitterness and a bit of sweet caramel malts growing from the background. Through the middle, some pine and floral hops come through with some more citrus flavor and bitterness. The finish is a mix of sweet candied tropical and citrus fruits, bitterness, grassy hops, and some sweet malt.

M - Medium bbodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a resiny and fairly dry finish.

D - Very drinkable. Nice big hoppy DIPA with a great hop profile. I really like how strong the candied tropical fruits are.

From notes.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a tulip.

The pour is a mostly transparent, full golden yellow color with straw edges.  A regal off white froth bellows up from the beer upon pouring.  Levels of lace remain where the beer rested during my glass.  

The biggest compliment I can pay to the complexity of this beer is that it seems nearly impossible to identify all of the aromas and flavors, so I am reduced to using general descriptors to do the best I can.  The aroma has a spicy pine hop base, with a nice amount of grapefruit, apricot, and tangerine as well.  As the sweetness comes through, I get some light pale malts, honey, and some caramel.  

The flavor blend nicely together and roll in complexity.  Up front, biscuity bread and honey, some light caramel notes, and then a nice wave of hops that never goes off the bitter end.  Spicy pine, grapefruit, lemon zest, apricot, and assorted other citrus notes roll on the tongue as the sip concludes.

The hops are strong, but not totally overwhelming.  The oil residue mostly clears away from the mouth after each sip, and the hoppy flavor and crisp carbonation mean it scrubs the tongue clean after sip.  The overall feel is simple, clean, crisp, and refreshing.

Not an absolute hop bomb, but this was quite enjoyable.

Location: 12 oz bottle from jcos, 3/14/12


Aroma: The nose is juicy hops (pineapple, grapefruit, orange) and some pine as well

Appearance: It pours a clear orange color with a nice white head and mid-heavy lacing

Flavor: Tastes medium-heavy sweet and juicy, with the hop bitterness coming though in the finish

Palate: The body is medium-plus, it has a clean, creamy, and smooth feel, and a fairly dry finish

Overall Impression: 
This one is pretty tasty.  I like the juicy hop presence, it gives a nice sweetness, and the later hop bitterness provides a nice balance as well.  Another very solid offering from Lagunitas.

Huge tangerine aroma...hops hops hops...but not too bitter. Really enjoying what sems to be citra-hop with a nice malt backbone. Really much like a fruit-filled DIPA, and extremely enjoyable to drink. The hop/flavor intensity reminds me of Monks Indiscretion and Bigfoot. Mouth feel is medium and the head retention is great. Even with a giant head, the hop aroma blasts you in the face. Tasted from the bottle @ 51F.
